story:
Why Hair?...

Hi, my name is Pyeng Threadgill (pronounced Py-ying) and I am a vocalist and songwriter, performing and coaching in New York. I have been singing and performing since the age of 3 or 4 and I have always always been in love with words and music.

For the past several years I have been writing and researching to create a new multimedia project entitled Head Full of Hair, Heart Full of Song. Head Full of Hair, Heart Full of Song is a collection of songs, stories and videos exploring the notion of natural hair, ancestry and adornment for women African descent of all ages. This project looks at the inner and outer conflicts that arise for a young woman of African descent or woman of color when confronting oneself in a world that generally defines beauty from a European set of values.

Growing up African American and now having a teenage daughter myself I have witnessed how resourceful one has to be in order to counter many of the biased/disempowering images, limiting language and beliefs that are used everyday in our culture. 

By pledging today your contributions will help in the rehearsing, recording, mixing, mastering, artwork and manufacturing for this full album! An album which I hope will be a modern resource for young women of all backgrounds to see and create themselves from their own vision.  

What We Need & What You Get

In order to make this project a reality I am asking you to help me raise $20,000 with a flexible goal of $25, 000. Having made three records prior to this moment, I have experienced what it takes both financially and artistically to make a quality album with committed artists. This amount will go towards paying professional and committed musicians to fully learn, rehearse and co-arrange the music that I have written. Songs that range from stories of my maternal and paternal grandmothers to young teenage girls in South Africa protesting to be able wear their hair natural at school...in 2016!  I plan to use a total of 5 core musicians with a few special guests.

After a few small sharings to solidify our arrangements the music and stories will be recorded. So your contributions will compensate musicians and the engineer for their time in the studio. At this point I will be co-creating a visual experience that best reflects the intentions of these songs to convey the inner and outer beauty and challenges of African ancestry and hair with a dynamic photographer and a graphic designer. The last steps of music production will involve mixing/producing and mastering and finally pressing the completed project to a small amount of vinyl and cds as well as digital downloads.

Due to the complexity of Afro ancestry/identity and hair, video spoke to me as a means to convey thoughts and feelings around this layered topic. Your donations will also allow me to focus on filming and editing the last three video installations for this project. I have already had the time to gradually develop half of  the videos that are connected to Head Full of Hair, Heart Full of Song. With the help of my husband Nikolai Moderbacher crafting video camera rigs and backgrounds as well as often handling camera work, I have several videos completed. 

Finally, you will be receiving a host of goodie bags or perks for joining me in this creative process. Contributors will receive anything from a digital copy of the album Head Full of Hair to my entire discography, which includes my first album Sweet Home Chicago, The Music of Robert Johnson, my first collection of original music released on cd Of The Air and my last recorded project Portholes To A Love & Other Short Stories which won me a grant from New York Foundation for The Arts in Music Composition. Donators may also receive anything from to their name in the liner notes, to a special Posture Self-Care Package, to being the executive producer and more. 

In the event that I am unable to reach my entire financial goal I still plan to complete the recording of this album releasing Head Full of Hair first digitally and postponing the vinyl pressing and additional video installations.  

The Music Is The Magic...

It has been nearly 10 years since I released my third solo album Portholes To A Love & Other Short Stories. My first record Sweet Home, The Music of Robert Johnson earned me national and international exposure as well as many positive reviews including having "put a novel spin on the Blues" by Downbeat Magazine. While I have written a collection of environmental inspired music entitled Songlines: Singing The Land  in the time since my last album, I chose not to go to the studio to record. I needed to rebuild my energy, raise my family and take care of my health. But NOW with Head Full of Hair, Heart Full of Song I really feel ready to share this project in a big way because it means that much to me. It literally pulls on me, like a child, to be completed.

Everyone needs a positive role model and our society needs a wide span of storytelling to represent the full range of experiences lived in this world . From slogans like "Black Girl Magic", to Solange's "A Seat At The Table" album, to a rise in women of African descent "going natural" and much more, even pop culture is seeking to re-envision what we want to say about race, gender and equality. Young women need to know that who they are and what they are feeling is acceptable and that many of our ancestors who came before us had valuable stories as well. That tight, curly hair is just as interesting, raveled, beautiful, messy, mysterious, misleading, and misunderstood as straight hair. 

African/African American/Afro diasporic women and  young girls need safe centers to reflect and rejoice. Like Oshun, the Yoruban Goddess of beauty/fertility/music and art, looking in her mirror, we all seek to face ourselves and find peace. Any pledge you make to this project is a pledge towards reframing a part of our global history. Everyone needs a positive role model. Someone with stories and feelings and songs. Thank you for pledging to Head Full of Hair, Heart Full of Song.

Other Ways You Can Help

I know everyone has a multitude of financial responsibilities and perhaps a limit to what you can donate towards. So while you may not be in a place to donate financially, if you would like to support this project, if it resonates with you, please do so but sharing this via Facebook, Twitter, Email, Instagram and even your own email blasts. You can email me directly for a concise blurb about the project or Click on the Indiegogo BACK it button at the top of the page and share away!

story:
Short Summary

  • My name is Toby Farrant, and I am a young entrepreneur. I started up Drumble around two years ago, with two business partners, which are both industry experts, and our goal is just to help and support struggling start up musicians, and potentially find the next big hit. 
  • We came up with the idea for Band Hunt as a fun way to help start up musicians, and give them a platform to perform from. It also creates a healthy rivalry between universities, and gets anyone that does perform a lot of support from their backing university. 
  • From your contributions, we will fund this competition, and create a social night in all your calendars that you will likely never forget. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need to raise around £50,000 to fund Band Hunt, because there is a massive list of things we need to do and pay for before the final. This includes venue, equipment, advertising, web development etc. 
  • We are offering the opportunity to help name our winning trophy, and by doing so, you are also supporting your university, and any bands that wish to participate from that university. You also get the chance to win some cool tickets. 
  • If we do not reach our full intended goal, we will attempt to create a much cheaper version of the whole competition, and still try to offer a unique experience if viable. 

The Impact

  • This competition could be a massive opportunity for a lot of people, which may never have had the chance to stand up on stage and perform before. Our audience is very large, and will be a national event with professional judges through all events, and if they like what they see, it could go a long way. 
  • Band Hunt is all a bit of fun, but for some, it is a serious opportunity, and one that we would very much like to give to anybody that is interested. We are hoping to run this competition year on year, to help and support as many musicians as possible. 

Risks & Challenges

  • Luckily, I have the support of two very experienced business partners which have toured with some of the largest musicians in the world, and with their experience, and my business knowledge, I believe that I can make this competition a reality and live up to the expectations that you all may have of the event. 
  • Alongside my business partners, we have some very good contacts, which will help us to create Band Hunt. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you can't contribute, we would appreciate any help sharing this will all your friends, and it is so easy to do so with Indiegogo share tools. 

First round

  • There are three stages to our competition. A first stage knock out round. A semi final and a final.

The rules are:

  • Any UK university is welcome to participate.
  • The video must be no longer than five minutes long.
  • All genres and all types of musicians and performing artists are allowed.
  • One participants from the band must be a student currently studying at the university of submission.
  • Any video that does not follow these rules will still be allowed to be featured on our website, but will however, unfortunately have to be disqualified from the competition. 

The first stage is where all participating bands from each university will film a video, no longer than five minutes of them performing a song together as a band. All and any genres are allowed. Any video that does not follow these rules will be disqualified. It will be made very clear exactly how each band should upload their video onto our website. It is encouraged that members of the bands seek help from other students that study film/photography/music to complete their video. There will be another cutoff point, and any band that has not uploaded their music to our website will be disqualified from judging for the semi-finals. After this cutoff point, the acts will be judged by industry experts, and the best will be featured and shown in our TV shows. The judges will choose the top 25 bands to carry into the next stage, so competition could be very high. The bands will be judged by the quality of music, stage presence, and the amount of views and votes they receive from the website.

Semi-final

  • The semi-final will be held in a studio, with all remaining bands left in the competition. There will be 25 bands remaining, competing for a prize for themselves and the band, and as well as a trophy to the winning university to showcase. Again, this will be judged by industry experts, and judged on the same criteria. Judges will eliminate the number of bands to just 8, which will go into the final.

Final

  • The final will be the last 8 bands remaining, and whoever wins this will win a prize for themselves, as well as a trophy for their university that they represent. There will be a panel of industry experts judging this, and their decision is final. This final will be televised live, and anybody can watch

Prize

  • £1,000 to share amongst the band members

  • A day in a professional recording studio

story:
Brume!

Brume is a very talented gal who's been hiding! Why? Brume was in the middle of a singer songwriter world that was mostly made up of the genre's like folk, blues, and blue grass.  Now Brume has no problem singing and enjoying with other artist of this genre, in fact she has lended her talents by way of singing on her friends songs.  "It Gets me Down" by Liza Marie Sparks of the SF Bay Area for one.

Angela comes from a Mexican American heritage, growing up loving all kinds of music.  But her love for Indie Rock, and British Pop she feels is outside the norm for the area she lived in and had to quietly enjoy the music, until she started doing open mic in and around the Bay Area.  

She started recording her ideas and throwing her songs up onto Soundcloud.  There, tiny bits of gems were laying, waiting patiently to get polished into sparkling gems and we are excited to be a part of it! Aren't you!  Music so sweet with a rock edge! 

A friend helped her develop one of the songs on to Soundcloud and the producer in LA, Chris Wirsig of the famous band no:carrier and of Counter Communications heard it and started to experiment with her song.  Just a few conversations later and the Indiegogo campaign is born to help BRUME GET TO LA for her RECORDING ADVENTURE!!!

 

What We Need & What You Get

FUNDS! Tons of Funds... well the amount we are asking for...

What do you get? The music, the paintings, the updates!!!  Did I tell you Brume is one heck of an artist? Paint, pen, brush? That kind of artist?

 

Oh, and that three different lucky people will get the  paintings for the a $500 donation? and one large painting and oh and a HOUSE CONCERT!!!

Brume is asking for $7435.16 - exact numbers of what we need, but a little more for fees would help so $7500 total!  Because we are determined on getting her there, keeping her safe, fed, relaxed and rehearsed! It would also help in case Brume needed to rent any instruments  while down there to.  Brume's team will be hard at work filming and updating her Adventure as she goes!  Make sure to follow the link to her blog!  Her team will  be making sure all is prepped for distribution, so the CD's will come in time for signing!  

The house concert will be limited to the SF Bay Area.  Did you know Brume is bilingual?  

Brume's voice is beautiful in any language  and her covers are amazing.  If you are one of the lucky folks to choose the house concerts, make sure to think of songs you think she would be awesome at performing. Give her a bit of time to get familiar with them!  

We are so excited! Are you?  Then let's get Brume there! - LET'S GO!

story:
As a baby I woke up singing and making up songs, and started playing the Flute when I was 7.  My first professional music project was in NYC in the 80's in venues like CBGB's. Music is my lifework and I have created many songs and albums. But more recently, for over 10 years, I was in horrible physical pain and it was a struggle making music, and even just living. I could hardly walk. It was awful. Then a transformation happened. And I felt like I experienced a medical and metaphysical miracle. Learn more by viewing this short documentary story of Metamorphosis.

Being well again, I feel such a deep sense of gratitude I want to give something back, share, and inspire, create hope, and even heal thru music.

I used my savings to produce the Metamorph's "The Wave" single and music video.

An international adventure with filming in Costa Rica, Australia and the US. And a family project with both my grown beautiful daughters and 101 year old friend who is still dancing!
 
Some very talented people from the community volunteered their time to make the first two Metamorph music videos possible. Thank you to Lazarina Todorova, Z Boyd Stout, Julifer Day, Morgana Rose, Eileen Kramer, Ari Karma, Kellen Corkill, Nyiko Beguin, Acezat, Fabrice Renaudin, Michal Ben Moshe, Eva Dalak, Naida Moon, Hannah Dyson, Rosario Lill, Shannon Ross.  
 
"Fire Monkey" is the second single and video in the Metamorph 4 Elements series.

Please help us make the  "Wings" music video even better. “Wings” is about using pain, suffering, and struggle, to change and fly. Here is an excerpt from “Wings”. “I’m breaking away my chains, I have to be free, into the vast, unknown, alone afraid, alone, unfolding new wings, leaving our home, alone. Heartbreak is my gunpowder, I am shooting for the stars, love flies and wounds, I have wings and claws...".

The reason for this fundraiser is because as much as I may want to continue and make the Wings video, I don't have the funds.
 

The Metamorph music project features four new songs, focusing on the four elements. “The Wave” (water) “ Fire Monkey” (fire) singles and video's released on YouTube, iTunes, Spotify, reaching over 40,000 people in less than a year. The feedback fills my heart. So many amazing people letting me know they were touched, inspired, and encouraged.

 "Wings" (air) is the 3rd song in the 4 Elements series and will be released on Metamorph The 4 Elements EP. The green macaws from the ARA project will be featured in the "Wings" video, along with the beautiful Arial dancer Hazel Blenes Pla. Donate and help the Wings video fly!

Specifically your donations will go to the production, and the promotion of the "Wings" music video.  Contributions will go to pay the crew, director, dancers, actors, the videographer, the editor, team facilitator, and the promoters. A portion of this fundraiser's proceeds will go to help re-wild those beautiful endangered birds, the Macaws. 

I am offering all kinds of special incentives. Including a 4 day vacation here at my home in Costa Rica with a concert, and a night tour of Puerto Viejo, showing you were "Fire Monkey" was filmed. And of course a tour of the Ara Macaw rescue center.  Or with a "Producer Circle" donation your name will be forever included in the credits. With the "VIP Circle" you will get regular updates as the video is being made, and special behind the scenes photos and so you can watch the magic unfold its wings(pun intended). Smiling.

Help us make this Music Video.

Donate if you can. And with all my heart I will thank you for joining us. Together we will unfold the magic and visions, you are the ones that make this possible.

And please share the link! Thank you. Blessings.....

"Wings" lyrics, music, and vocals by Margot Day. Produced and music co-written by Ari Karma. Photos by Miriam Beach

PS. More Metamorph concerts soon with me and Kurtis Knight, we love sharing our music live with you.  And the 4th song on the Metamorph The 4 Elements EP is "Mindblown" (earth).

Here is an excerpt from “Wings”. “I’m breaking away my chains, I have to be free, into the vast, unknown, alone afraid, alone, unfolding new wings, leaving our home, alone. Heartbreak is my gunpowder, I am shooting for the stars, love flies and wounds, I have wings and claws...".

The reason for this fundraiser is because as much as I may want to continue and make the Wings video, I don't have the funds. 
The Metamorph music project features four new songs, focusing on the four elements. “The Wave” (water) “ Fire Monkey” (fire) singles and video's released on YouTube, iTunes, Spotify, reaching over 40,000 people in less than a year. The feedback fills my heart. So many amazing people letting me know they were touched, inspired, and encouraged.
 "Wings" (air) is the 3rd song in the 4 Elements series and will be released on Metamorph The 4 Elements EP. The green macaws from the ARA project will be featured in the "Wings" video, along with the beautiful Arial dancer Hazel Blenes Pla. Donate and help the Wings video fly!Specifically your donations will go to the production, and the promotion of the "Wings" music video.  Contributions will go to pay the crew, director, dancers, actors, the videographer, the editor, team facilitator, and the promoters. A portion of this fundraiser's proceeds will go to help re-wild those beautiful endangered birds, the Macaws. I am offering all kinds of special incentives. Including a 4 day vacation here at my home in Costa Rica with a concert, and a night tour of Puerto Viejo, showing you were "Fire Monkey" was filmed. And of course a tour of the Ara Macaw rescue center.  Or with a "Producer Circle" donation your name will be forever included in the credits. With the "VIP Circle" you will get regular updates as the video is being made, and special behind the scenes photos and so you can watch the magic unfold its wings(pun intended). Smiling.Help us make this Music Video.Donate if you can. And with all my heart I will thank you for joining us. Together we will unfold the magic and visions, you are the ones that make this possible.And please share the link! Thank you. Blessings....."Wings" lyrics, music, and vocals by Margot Day. Produced and music co-written by Ari Karma. Photos by Miriam BeachPS. More Metamorph concerts soon with me and Kurtis Knight, we love sharing our music live with you.  And the 4th song on the Metamorph The 4 Elements EP is "Mindblown" (earth).
campaign_city: Puerto Viejo De Talamanca, Costa Rica

story:
Who we are:

We are Youngest of Elders, an indie/alternative band from the San Francisco Bay Area. We've been working hard on our debut full-length album for the last year, and we need your help finishing it!

In just eighteen months, we've gone from a solo project to a full four-piece band playing with such acts as Anthony Ranieri (of Bayside), Tiny Stills, Bad Pop, Oleander, and many more. We've all been in bands for a long time, and know all too well that paying for any recording or merchandise out of pocket is always a financial and mental pain. With all of the success crowdfunding has been over the last few years, we thought we'd try it out and hope fellow musicians, friends, family, and fans both new and old could help out.

What we want to do:

We want to raise enough money with our campaign to produce a radio and CD-ready debut album that's guaranteed to let everyone know who Youngest of Elders is, can do, and wants to get done musically.

The total estimated cost of the release is $2500, which covers the recording, mixing, mastering, and CD duplication costs. We’ll be working once again with The Canvas Group, a San Francisco Bay Area-based production team, for the duration of the project, who I've worked with previously for our last release, "ASL". All funds raised for the campaign, whether it be more or less than our goal, will go to making our dream of releasing our first album a wonderful reality.

What's up, Goatheads!

You know what time it is! Goatsilk is heading into the studio to record a new single. One lucky fan gets to join the band for an exclusive experience in the studio. Come hang with us as we work with Chis Dawson of Seasons After. You know you were going to buy the track anyway on iTunes. Why not support your favorite group and have a chance to win other prizes also up for grabs.

Thank you for entering the "Goatsilk #keeplivemusicalive Sweepstakes"

Signed CD's, shirts, posters and much more... TBA. Grand prize and shipable items restricted to US residents only. Digital perks availible world wide.

Join the Goatnation!

Thank you for your support and be sure to sign up for the mailing list for earlier notification.

 

 

Note: Limited number of certain prizes. Unlimited chances to win.

story:
The Lowdown

Red Mesa is an Albuquerque, NM based desert rock band.  The band was formed in 2013.  The band has been playing live since 2014. They have released 1 full length album and 1 EP split most recently 2016's SECOND COMING OF HEAVY VOL.4 released on Ripple Music label.  The Obelisk wrote of the EP "a genuine mini-album" and "somewhere between a vocalized Karma to Burn and Kyuss".

After an up and down 2017, where the band saw two of its original band members leave, principal songwriter and founder, Brad Frye started writing a record.  The Devil and The Desert is more personal and heavy than previous Red Mesa records.  But by no means is this a solo record.  The songs are hazy and beautiful like desert sunset.  The melodies are catchy, errie, and haunting.  The guitars are dirty and effect-drenched to capture the desert environment. We know you are going to love it.  And we can all feel a little pride together about making this a reality.  

So, we are just asking for you to order this record in advance.  We will be pressing 250 copies.  They are going to go fast, there's nothing to lose.  Let's do this!

What We Need & What You Get

Most of the record has been recorded, mixed, and mastered.  What we need help with is the funds for production of the vinyl LP and costs to cover merch and PR work to help with the release of the record.  

We're asking for 4000 as a goal.  Approximately 2000 is going to the production of the vinyl and jackets and artwork. and the rest will go to merch production and PR.  This will help "The Devil and The Desert" reach national press.  

All contribution levels will include a pre-release digital download, and the second tier and above will include either a copy of the new vinyl record, killer new "The Devil and The Desert" merch, or both!

Donating above and beyond will get you some awesome other prizes like an album artwork print by the album's artist Joe Vollan or a free Red Mesa show and more.  

The Record

This is an ambitious record.  There is no record label backing on this album, hence we need your help. 

With Brad not having his original band members, Matthew Tobias at Empty House Studio has worked directly with Brad to get the songs to come alive, and to add to the Red Mesa catalogue.  Matthew brought in a few top Albuquerque studio musicians to help with bass and lap steel, and additional guitars.  Matthew himself laid down drums.  Brad wrote, sang, and played guitars and lead.  

The album will have two sides.  Side A being the more deserty and atmospheric side, with excellent songwriting and Side B bringing the heavy riffs and power. This album grows and weaves through stories and sounds.  

Side A:

1) Devil Come Out To Play

2) The Devil's Coming Round

3) Springtime in the Desert

4) Desert Sol

Side B: 

....To be announced soon!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't give money, but still love Red Mesa, please help spread the word to any and all friends, family, co-workers, and music lovers.  We'll be very grateful for your efforts.

story:
Toni Bergins

Hi!  I'm Toni. My goal is to create a wave of inspiration where people learn to love themselves, connect with their joy and find their personal power!  I really need your help in getting my music out there! I want to impact young people and inspire all listeners to remember that they matter! I'm a dancer, singer-songwriter, workshop facilitator, founder of JourneyDance™. I've also created the Embodied Transformations Method for personal growth and development.  For the last 20 years I have used movement and expression to help people get into their bodies, heal from past traumas that impact their lives, and find joy.  We move into a new story. 

As I work with people, I find such a range of sadness and joy in the world.  I sing and write music  to release my own emotions and connect with people's stories.  Almost every song on this upcoming debut album was written in response to emotions I needed to express or stories I needed to share.  My title track Never Too Late was written to inspire those who feel they have lost their dreams, or that the pain of their past holds them back from fully living.

Two years ago I began sharing my music publicly during workshops and at open mic events.  I got wonderfully positive responses and someone generously introduced me to my producer Jason Samonik.  We immediately clicked and became writing and musical partners.  He took my folky guitar songs and my piano ballads and turned them into epic musical pieces.

It's been a challenging process to uplevel my work and jump deeper into sharing my voice and message. For me, the voice is my most vulnerable place to share myself.  I'm pushing myself to my edge recording these songs, performing them and deciding to share them with the public.

This campaign is to help raise money for producing and completing this long-awaited project.  It's been a labor of love!  I just finished writing the last song for the album, Made From Love, about how my divorce impacted my sons.  I know many people will relate to it.  With your help, I can get these messages out into the mainstream!

What We Need & What You Get

Recording and production is a costly and totally worthwhile adventure.  I've loved every minute of it!  I've also spent a ton of my own personal money on this labor of love and I now need to raise funds to complete paying my producer to bring these songs to life. What I've learned is that it really takes 100s of hours to produce an amazing track with all the layers of today's music.  Recording is the easy part.  Hours in the studio laying down instrument tracks and creating a sound and feel takes the longest!  I'm hoping to raise enough for 50-100 more hours in the studio and completion of the first album.

You can probably tell I love connecting with people.  Your donation means so much to me because you will become a part of this project and getting it out to the world!!  I've created a bunch of perks as my way of saying thank you for your generous contributions.  There are even a few perks where we can connect directly, like songwriting workshops.

The goal I selected will allow me to complete a full CD of 11 songs.  If I don't reach my full goal, I will use the funds I do raise to work on as many tracks as I can and release them as singles. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you aren't able to contribute financially, your support means so much to me.  This is such an emotional journey and every person's energetic contribution helps the momentum of this project.  Please:  Share this campaign with friends and others who might be moved by this music!  Look for my songs and videos on Spotify, iTunes and YouTube!

I'm all about Impact!

When you donate to this project you will be helping share positive messages given to the world through music.  Each song stands for something that I feel strongly people need to hear.  A few of the songs are pop and fun to dance to, but the lyrics are meant for something greater.  Like when you listen to music to help you feel and release, I want this for others.

I am still nervous when I perform. I am still nervous about what kind of response I will get when my music is "out there". But I know I must do it and that if can do it, I can inspire so many other wonderful people to live their dreams!

Here is my first completed track with some fun images and dancing for your enjoyment! Be a game changer!

story:
Help Sue Bachner and Ether Park record a new EP

Hi all, 

I'm Sue Bachner. If you're reading this, it's possible you know me from my past recordings with my band Ether Park, or from tracks I've had on compilation albums on Zero Hour Records the last couple of years. https://zerohouraustralia.bandcamp.com/music

Or maybe you've seen the video for my song "Where's Jeffrey" on youtube.  

 
Perhaps you've stumbled onto this page in the course of an intense google search for an affordable place to purchase some ether. I'm not judging, but I can't help you with that. Still, please check out the rest of my story, the ether will still be there 10 minutes from now. (Unless it evaporates; I remember very little about chemistry from high school.) 
 

My goal is to crowdfund an EP of 5 songs ( listed below), with the "perks" being pre-paid downloads of the eventual completed tracks, PLUS some fun extras. 

I've tentatively titled the project "Happy Landings" because I think a lot of us feel the world is sort of up in the air right now. Maybe putting the EP out will encourage some solid "happy landing" energy for my friends, and listeners. But I need $2500 for liftoff! That will cover the entire cost of production, as per a quote from Westfall Recording Company www.westfallrecording.com

A lot of my songs are about real life issues many people think about. Here's a list of the probable songs I will record.: 

 "Happy Now": about the decision to put a child up for adoption 

 "Theme For The Day": about a person trying to find a "theme" or point to life while being unemployed. 

"Money Up, Money Down": about a whole country trying to find a "theme" or point to life while being unemployed. ( Hmm, I think I sense a theme here, after all, and it's chronic unemployment.) 

"I'm Not Your Fan" : about trying to crawl out from under the weight of your friends' big fat creative egos. ( No, it's not about me. I'm a very humble, down to earth person. Probably.)

"According to Mary": kind of 21st century version of "The Gospel of Mary" from the Gnostic Gospels in song. gnosis.org/library/marygosp.htm  ( OK maybe a lot of people don't necessarily think about that, but it's good to switch things up a little once in a while!) 

Here's a video of a me doing a live, acoustic version of "Money Up, Money Down" just to give you a sample of one of the songs. ( The video was part of an animated web series at the time called "Explosion Bus" http://www.explosionbus.com  In the video, I'm supposed to be auditioning for a fictional traveling talent show. Oh yeah, I do comedy too.) :  

 

Here are reviews of my previous work: 

"...without going overboard toward cutesiness, Ether Park express their tales of heartbreak and bitterness without woe or pity. Instead, there's an inspirational theme that advises one to pick up the pieces of one's shattered relationship without feeling sorry for oneself." Mike DaRonco, Allmusic.com

“Ether Park delivers female-fronted, guitar driven, radio friendly mainstream alternative rock.... hooks had me singing along with the choruses by just the third listen.” Geoff Wilbur's Renegade Newsletter (Industry Edition) 

 “Crafty, confident, and more than a little clever pop music... This is smart work. Is Top-40 radio ready for Ether Park? Probably not, but you should be.”  Cake Magazine

"In a world of alternative clutter that has lost its direction, its refreshing to hear something totally new.” Crash Zero

Here's a song I recorded last year for a tribute compilation, "Not The Knack" for Zero Hour Records, at Westfall Recording Company, so you can see the quality of the work they do there. 

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute financially, there are other ways you can help this recording to become a reality: 

  • Please take a minute to get the word out and let others know about my campaign through social media or any other way that occurs to you. 
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

I guess that's all for now. I promise to do my very best to provide music you'll really enjoy if I can meet my funding goal. 

Thanks so much in advance for any support you can give us! 

Best, 

Sue of Ether Park

Here's a song I recorded last year for a tribute compilation, "Not The Knack" for Zero Hour Records, at Westfall Recording Company, so you can see the quality of the work they do there. 

 


 
Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute financially, there are other ways you can help this recording to become a reality: 

Please take a minute to get the word out and let others know about my campaign through social media or any other way that occurs to you. 
Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

I guess that's all for now. I promise to do my very best to provide music you'll really enjoy if I can meet my funding goal. 
Thanks so much in advance for any support you can give us! Best, Sue of Ether Park

story:
Short Summary

Hi! We’re Names Without Numbers. Since originally forming in the summer of 2000 we’ve released an EP and a full-length album, toured the Midwest, played in venues ranging from basements to festivals, slept on floors and in barns (true story), and enjoyed meeting tons of cool people along the way. 

In 2006 we decided to take a break. Since then we’ve all started families, added to our already impressive collection of tattoos, Dave fractured his skull and almost died (his brain is fine now…at least as much as it ever was), shook the dust off in 2009 for a reunion show, and then resumed our rock and roll hibernation. 

Fast forward to 2018…WE’RE BACK! We came out of retirement, woke up from our hibernation like a bunch of hungry bears…hungry to write new, bold, passionate music. We have already begun writing and recording new songs, but we need your help to finish the project. 

What We Need & What You Get

There are a lot of expenses that go into a recording project; studio time, mixing the record, mastering, artwork, advertising, and a ton of other things. So, we’re asking for you to consider helping us fund the project. 

We’ve decided to work with our friend and producer Michael King on the album.  Mike’s worked with groups like Mainstay, Undying Anthem, Epic Hero, CP Worship, and is also a published writer. In addition, we’ve brought in Grammy Award-winning mixing engineer J.R. McNeely. Some of his credits include Anberlin, Emery, Demon Hunter, Relient K, Underoath, and Acceptance. 

The $10,000 goal is a very conservative number compared to what it might actually cost to make this the best it can be. It's not just a financial commitment, but it's also very time consuming. This means spending time away from family, long hours in the studio, meeting with graphic designers, producers, writing sessions, etc.  

If we don't meet the goal, the project will still happen, but we might have to cut some corners! That means less songs, less advertising, and less time perfecting the songs to make them the best they can be. We want you to have MORE, not less. If we meet, or go above and beyond the goal, that will only mean one thing…more rad perks for you, the fan and listener! We’ll be able to record more songs, have better production, artwork, and many other things. The more we raise, the more we can make this an album you’ll really enjoy. 

There are several different levels of funding you can choose from, and each one has special perks that come with it. As a bonus, everyone who donates will get a download of the brand new, un-released song, THE APATHY ANTHEM. 

The Impact

We’re not asking for money just so we can have fun and record some songs. We’re asking for you to help us impact lives through music. It has always been our goal as a band to write thought provoking songs that help the listener in whatever situation they’re in. At the same time, we want our songs to be fun, catchy, and something you can bob your head to and sing along with. 

We feel these new songs are the best material we’ve ever written. I’m sure every band says that, but really, this stuff has us very excited! So, in the words of one of our favorite bands, Jimmy Eat World, we need you to “Kick start our rock & roll heart.” 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand some people can't contribute financially, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

·SOCIAL MEDIA. This is huge. Share, share, share. Use the Indiegogo social media share tools, Facebook, Instagram, Twitter…whatever you got.

·Tell your friends, neighbors, mom, dad, your doctor, your lawyer, church, youth group, your bridge club, anyone you can think of. Word of mouth is a great tool. 

Whatever resources you have, use them. Start making some serious noise about this campaign!
story_txt:
Short Summary
Hi! We’re Names Without Numbers. Since originally forming in the summer of 2000 we’ve released an EP and a full-length album, toured the Midwest, played in venues ranging from basements to festivals, slept on floors and in barns (true story), and enjoyed meeting tons of cool people along the way. 
In 2006 we decided to take a break. Since then we’ve all started families, added to our already impressive collection of tattoos, Dave fractured his skull and almost died (his brain is fine now…at least as much as it ever was), shook the dust off in 2009 for a reunion show, and then resumed our rock and roll hibernation. 
Fast forward to 2018…WE’RE BACK! We came out of retirement, woke up from our hibernation like a bunch of hungry bears…hungry to write new, bold, passionate music. We have already begun writing and recording new songs, but we need your help to finish the project. 

What We Need & What You Get
There are a lot of expenses that go into a recording project; studio time, mixing the record, mastering, artwork, advertising, and a ton of other things. So, we’re asking for you to consider helping us fund the project. 
We’ve decided to work with our friend and producer Michael King on the album.  Mike’s worked with groups like Mainstay, Undying Anthem, Epic Hero, CP Worship, and is also a published writer. In addition, we’ve brought in Grammy Award-winning mixing engineer J.R. McNeely. Some of his credits include Anberlin, Emery, Demon Hunter, Relient K, Underoath, and Acceptance. 
The $10,000 goal is a very conservative number compared to what it might actually cost to make this the best it can be. It's not just a financial commitment, but it's also very time consuming. Whatever resources you have, use them. Start making some serious noise about this campaign!

story:
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

For fans of music like Melody Gardot, Madeleine Peyroux, Cyrille Aimée, Cécile McLorin Salvant, Emilie-Claire Barlow, Hailey Tuck, Postmodern Jukebox, Harry Connick, Jr., Michael Bublé, Ella Fitzgerald.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

"Freed's shining moment was with her own composition "Movie Boy" where she sings to a portrait, a la Garland to Gable."  -Broadway World LA

" Freed is the funky, effervescent belter" -Chicago Theatre Addict

"Freed is a belter...and the power of the Queen canon isn't diluted one decibel." -Oregonian

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

You are Big Crazy Love...

As I reflect on the past year, I see much duality. Pain and joy, movement and stillness, community building and divisiveness, fear and faith. Collectively, we were forced to face our truth...like it or not. Personally, I spent the first half of last year questioning my reality as an artist and what it means when everything seems to come to a screeching halt. Like so many, I had to live in the unknown and allow my discomfort to become a messenger of what was possible for me on the other side of a global trauma event.  In December, I decided to call in a dream I had been sitting with for many years, to create a fully produced album filled with original music, written from bottom of my heart, and to set it free in the spring of 2021. This album is a love letter to myself and to you. 

My name is Courtney Joy Freed and I am a musician who has been dedicated to live performance for almost 20 years. I've lived and worked in Los Angeles, Chicago, New York City and now reside in my hometown of Portland, Oregon where I weave music into all facets of my life. I adore the performing community in Portland and I find great pleasure in sharing my love of jazz music with my friends, family, vocal students and audiences all over the region. I view this collection of music as an offering of love, to anyone who may need a bright spot as we emerge from a particularly stormy year. 

About The Album: 

It is my honor to be working with Matt Greco at The Rye Room in NE Portland as producer and engineer. He has worked with many local musicians and has infused his artistry and dedication into every project. We begin our sessions in March and will be focused on creating the best product possible. Each track has been lovingly designed to take the listener on a musical journey through a hopeful, wistful, inspirational, pensive and joyful dreamscape. You will hear my brand spanking new original tunes as well as a few classic covers. Also, I couldn't imagine recording an album at this moment in my life without including a song by the great Freddie Mercury. 

Musicians:

piano: David Saffert

drums: Kyle Owen

guitar: Hamody Hindi

bass: Bernardo Gomez

strings:  Bizarre Star Strings (Kyleen King, Patti King and Anna Fritz)

string arrangements: Kyleen King

Fundraising Goal: 

Y'all, making a beautiful album is EXPENSIVE. That, coupled with the fact that I lost almost ALL my income in 2020 means I couldn't make it happen without you! Ultimately, this fundraiser will cover a portion of the costs it takes to birth this little gem into the world. Your support would help so much and relieve some of the pressures that go along with covering the costs of rehearsals, musician fees, recording, mixing, mastering, distribution, photography, design, printing, social media, pr, marketing, etc. Truly, any amount of support would be amazing. Even if it isn't financial! I know this is a difficult time for artists, so the fact that you are reading this right now is AMAZING:) Your love gives me warm fuzzies all over!! 

Your funds will go directly to: 

- Producer, engineering and studio time 
- Session musicians (guitar, bass, drums, piano, strings)
- Post-production (editing, mixing, mastering)
- Album production (CD & Vinyl pressing)
- Distribution, marketing and promotion for the album

Track Listings and sneaky peak at some lyrics:

Big Crazy Love (original) - "it will get easier, it will be clearer, here in the darkness you'll see..."

When We Were Lovers (original) -"you drew a map of your heart, and I did my best not to tear it apart but I knew we were robbed from the start...digging our pockets for that delicate art"

See the Sea With Me (original) - "maybe I'm dreaming, maybe I'm asleep..but slipping away at the break of the day is a secret I plan to keep."

Ancient History (original) - "Are we young? Are we old" Is our story all but told? Have we missed the boat and cannot float, are we dust or are we gold?"

Take Your Time (original) - "This love affair has only just begun, still you look at me as if I was the only one. I'll take your hat, take your shoes...we'll dance away these lonely blues. Just put your hand in mine and take your time."

There's a Mornin' Comin' - "There's a morning coming when you won't feel low, there's a morning coming for you. From the top of the stairs, throw down your cares...there's a morning coming, coming for you."

Melancholy Blues - by Queen!! You KNOW how I love my Freddie Mercury:)

No More Blues - by the great Brazilian composer Antônio Carlos Jobim

What a Difference a Day Made - one of my favorite songs, originally written in Spanish by María Grever, a Mexican songwriter, in 1934.

Lilac Wine - written by James Shelton (lyrics and music) in 1950 and made famous by Nina Simone in 1966.

Wake Me Up Before You Go-Go -I'm putting a Wham! song on my album and you can't stop me. 

 

LINKS: 

my sites:

http://www.courtneyfreedmusic.com

https://www.facebook.com/Courtney-Freed-Music-223609980838

https://www.instagram.com/courtneyjoyfreed/?hl=en

my videos: 

 

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

THANK YOU

I truly appreciate you taking the time to visit my campaign. I know there are a lot of wonderful projects out there made by some amazing artists so just the fact that you spent a little time getting to know me and learn about this album warms my heart. Please know that any way you can support my art helps...even if it's just a "like" on social media:) If you pre-order the album, great! If you decide to get a vinyl, awesome!! Either way, I am grateful for you!! XOXO

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

I truly appreciate you taking the time to visit my campaign. story: New Album "Coming Home" - Now available at www.kimoleary.com
story_txt: New Album "Coming Home" - Now available at www.kimoleary.com

story:
Short Summary

Vaureen is Andrea, Marianne and Cale. For over 2 years, the three of us have worked on this record while facing some significant challenges brought on by life-changes. We pushed forward because of how much music means to each of us individually, and how sincerely we want to share with others. We're deeply grateful to all who have helped us make it this far!

Our 10-song album is all ready to go, and we need your help to give the music the best release possible! After all, if it weren't for you out there supporting us and watching us grow, it would mean nothing.

With your generous support, we will:

  • cover months of production, mixing and mastering
  • press collectible vinyl
  • hire a music promotion company to release the music

 

What We Need & What You Get

Our funding goals:

  • Goal #1 – $10,000: We emptied our bank accounts to cover studio time, engineering, mixing and mastering! It was worth it to nail the recording process and produce the grungy, sludgy album of our dreams.

  • Goal #2 – $13,000: We need to deliver a killer physical product: collectible vinyl! Music fans today still value having a physical album to hold in their hands, and we’ve got a custom design prepared that will make eyes and ears happy!

  • Goal #3 – $16,000: We need a music promotion firm to get our music heard on the radio, place stories in blogs and papers, and to help share “Extraterra” with a larger audience. Typically a three-month engagement.

  • Goal #4 – $18,000+: any money we raise past $16k will go toward professional music videos.

Cool stuff for you:

  • First Listen - hear the music before anyone else!
  • Swag - pins and tees
  • Autographed Collectible Vinyl
  • Album Credits - let your kindness be immortalized in vinyl
  • Framed Artwork - something special and unique created by Andrea
  • A live performance video of cover song of your choice, like this one:
 
Everything helps. But if we don't reach our goal, we'll still be able to release the music digitally.

 

The Impact

Nothing brings us more joy than to hear that someone has been moved by a Vaureen song. So far, we've received praise from all over the world! It's been a kind of life-line for us. Connecting with people through our music has brought us the understanding that we're not alone, and compels us to move forward. 

Risks & Challenges

We've spent all our extra time and money making this record. Fans from all over the world have been waiting a long time to hear a follow-up to our Violence EP. One of the biggest risks we face is disappointing our fanbase. Dedication to our fans is a driving force - and if we can't deliver the goods in one year, we'll just have to take more time.

Other Ways You Can Help

Follow us on Facebook and Instagram (@vaureenband), and help spread the word by sharing our campaign with your network! You can also use the Indiegogo share tools, right here on this page.

story:
All Backers, no matter the amount given, will receive free digital downloads of D.R.O.'s Discography and will be rewarded with an invitation to the premier of the "P.C.K.W" video in San Antonio

The Story:

D.R.O. chases his anthropomorphized phone, cigarettes, keys, and wallet through an infinite plane of light. The items are heading towards a dark portal where D.R.O’s embrace of the dark side will become inevitable. Can he save his items, and therefore, himself from a toxic lifestyle?

"P.C.K.W" (Phone Cigs Keys Wallet) is an independent animated music video exploring the mythological balance between Yin and Yang; the delicate dance between light and dark.

This is a story as old as time, but crafted into a new mythology for an emerging generation of artists and young people who want to rise above the complacency and cynicism of our times for the sake of empowering others and defining the everlasting strength and importance of the artist in society.

Campaign Summary

This campaign is helping to support a hungry artist (D.R.O./Me), who has the privilege of creating innovative music with the responsive backing and financial support of my community. Your endorsement will aid in the production of a short film that connects music with an animated visual representation.

Upon completion of the music video, the producers will target top film, music video, and animation festivals such as South by Southwest, Austin Film Festival, Annecy International Animation Festival, and UK Music Video Awards in order to create maximum publicity.

Your donation matters and give us the ability to share our art with the world!

Tha Perks n Shit

The budget of Phone Cigs Keys Wallet is $4,000, being raised primarily through incentivized donations. Donations go towards the budget of the music video production, festival submission fees, and online publicity.

Any donation amount will be rewarded with an invitation to the premier of the Phone Cigs Keys Wallet video in San Antonio. We would like to reward any larger donations in the following ways:

Pledge $25 or more:
- Access to music video release party

- Official D.R.O. Phone Cigs Keys Wallet T-shirt (designed by Ricardo Tomita)

Pledge $50 or more:

- Access to music video release party

- Official D.R.O. Phone Cigs Keys Wallet T-shirt (designed by Ricardo Tomita)

- Signed D.R.O. EP album on Vinyl

Pledge $100 or more:

- Access to music video release party

- Official D.R.O. Phone Cigs Keys Wallet T-shirt (designed by Ricardo Tomita)

- Signed D.R.O. EP album on Vinyl

- Original D.R.O. artwork
 

Pledge $250 or more:

- Access to music video release party

- Official D.R.O. Phone Cigs Keys Wallet T-shirt (designed by Ricardo Tomita)

- Signed D.R.O. EP album on Vinyl

- Original D.R.O. artwork

-Producer credits

Special secret prizes for our high rollers who donate above $500

*If we do not meet our goal, the funds collected will still be used towards our project, and you will still receive your rewards

Budget Breakdown

Stages:
I) Pre-production

1) Concept / Design
2) Storyboard / Animatic

II) Production

3) Backgrounds
3) Lay outs
4) Rough Animation 5) Clean-up
6) Inking and coloring

III) Post-production

7) Finished Composition / Sequence 8) Editing

IV) Additional Costs and PR

9) Social Media Boosts
10) Festival Submission Fees
11) Video Release Party/Performance                                                                                                                 12) Video Merchandise (PCKW Shirts)

Summary:

-Pre-production (~1 wk): $500 Production (~6 wks): $3,000 Post-production (~1 wk): $500 -Additional Costs and PR: $500-$1000

Total Video Budget = $5,000

*We are only asking for half of the Total Budget $2,500 (factored in indiegogo fee of 5%) bringing the total to $2,625

 

The Creative Team

Dillon O’Con (aka D.R.O.) is a local San Antonio Hip-Hop artist and Producer. His goals consist of enhancing other's experience through his thought-provoking art, and producing progressive audio and visual content. Friends and Family can attest to his incessant need to challenge peoples perception of reality, examining themes centered around social injustice and mental health. 

Ricardo Tomita was born in Mexico City and raised between Texas and Tokyo. He graduated from NYU Tisch School of the Arts with a BFA in Film & TV Production, concentrating on animation and direction. He founded Volcano Island Productions where he directs and animates commercial projects and develops and creates personal projects. He lives in Brooklyn.

Ricardo's Works

"PCKW" is the first animated music video for our writer/ animation director Ricardo Tomita. He developed and directed the first two episodes of a short form animated series about animating skits from hip hop albums.

You can find his work here: https://www.volcanoisland.co/

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Ultimately, on behalf of Ricardo and I, we thank you for your time. We totally understand if you aren't able to lend your boys some cash at this time. What you can do for us, if you are low on the funds, is share this campaign with family and friends who may be interested in a project like ours! Thank you from the bottom of my heart,

D.R.O.

Tha Perks n Shit
The budget of Phone Cigs Keys Wallet is $4,000, being raised primarily through incentivized donations. Donations go towards the budget of the music video production, festival submission fees, and online publicity.
Any donation amount will be rewarded with an invitation to the premier of the Phone Cigs Keys Wallet video in San Antonio. We would like to reward any larger donations in the following ways:
Pledge $25 or more:- Access to music video release party
- Official D.R.O. Phone Cigs Keys Wallet T-shirt (designed by Ricardo Tomita)
Pledge $50 or more:
- Access to music video release party
- Official D.R.O. Phone Cigs Keys Wallet T-shirt (designed by Ricardo Tomita)
- Signed D.R.O. EP album on Vinyl
Pledge $100 or more:
- Access to music video release party
- Official D.R.O. Phone Cigs Keys Wallet T-shirt (designed by Ricardo Tomita)
- Signed D.R.O. EP album on Vinyl
- Original D.R.O. artwork 
Pledge $250 or more:
- Access to music video release party
- Official D.R.O. Phone Cigs Keys Wallet T-shirt (designed by Ricardo Tomita)
- Signed D.R.O. EP album on Vinyl
- Original D.R.O. artwork
-Producer credits
Special secret prizes for our high rollers who donate above $500
*If we do not meet our goal, the funds collected will still be used towards our project, and you will still receive your rewards 

Budget Breakdown 
Stages:I) Pre-production 
1) Concept / Design2) Storyboard / Animatic
II) Production 
3) Backgrounds3) Lay outs4) Rough Animation 5) Clean-up6) Inking and coloring
III) Post-production 
7) Finished Composition / Sequence 8) Editing
IV) Additional Costs and PR
9) Social Media Boosts10) Festival Submission Fees11) Video Release Party/Performance                                                                                                                 12) Video Merchandise (PCKW Shirts)
Summary:
-Pre-production (~1 wk): $500 Production (~6 wks): $3,000 Post-production (~1 wk): $500 -Additional Costs and PR: $500-$1000
Total Video Budget = $5,000
*We are only asking for half of the Total Budget $2,500 (factored in indiegogo fee of 5%) bringing the total to $2,625
 
The Creative Team
Dillon O’Con (aka D.R.O.) is a local San Antonio Hip-Hop artist and Producer. His goals consist of enhancing other's experience through his thought-provoking art, and producing progressive audio and visual content. Friends and Family can attest to his incessant need to challenge peoples perception of reality, examining themes centered around social injustice and mental health. 
Ricardo Tomita was born in Mexico City and raised between Texas and Tokyo. He graduated from NYU Tisch School of the Arts with a BFA in Film & TV Production, concentrating on animation and direction. He founded Volcano Island Productions where he directs and animates commercial projects and develops and creates personal projects. He lives in Brooklyn.

Ricardo's Works
"PCKW" is the first animated music video for our writer/ animation director Ricardo Tomita. He developed and directed the first two episodes of a short form animated series about animating skits from hip hop albums.
You can find his work here: https://www.volcanoisland.co/
 
Other Ways You Can Help
Ultimately, on behalf of Ricardo and I, we thank you for your time. We totally understand if you aren't able to lend your boys some cash at this time. What you can do for us, if you are low on the funds, is share this campaign with family and friends who may be interested in a project like ours! Thank you from the bottom of my heart,
D.R.O.

story:
STRUGGLE SESSION is a hardcore band living in Beijing, China and consists of members from the USA, Canada, and Australia.  Struggle Session is touring South America (Brazil, Uruguay, Argentina, Chile, Peru, Columbia, and Panama) in June-July of 2018.  After our last tour and consequently, making our last tour documentary, we noticed the power of sharing videos of local scenes and its capacity for networking, promoting music from local scenes and sharing it internationally, and the reinforcing and encouraging effect it had on musicians worldwide.  Although we live in China, this documentary acts as a way to celebrate, encourage, and support musicians all over the world to reach out, share music, and get touring!

 

If there are any excess proceeds, half will go towards paying for editing and off-setting costs of the tour and half towards a local charity in China.

 

We need your help with getting the documentary made!  Our last tour only consisted of 8 shows in Morocco and Spain, and it took us months before it was ready to release.  This time, we will be playing 34 shows in 36 days, and we would like to bring a professional videographer with us, whose job will be to film and help us with editing and production.   Our goal is to raise $2,500 - $3,000 to cover part of their flights to Brazil and cover some of the fees for time that they will spend on editing and production.

 

Other ways that you can help are by supporting Struggle Session's Music or by supporting local Chinese punk bands on; 

https://strugglesession.bandcamp.com/

http://genjingrecords.com/

http://genjingrecords.com/list/artists

https://www.facebook.com/FarOutDistantSoundsInd...

story:
We are Ask My Bull!


In one form or another we've been a band for 6 years now. We've played in electric house parties, raved it up busking on the streets and taken our crazy sound to festivals all over the UK. We've created an original live score for the play Oct.O.Pus and even provided music for cartoons that have featured on Adult Swim. We've recorded an EP and carved out our own particular niche in the amazing Manchester DIY creative scene. Now its time to solidify these achievements by making a full length album.

We are a strong unit where individual difference is celebrated but everyone is working together for the sake of the music. If you've seen us at gigs you will know that we play as one! One of the main reasons we need to make this album is to finally have recordings that feature all of the current members. The Ask My Bull EP is 3 years old now and we have evolved significantly in the meantime. Its time to have something available that really sounds like us!

This album cannot be thrown together quickly on borrowed time. If it is to be worth making, the album has to capture the energy of our live performances. This is no mean feat! As such, we've been working tirelessly to perfect the songs. However, this is only half the battle – we cannot compromise on sound quality. We need a good old fashioned recording studio, to tap into the sonic power of our musical past and create the most immense sound we can.

Your support will help us work with the right people in the right places to transform our work into a life-size musical creature. We believe that with a recording that truly represents the energy and passion we play with, we'll be able to take the next step and convince anyone who will listen that we are a musical force for the future. Its time to level-up!

 

What We Need

Putting this album together has been a steep learning curve for all of us. Here is a rough and incomplete breakdown of what we need to make this project a success. We've included some estimated costs but we're still working it out! 

Recording  ~ £ 6,000

Not only do we need approximately 18 days of studio time (£ 2,650), we'll be working with producer extraordinaire Luke Clarke who will engineer and mix the record (£ 2,805). To keep the sound quality at maximum, we'll need plenty of fresh strings, drum skins and sax reeds (£ 250). Once the we have the recording mixed, we'll also need to master it (£ 300).

Merchandise  ~ £ 800

We will of course be making CDs, and making the album available online (~ £ 300). We also want to make a killer T-shirt/vest/thing and, of course, some stickers to spread the word (~ £ 500).

Launch Night ~ £ 700

We'll be working with Gadzooks to try and make the launch a night to remember. If you were at our sold-out EP launch you'll know how raucous it can get! We want to hire a sick venue (£ 400) and set the scene with decorations, lighting and projectors. Then there is of course the sound engineer, support acts and DJs, all of whom also need payment (~ £ 300).

Media/Marketing/Art  ~ £ 1,400

We've already begun working with The Samsara Collective to revamp our online presence and get some crisp new photos. For the photoshoot itself we had help with make-up and art direction from our talented friends. Very soon we'll be commissioning a music video and album artwork. We are excited to be working with all these amazing creative people and your support now allows us to do this and treat them fairly.

 

What You Get

So, we've come up with some 'perks'. Not only are these cool ways for you to support the album, but they're a way that we can give something unique back. We've tried to price things as well as we can so you are really getting more than your money's worth. As you'd expect we've got various bundle combinations of CDs, T-shirts, Launch Tickets and the like. There is some pretty unique stuff there too, but let us just highlight one in particular...

Feature on the Record
As part of trying to capture the energy of our live shows we need some of you to come and make some crazy noises with us. Screaming, shouting, babbling, chanting and even some good old fashioned singing; lets all get together and go mental in a room!  We would also love it if you could reprise your role at the album launch itself and shout along in the right places (shouting in the wrong places is also encouraged).
 

Community

We feel amazingly lucky to be part of a thriving DIY scene here in Manchester. There are so many amazing musicians around with whom we feel a kinship, but music alone doesn't make a scene. Sound engineers, venues, promoters, artists, graphic designers, animators, writers, actors, dancers... the list goes on. It should also include friends with good taste and great attitude, random people that dance like there's no tomorrow and that person you know with the great dress sense... With so many people making vital contributions to the culture; its easy to forget about the world's troubles when you're surrounded by so much life. We are thankful, but more than that, we see our music as arising from this scene and therefore as an authentic reflection of it.


So please, if you've ever partied with us, danced your ass off to our music and helped us create the amazing vibe at our shows, help us now bring that vibe to the rest of the world by supporting our debut album. We couldn't be where we are without you and we want to celebrate that with the best recording we can make. If you were going to buy our album at some point anyway, please contribute to this campaign and help us make something really special.


Thank you for taking the time to check out our campaign. We appreciate that not everyone is in a position to contribute money, but if you believe in our music and want to be part of the noise then please share this campaign with anyone you think would feel the same. Online, word-of-mouth, telepathy, passive-aggressive post-it notes... Lets get this moving!

story:
The Last Saturday Night

The Last Saturday Night is a collection of 10 new original Pinto Bennett songs recorded in Idaho with long time friends and some special guests. We have made an incredible record. But we could use your help in covering the climbing costs of this production.

The Story

Pinto Bennett is an Idaho music legend. His unique take on classic country songwriting along with his powerful performances have earned him loyal fans from Boise to Nashville to London. He has shared bills in the U.K. with Willie and Waylon. Harland Howard was a drinking buddy. Emmylou Harris babysat his child.  After performing around the world for decades, Pinto eventually made his way back to Idaho where he currently resides. He still performs occasionally for fans of all ages. 

I'm Jason Beek, producer of The Last Saturday Night. I've been touring around the world for the last dozen years as a drummer and manager for my wife, Eilen Jewell. I also host a radio program called Spoonful on Radio Boise which features classic country, old blues, rockabilly, gospel and old rock 'n' roll. I share a birthday with Hank Williams Sr. I don’t listen to much music made before 1972. Music is my life. With all of this in mind, you can see how easy it was to fall hard for Pinto's music. 

I'm admittedly new to the Pinto party. About 2 years ago, my friend and fellow drummer Michael Rundle invited me to watch him perform with Pinto at the 44 Club in Boise. Pinto's original songs blew me away. I was floored. "Winnemucca", "You Cared Enough To Lie", "Stranger in the Mirror"...so many amazing tunes. Eilen and I began attending the shows at the 44 Club religiously. It wasn't long before I was filling-in on the drums at the 44 and Pinto and I became friends.

Making a Record

About a year ago I asked Pinto about re-recording some of his popular tunes to reflect his current approach and vibe. He said, "Hell man, I already recorded those songs. I have drawers full of new songs." Ok, I thought. Pinto Bennett wants to make a record of new songs. Someone needs to make this happen. So, Eilen and I decided we would take some money we had squirreled away and make a new Pinto Bennett record. 

Obviously this project has been a labor of love. Over the course of many weeks we worked hard to get the songs out of Pinto's kitchen and into the world beyond. We eventually assembled a band of long-time friends who Pinto loves and who he has been working with at the 44 for the last couple of years. I can't say enough about the hard work and dedication given to this project by Brett Dewey (mandolin, vocals), Jake Hoffman (pedal steel), Bill Parsons (upright bass) and Dale Wilson (electric guitar). Together we spent many hours shaping the tunes that appear on this record. All of the work has been for the love of Pinto Bennett and his music. Guitarist Jerry Miller and multi-instrumentalist and engineer Steve Fulton added musical magic that glued the sound together. Eilen Jewell added background vocals.

Help Us Release The Last Saturday Night

Again, so far The Last Saturday Night has been funded entirely by my wife Eilen Jewell and me. There is no label or agency or group backing us. We have been happy to do it, but we also have some realistic goals for this record release. Having a boost from Pinto's fans would help us realize those goals.

Costs So Far Include:

  • Recording and mixing of the album over several days at AudioLab in Garden City, Idaho
  • Mastering by Yes Master Studios in Nashville, TN
  • Painted portrait by Javier Vega (Madrid, Spain) for the album cover
  • Promo photos by Alex Hecht 
  • Album layout and design by Eric Kelly
  • Duplication of the CDs

Future Goals for The Last Saturday Night:

  • We would love for The Last Saturday Night to have a small publicity campaign in the hopes of capturing a few good reviews and getting spins on college and community radio. We’re hoping to reach a larger audience of potential fans as well as trying to reach as many Pinto Bennett fans as possible to let them know about The Last Saturday Night. 
  • While the album is on its way to the CD duplication house, we’re also hoping to raise funds for a vinyl release of The Last Saturday Night. I know there are some audiophiles out there like myself who prefer the beauty of analog LPs over CDs. With luck, we’ll raise enough to make a vinyl release happen.

What Can You Get?

  • There are several perks available for contributing to this project that you will find right on this page. Obviously we have CDs available as well as signed CDs at a slightly higher level.
  • We are hopeful that enough fans will choose to buy vinyl records (signed or not) for us to release this album on LP in early 2019.
  • There are 50 limited edition prints of the original album artwork signed by Pinto available.
  • One lucky person can own the original portrait of Pinto by Javier Vega. Javier is a very talented artist and also an Eilen Jewell fan from Madrid, Spain. He was the first artist I thought of to create the album cover portrait. I was thrilled he could work with us.
  • Pinto's original hand-written and signed song lyrics are also available as a perk for backing this project. These are the road maps the band followed to create these tunes. You can't get much closer to the roots of these songs than holding these sheets of paper.

Join Us

Help us make the release of The Last Saturday Night as good as it possibly can be.  According to the man himself, this is the last album for Pinto Bennett, our guy, your pard’, the Idaho Cowboy, the honky tonk ass-hole pickin’ up cans for a bottle. The record is full of Honky Tonk Bad Breath City. Let’s tell the world about it. 

Not In a Position to Help Financially?

That's ok! We’re really hoping that Pinto's fans and music fans the world over can help us spread the word about this project to all lovers of genuine good music. Please share the link to this campaign to your music loving friends!
