story:
Our Campaign

DCAST Music is a label committed to raising awareness about women's empowerment & promoting gender equality. We pledge to partner with local non-profits and give half of all our profits to them.  This campaign we are supporting the East Los Angeles Women's Center and their Men's Circle Program!  This is a violence prevention program that promotes positive masculinity, healthy relationships, and respect for women. In promotion of our up and coming album I'm a Beautiful Mess, we are selling t-shirts and committing to give the ELAWC half of all the profits. Buy the t-shirt and be a part of supporting programs that help empower women.  Welcome to the movement...we've been waiting for you.

Why are we doing this?

Welcome to the Movement.  Partner with us.  Empower Women.

Violence against women is real

1 in 3 women have been physically abused by an intimate partner.  1 in 5 women in the U.S. has been raped in their lifetime.  Help us support Domestic (Intimate) Partner and Sexual Assault Centers.

Lack of women in Leadership

In 2014, women were just 20 percent of executives, senior officers, and management in US high-tech industries.  In medicine, they comprise 37% of all physicians and surgeons.  Only 29% of women are executives and senior level managers.

Our Goal

Over the next 60 days we want to raise $5,000.  Half of our profits will go straight to the East Los Angeles Women's Center and their "Men's Circle" program.  The other half we use to develop more music projects and to hopefully run more campaigns like this in the future.  With your purchase you help us be apart of the solution. Welcome to the Movement.  Partner with us. Empower women. 

What Your Funding Contributes to:

The East Los Angeles Women's Center offers a number of services but specifically The Men's Talking Circle covers the following:

-Women's empowerment

-Gender equality

-Positive Masculinity

-Objectification and how to stop it

-Healthy Relationships

-What is gender based violence?

-Coping skills (for sadness, hurt, fear, loss)

-Expression and communication of emotions

 

Any Risks?

There are always some risks and challenges involved in pulling off a project, mostly anticipated from printing, production and shipping delays.  You have our full commitment that we will work tirelessly to get you all the merchandise sent to you within the estimated time-table.  It’s important to us to come through on our agreement, especially when referring to giving half of our profits to The East LA Women's Center.  In researching other campaigns on this site, we anticipate that 30% of the funds will go directly to paying host fees, credit card transaction fees, cost of merchandise, and shipping cost.  The rest of the funds generated from this campaign will be split down the middle with the East LA Women's Center.  We believe it’s important to be honest and transparent with all our backers about the financial breakdown – building trust and community is the only way we want to do business.      

 

Other Ways You Can Help


    
If you can fund this project, please do.

        -Please share it all over the internet

       - Or join our Mailing List https://dcastmusic.us18.list-manage.com/subscri...

To learn more about the services offered by the East Los Angeles Women's Center check out their website:  https://elawc.org/

What is DCAST Music

    DCAST Music is a record label that signs music artists and producers to one song record deals or full length album contracts.  We work on a word-of-mouth model to promote, advertise, and distribute singles.  We are committed to sharing half of all our profits with local charities, social justice organizations that promote women's empowerment.  These charitable organizations provide services to survivors of domestic violence (intimate partner) & sexual assault, as well as promote awareness for women's empowerment.  We believe this business model can prove to others that it’s possible to create a successful business, love what you do, and help others in the process.  Check out https://dcastmusic.com/music-gives to find out more about what we do or join our mailing listhere https://dcastmusic.us18.list-manage.com/subscri...
story_txt:
Our Campaign
DCAST Music is a label committed to raising awareness about women's empowerment & promoting gender equality. We pledge to partner with local non-profits and give half of all our profits to them.  This campaign we are supporting the East Los Angeles Women's Center and their Men's Circle Program!  This is a violence prevention program that promotes positive masculinity, healthy relationships, and respect for women. In promotion of our up and coming album I'm a Beautiful Mess, we are selling t-shirts and committing to give the ELAWC half of all the profits. Buy the t-shirt and be a part of supporting programs that help empower women.  Welcome to the movement...we've been waiting for you.

Why are we doing this?
Welcome to the Movement.  Partner with us.  Empower Women.
Violence against women is real
1 in 3 women have been physically abused by an intimate partner.  1 in 5 women in the U.S. has been raped in their lifetime.  Help us support Domestic (Intimate) Partner and Sexual Assault Centers.
Lack of women in Leadership
In 2014, women were just 20 percent of executives, senior officers, and management in US high-tech industries.  In medicine, they comprise 37% of all physicians and surgeons.  Only 29% of women are executives and senior level managers.

Our Goal
Over the next 60 days we want to raise $5,000.  Half of our profits will go straight to the East Los Angeles Women's Center and their "Men's Circle" program.  The other half we use to develop more music projects and to hopefully run more campaigns like this in the future.  With your purchase you help us be apart of the solution. Welcome to the Movement.  Partner with us. Empower women. 

What Your Funding Contributes to:
The East Los Angeles Women's Center offers a number of services but specifically The Men's Talking Circle covers the following:
-Women's empowerment
-Gender equality
-Positive Masculinity
-Objectification and how to stop it
-Healthy Relationships
-What is gender based violence?
-Coping skills (for sadness, hurt, fear, loss)
-Expression and communication of emotions
 
Any Risks?
There are always some risks and challenges involved in pulling off a project, mostly anticipated from printing, production and shipping delays.  You have our full commitment that we will work tirelessly to get you all the merchandise sent to you within the estimated time-table.  It’s important to us to come through on our agreement, especially when referring to giving half of our profits to The East LA Women's Center.  In researching other campaigns on this site, we anticipate that 30% of the funds will go directly to paying host fees, credit card transaction fees, cost of merchandise, and shipping cost.  The rest of the funds generated from this campaign will be split down the middle with the East LA Women's Center.  We believe it’s important to be honest and transparent with all our backers about the financial breakdown – building trust and community is the only way we want to do business.

    If you can fund this project, please do.        -Please share it all over the internet
       - Or join our Mailing List https://dcastmusic.us18.list-manage.com/subscri...
To learn more about the services offered by the East Los Angeles Women's Center check out their website:  https://elawc.org/

story:
What are the details of this campaign?

All funds raised will be going to the completion of my home studio in order to complete/release my first Solo Album!

  • The First Album will be a comprised of my orignal compositions that I've been writing since I moved out to Colorado. 
  • This album is like a "closing a chapter" of my life, and I wish to share that chapter with you. 
  • My music and style draw inspiration from many different artists. Artists new/old such as Gary Clark jr, J Dilla, The Meters, Miles Davis, The Allman Brothers, Jimi Hendrix, Stevie Ray Vaughan, and The Grateful Dead to name a few. 
  • Expect the music to be for the soul and the booty. Good music makes you think, while also having the ability to make you move!
  • ALL of the music you will hear on the album will be written, arranged, and produced by myself. 
  • With YOUR HELP, together we can make this DREAM A REALITY!
  • Sharing my music with the world is my life's mission. Hopefully one day it can make a change for the better. Even if it's just for one person. I'm going to put my soul into these recordings, and I hope to conjure the same spirit within the listener that it does for me when I'm able to play it.  

In order to help make this happen, all you need to do is pick your personalized reward, and voila! You've just contributed to making this dream happen!! In the Flesh!! 

My Music

  • Having studied, and played most styles of music ranging from Metal to Disco; over the past few years I have begun to mold my own style centered around the ethics of "Jazz". Jazz is it's own dialect within music. It's like having a good conversation. One where you don't speak without intent, and you're predominantly listening to those around you, trying to intelligently contribute to the conversation. When this is practiced in other genres of music, you begin to see that genre evolve and the musical exploration take shape. 
  • This first album is a representation of my musical evolution. Combining elements of blues, rock, funk, hip-hop, jazz, and r&b.
  • I will take all these techniques I've studied from these respective genres, and give them a voice within my music. Using the etiquette of Jazz and improvisation; you begin to hear the influences, and sound develop into its own unique thing. My musical "identity" if you will.

My Story

  • My musical journey really started when I became a winner of moe.'s "6th Member of moe." contest via Relix Magazine in December of 2013. (Shown below)
  • After playing with some my musical heroes, it gave me the confidence to pursue playing music as a full time career.
  • After I graduated the State University of New York at Oneonta in 2013, where I received a Bachelor's degree in Music Industry with a minor in Audio Recording and Production, I moved west to Colorado. 
  • There I would continue to develop my craft, and grind as a Guitarist/Singer-Songwriter. Playing with bands like Technicolor Tone Factory, and Yamn (Videos Below).
     

  • Currently I am a contributing creative force behind the group Eminence Ensemble. I have been touring, and writing with the band since October of 2016. 

  • Now at the age of 28 with thousands of road miles under my belt, I'm looking toward the future of my music career in hopes to keep pushing the limits of my musical capabilities, my songwriting, and my art. 

  • Music is cathartic for me. It's one of those arts that not only allows you to express yourself, but also allows you to connect with people the world over. It's use as a language allows you to communicate fluently to create with someone who you would never think you would understand, creating a bond that is unspoken but heard. The power music has drives me to not only experiment with the effects it has as an outlet, but also as a beacon for change. Whether it's instrumental, or a song you can sing along with. Bringing people together to escape their day to day struggles, and make them feel something drives me to not only become the best musician I can be, just it has also taught me a good deal about how to live my life. But we'll save that for the book I hope to write down the line. 

The Impact

Your support means everything to this project, and to myself! It blows my mind how much support I've seen just chasing this dream of mine from the get go. Without the supporters, friends, family, and the countless people who have told me I've made their day just a little bit better through my music; It keeps me going, and for that I can't thank you enough! 

There have been countless campaigns to fund albums. Most have been successful due to the overwhelming support that artists have from their fans. With that said what makes mine so different? Well let me explain...

  • Today's music industry is all about content (Recorded material, videos, live archives, etc.)
  • The more material you have, the better. Music is consumed at such a rapid pace these days. People are always searching for something new. Having the outlet to give them something new all the time is my goal. 
  • With how much is costs to record in a real studio, if you know what you're doing you can not only do it for half the cost, but you can also do it right from your home! (If you have the right gear!)
  • With my network of professionals, knowledge, and experience, I not only know I can achieve the quality of content I'm pursuing, but with the right gear I can also mass produce to create, and distribute all the content I would ever need. 
  • With the proper gear, the content would not be limited to just audio recordings, but also videos, live streams, podcasts, and more that will be produced.
  • This studio was once a dream that is slowly becoming a reality. Having most of the gear and equipment ready to go already I'm almost there, and with your help it will be up and running in no time!

 

Challenges and Perks

With anything there are some risks involved. This career is not for the faint of heart, and I knew that going into this field. However I believe in myself, and my ability to write/produce great music that will make people feel, and bring people together. I've worn the hat of most positions this industry has to offer (Management, booking, production, etc.). I'm at the point now where all the pieces to the puzzle are now visible laying on the table, and they just have to be put together. The only thing needed is time, patience, and a little monetary startup to allow that puzzle to take shape. However as a contributor you don't need to worry about ANY of that! To entice you into becoming a contributor, I have assembled some great packages as an incentive to help fund this project. Some of which are pieces of my instrument collection, guitar lessons, improv masterclasses with your band, merchandise, and so much more! 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I know that things can be tight, and money is not always something you can give. However there are a few other ways you can help! 

  • Share this campaign with friends and family!
  • Share the link on your social media via the Indiegogo share tools at the top of the page!
  • Share within circles you think people would be interested! (Facebook groups, Blog sites, Industry contacts.)

 

Want more info about the project?

Go to the UPDATES section of this page periodically for more info about the album, studio progress, and what you can expect. 

Thank you again for your time and consideration.

Sincerely,

Taylor

story:
“A small-town boy, with a voice that could move the world”

Who? What? Why?

My name is PrinceAlonzo, I am a Rock Soul Singer/Song writer from Rockford, IL now living in Los Angeles, CA. I sing, dance, act, motivational speak and so much more. Inspiring through Music and Entertainment has been my life FOR MY LIFE. Whether it was singing in church, leading my hometown's community dance team or speaking at schools to students, I have always used my gifts to help others. 

This campaign is a project for my supporters to help me fund my Debut EP. It is so important to me because this EP is the key to many doors that will open my career in music. This body of work is the jumpstart & key component to a larger following, a record deal, & opportunities that can change my life.  I am “The Complete Package” but the only thing that is missing is my music.  I’ve been able to tour the world & sell out tours singing covers of other people’s songs. It is time for me to release my own.

This project will change my life!

I invite all of my supporters to help me raise $20,000 for my Debut EP. This $20,000 will cover Studio Time, Recording, Mixing, & Mastering with several of LA’s most talented musicians, record producers, and engineers.  The goal is to create a quality body of work that can compete with today’s best.  Over the years i’ve been able to build my reputation performing covers with live bands in clubs all over the world. It is most important to me that my original body of work has the same powerful presence everyone feels when im on stage. This is why this project must be done right. 

My Music, My Voice…

I am an artist that sings from my heart to the soul. I know my purpose on this earth is to use my voice for healing and change. I have so much to say… On this EP I will be singing about power, unity, love, peace, life, overcoming fear and the list goes on. This EP if nothing else will conceive the power to inspire, heal, and produce change. A change in music, a change in my life, and a change in the people listening. With all of the crazy things going on in the world today, it is imperative for artists like me to speak up, out, and into existence the things we want to see happen. I truly believe that it is up to us to continue fighting for love while uplifting the people around us. No matter what age or race something on this EP will speak to you.  

There are a few perks!

At random my management and I will be giving prizes to the biggest supporters. Prizes will include Free Concert Tickets, Free Merchandise, & More! We also understand that help comes in many forms. If you cannot make a financial contribution, simply helping us get the word out is just as valuable. Share the campaign by using the Indiegogo share tools. Share on your social media and help us spread the word!

story:
I am inviting you on a creative journey to help keep art alive. Art will always need funded and you can play a part in this collaboration.

Fund a single

I am raising $3,700. You may think this number is outrageously high, but it is actually more normal than you think.

Let me explain.

Anybody can throw some tunes into garage band and think “wallah, I have a single.”

Well, that is actually more of a demo. 

When creating a single song, there are about 10-15 people involved.  All of these people need to be paid for their services. Especially if you expect those services to be professionally executed.

And who are these people?

  • Producer
  • Mixer
  • Masterer
  • Musicians - (beautiful strings don’t come for free) 
  • Art Director 
  • Videographer
  • Engineers
  • And more

All of these roles are specific crafts and skills that take years and even schooling to master. 

So, what comes with 3.7k?

The song will be fully available on all streaming platforms, including for sale on iTunes. There will also be a music video that goes along with this song, as well as a live performance video. 

This song is part of a larger project for my forthcoming album “There Is More Love Somewhere.” Any additional funds made in this campaign will go towards supporting the project as a whole

My newer sound can be described as collaborating with the sounds of dance and Anglican mass. I am writing songs that can be found in church and at your local joint. As Christians, we should not only make music for Christians, but music that connects our heart, mind, and soul to our neighbor. 

Because of the innovation musical streaming, the artist is hurting making money by selling records, and “Music Labels” are singing less artists because of this reason, but ART still needs funded. Music still needs to be made. And now it is in the hands of you to make that happen. 

Help me raise the funds for this next song, and you get to be a part of keeping art alive. 

Listen to my latest single - Human:

LISTEN HERE

story:
Most of you are probably aware of the music of Scottish prog rockers Citizen Cain who formed in the early 80s and, despite a couple of long hiatus, continued producing music until they disbanded in 2012. Now for the first time their back catalogue is to be made available on digital and streaming platforms which will open up their music to a whole new audience. We hope you can be a part of that process by contributing to this small fundraiser. In return you will recieve a link to a digtal copy of your chosen album(s) plus a link to an exclusive video of rare "bootleg" footage of the band playing live in the early 90s. The live footage was recorded during the "Serpents In Camoflage" tour and includes the performance of the entire album plus a cover version of the Gabriel era Genesis favourite "Firth of Fifth".

You can choose as a perk a digital copy of any title from our entire back catalogue:

Ghost Dance
Serpents In Camouflage
Somewhere But Yesterday
Raising The Stones
Playing Dead
Skies Darken

We appreciate that many of you will already own these albums on CD but nevertheless we hope that you are willing to help out with the process of moving these classic pieces of prog history into the digital realms. Any contribution will be greatly appreciated and of course you will recieve the added bonus of seeing some of the only footage available of the band performing live.

The actual funding goal of the campaign is £200 (Indiegogo sets a £500 minimum goal) however, even if the fundraiser doesn't meet its goal, the funds will still be put towards the digitalisation of the back catalogue and all perks will stil be fulfilled (i.e, digital album of your choice and live bootleg footage video).

Many thanks to everyone who chooses to support this campaign and to all who have supported Citizen Cain and the associated solo projects along the way. It wouldn' happen without you guys!! THANK YOU!!

The live footage was recorded during the "Serpents In Camoflage" tour and includes the performance of the entire album plus a cover version of the Gabriel era Genesis favourite "Firth of Fifth".
You can choose as a perk a digital copy of any title from our entire back catalogue:
Ghost DanceSerpents In CamouflageSomewhere But YesterdayRaising The StonesPlaying DeadSkies Darken
We appreciate that many of you will already own these albums on CD but nevertheless we hope that you are willing to help out with the process of moving these classic pieces of prog history into the digital realms. Any contribution will be greatly appreciated and of course you will recieve the added bonus of seeing some of the only footage available of the band performing live.
The actual funding goal of the campaign is £200 (Indiegogo sets a £500 minimum goal) however, even if the fundraiser doesn't meet its goal, the funds will still be put towards the digitalisation of the back catalogue and all perks will stil be fulfilled (i.e, digital album of your choice and live bootleg footage video).
Many thanks to everyone who chooses to support this campaign and to all who have supported Citizen Cain and the associated solo projects along the way. It wouldn' happen without you guys!! THANK YOU!!

story:
My name is Riley Whittaker, and I’m a 15 year old singer-songwriter, and musician. I live in a small town called Sedona AZ with my parents, and my two dogs, Charlie Brown, and Sally Brown.  I have always had a huge passion for music! I play multiple instruments including guitar, piano, violin, ukulele, and electric guitar. I have been writing songs since I was 12, and I have now written over 70 and released 7 singles. I have been singing since as long as I can remember, and I started playing instruments when I was 5. The first time I performed I was 8 years old and I sang in a local singing competition called Sedona Superstar. I have come so far since then! I have played around California in LA, San Diego, and I was accepted to play at the 2020 NAMM show in Anaheim. I also played around Nashville at the Bluebird Cafe, Douglas Cafe, and Country Music Hall of Fame. Last summer I played around Canada in Victoria, Vancouver, and Tofino! I have made so many other accomplishments that I am super proud of, and I know I will keep making bigger ones as the years go on! 

 

I am raising money to travel to Nashville and participate in the 2020 Tin Pan South Songwriting Seminar! It is a seminar with some of the top people who wrote the songs you hear on the radio almost everyday! I think this would be a great experience for me. A great way to connect with other writers, and other people who have a huge passion in music as well. I know this seminar will advance my songwriting skills in many different ways. Nashville itself has always felt like a second home to me, and I know it's the place I want to go when I’m done with highschool.  While I am there I would also get the chance to co-write with some of my friends that I met in Nashville two years ago, and hopefully play at some of the historic places I played at last time I was there! 

 

I am also raising money to record my first album! I have been putting out singles since 2017, and everyday I sit in my room and write another song. Recording music is one of my favorite parts of the songwriting process. I love to see it go from a little tune you wrote sitting on your bed, to a huge production. Although it is very expensive to record songs, and especially expensive to record an album. I think it would boost my music career a ton if I raised enough money to record an album. 

 

Anything can help me reach these goals! Just a simple share on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter or a quick text to some of your friends! I would appreciate it so much, and I already appreciate all of the support I receive with my music! I hope you take the time to donate or even share and help me reach these goals!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Eva Luna and I am the founder of my music project ALMERIM. Singing my songs from the purity of my heart is what makes me happy and touched already so many People during 14 years of performing.

I am in love with the power of the voice and how music is a great gift to all of us. It can bring harmony and beauty into our being and into the world. This campaign is to make it possible to record my newborn songs and share them with the world. It enables us to invite wonderful musicians for this new album and record it in high quality. Your support helps to spread the songs which are infused with the message of Love and blessings.

What We Need & What You Get

To realise this we need 12‘000 CHF

Recording: 4000.- / Mix & Mastering: 3000.- 

Graphic design: 2000.- / CD Printing: 1500.- 

Promo: 1500.-

 

You will be the first to get a free Download link of the new album and a signed CD.

All the funds will go into this new album and to the musicians

The Impact

Our Music Project has the intention to shine into the lives of everyone who wants to receive it. Our Sounds of natural simplicity and warmth bring joy and stillness to our bodies and minds. In the past it was already proven to us that this music is appreciated and loved by so many beings. We already created 4 CDs . You find them on www.almerim.ch and more of my artwork on www.evalunabenedetti.ch

Risks & Challenges

What can be a challenge is that we are busy with our family life and it takes some effort to stay put

but we already know the process of creating a CD and are in full trust that the recordings unfold in the right timing, as it always did:-)

Other Ways You Can Help

We are very grateful if you share this campaign with your friends, that it may bring blessings to many people on this beautiful planet.

Thank you so much!

story:
Dear friends and fans,

Due to recent issues with PledgeMusic, I have decided to transfer my album campaign to Indiegogo! 

In September I finished my Master’s Degree in Popular Music at Goldsmiths University, culminating an original stage show of new music that I spent the whole year preparing. It was an incredible experience to showcase my most stylistically experimental music music in such a magical setting, and now-- I want to give you these songs in a tangible format.

By supporting my project, you can help me transform the songs from a live showcase into an unforgettable record. I've managed to finish 2 songs completely and demo the rest, but I need your help to complete the album and create awesome merchandise.

It would be a privilege to have you join me on the journey of recording my most exciting set of work yet! This won’t just be a musical record; but an immersive audiovisual experience.

By supporting me with this project, you will not only enable me to professionally record, mix and master my new songs, but also to bring the record alive with stunning artwork that captures the spirit of the music, and unique, evocative merchandise like beautiful vinyl discs pressed with flowers.

The songs on this record traverse “worlds between worlds”: the liminal spaces between reality, memory and dream. Kate Bush and David Lynch fans: this music is for you!

Here’s a breakdown of what you can help me achieve:

100% of target: Record, mix and master an 8-song album based on the original material presented in my recent live show + press the album onto CD and vinyl + create stunning original artwork + make, package and deliver all of your rewards!

150% of target: All of the above + Integrate PR services to promote the record to press & radio.

To friends both old and new, it would be a privilege to share this journey with you!

Love, 

M

story:
Short Summary

We're Float Like a Buffalo out of Denver! We had a great 2019 - playing some of the largest stages that Colorado has to offer (Red Rocks, Jazz Aspen Snowmass), opening for some large national acts, including Big Sam's Funky Nation, Sting, and Dragon Smoke (feat. members of Galactic and Dumpstaphunk), and taking the crown for Denver's Best Funk Band (Denver Westword) and Top 30 Rock Bands in Colorado (303 Magazine).

We started 2020 with our sold-out single release party at Denver's iconic Bluebird Theater and are going into the year with a ton of momentum - momentum that we plan to build on with our very first national tour. We are so humbled and so excited to be bringing our brand of Colorado Mountain Funk to the rest of the U.S., and the outpouring of support has already been absolutely incredible. We are so grateful for any help we can receive on transportation and lodging costs. We have a chance at achieving our dreams - but we can't do it without you! 

We have never taken a penny from the band fund to pay ourselves. All of the money we make as a band goes directly back into the band. Each of us still works one or two outside jobs to pay our bills while we pursue this passion. That's why your contributions are so important. Your contribution to travel expenses will help make this tour possible. Contributions will go towards:

  • Van rental fees/Trailer costs
  • Gas to get us from here to there
  • Places to lay our heads at night after gigs
  • Meals along the way

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are asking for $7,000 to help with transportation, lodging, and food on tour.
  • Contributors aren't just giving money. They'll also get something in return when they donate! 
  • Even if we don't reach our full goal of $7,000, we'll still be using every penny of the money given toward tour costs.
  • You can follow along on our journey and see where the money is going by following us on social media!
  • Cost Breakdown:
    • 7-Person Van Rental with Insurance for Duration of Tour: $2,400
    • 10' Trailer Purchase to carry and store all of our instruments and gear: $1,000-$2,000
    • Gas for the van: $1,000-$1,200
    • Budget Lodging for 8 (Incl. camping, AirBnBs, hotel rooms): $1,500
    • Meals along the way: ~$1,800

 

The Impact

The impact you'll have on our national tour is huge. Your contributions will allow us to travel, sleep, and eat with a little less worry as we travel around the country. 

Our mission is to get our music into as many ears as possible. We are extremely lucky to have the chance to achieve our dreams, and we are hopeful that as soon as people hear our music, they'll love it and become fans.

We also have such a great support system across the country already - and we feel like we owe it to them to bring our live show to their cities. This is a real, concrete step to taking our passion to the level of a career that pays the bills; a step toward making music what we do full-time.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute monetarily, that's ok! You can still help:

  • Spread the word! If you have friends in our tour cities, let them know we're coming through. Our main goal is play for as many people as possible, so recruiting your friends helps more than we can say. 
  • Follow us on social media! When you follow us on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter, you're helping us grow.
  • Listen to our music on Spotify.
  • Let people know that we're running this campaign.

We're so beyond grateful for any contribution you can make, no matter how big or how small. Every cent and every word of encouragement helps us!

story:
Hi guys!

First of all, THANK YOU for your constant support over the years!!!

I want to release my new Ep directly with You! I'm cutting out all the middle men, so the music is coming directly from me to you.
You are funding it and in return I have a series of very exclusive perks you can get in return - take a look on the list to the right.

There is also the possibility to contribute smaller amounts, when you press the "back it" button at the top. Every penny counts and the most important thing for me is to connect more with You, and have You be a part of the project, even from day 1 of the creative process. Even if you help by sharing this crowdfunding page, it's really appreciated!

The producer of my upcoming Ep is the amazing Carsten Skov, and we are actually already working hard in the studio! The first single "Irony" is out on all streaming platforms, so check it out on the top, where you will find the youtube video! Remember to let me know how you like the sound!

Thank you so much, and looking forward to going through this process with You!

All my love,
Malene

story:
¡Bienvenidos!

¡Hola! Mi nombre es Maga Urdaneta, soy una cantautora de Caracas, Venezuela y ¡quiero darte la bienvenida a la página de mi proyecto!

Con esta campaña estoy buscando recolectar fondos para grabar, mezclar y masterizar mi primer álbum solista “El Mundo va a cambiar” que reúne mis composiciones originales que combinan elementos musicales de géneros como el pop, la música tradicional venezolana/latinoamericana y el jazz.

He estado trabajando en este proyecto FUSIÓN desde hace 2 años. El año pasado empecé a trabajar con el increíble maestro, músico y guitarrista venezolano Roldan Peña como mi productor, y hasta la fecha hemos creado 6 hermosos arreglos, llenos de energía y onda nueva. Roldan me ha ayudado a armar un “dream team” de músicos para grabar este disco, proceso que ya está en marcha, pero que aún falta un largo camino por recorrer para convertirlo en álbum completo.

Este trabajo es importante para mí porque realmente creo que hará una contribución al repertorio contemporáneo de la música venezolana y le dará un vistazo a la música de cantautor que se está haciendo en Venezuela. Y aun más importante, porque me darás la oportunidad de mostrar mi música, retratos de nuestra historia y promover nuestra cultura en un país donde básicamente nos estamos dedicando a sobrevivir.

Los escenarios

Crear este álbum ha sido un enorme reto, especialmente porque estamos enfrentando un obstáculo poco común, como los recientes apagones que nos dejan inhabilitados en todo sentido.

Hasta la fecha hemos grabado 45% del EP: Forastero (afro fusión), El mundo va a cambiar (Onda nueva), El tiempo (samba pop), ¿Qué será? (Pop-jazz), Perdóname (balada jazz) y Tu partida (tonada). Estas son las 6 canciones que están siendo grabadas hasta el momento.

Hemos tenido 5 sesiones de estudio en las que se han grabado los siguientes instrumentos:

Baterías (César Villarroel y Miguel D’ Vicenzo) Bajo  (Jorge Ramoncini y Giovanni Ramírez), Guitarras (Maga Urdaneta), Guitarras eléctricas (Roldan Peña).

Aun debo cubrir el costo de los otros músicos que están participando en el proyecto y las horas de estudio derivadas.

¿Para qué utilizaré los fondos?

  • Para cubrir el costo de grabación de las 6 canciones del EP + Producir y grabar 4 canciones adicionales para completar un álbum de 10 canciones. Esto incluye las horas de estudio, personal técnico y los músicos.
  • Proceso de mezcla y masterizado.
  • Distribución digital y realización del disco físico.

¡Por eso es que estoy solicitando tu apoyo y en retribución tendrás estas recompensas diferentes!

- Descarga digital del single (antes de su estreno)

- Descarga digital del álbum “El Mundo va a Cambiar” + una carta personal dirigida hacia ti acerca del proyecto.

-  ¡Contenido exclusivo! Con tu contribución te enviaré actualizaciones, imágenes y videos del proceso de grabación, entrevistas al equipo involucrado en la producción.

- Álbum físico + poster firmado por mí (aunque no soy famosa, me gustaría enviarte mi agradecimiento, con mi puño y letra)

- Libro digital con las letras y cifrados de las canciones.

- ¡¡Una canción escondida!! Sí, una grabación  de una canción escondida que no estará contemplada en el álbum.

NOTA IMPORTANTE: Incluso si no llego a la meta final, los fondos estarán destinados a la grabación del disco.

¿Quién es Maga?

Mi nombre es María Gabriela, pero todos mis amigos me llaman Maga. He estado en la música desde los 5 años, cantando en coros y estudiantinas, que son grupos instrumentales de música tradicional venezolana. Estudié comunicación social en la Universidad Santa María y, mientras estudiaba allí, ingresé a la Estudiantina de la Universidad Santa María, llegando a ser la directora artística de dicha agrupación, presentándonos en diversos eventos culturales dentro y fuera del campus, incluyendo una gira por Lima-Perú. Me he presentado en diversos espacios culturales, eventos y festivales en Caracas, Venezuela, incluyendo el Trasnocho Cultural, Centro Cultural Chacao, Festival Por el Medio de la Calle 2012, III festival de Vino de El Hatillo, Festival de Lectura de El Hatillo, Hatillo Fest, Librería Lugar Común, Centro de Arte Los Galpones, Concha Acústica de Bello Monte, entre otros.

Estudié música en el Taller de Jazz de Caracas bajo la tutela de maestros como Oscar Fanega y Luis González; también estudié en la Escuela Contemporánea de la Voz con maestros como Alejandro Zavala, Hana Kobayashi, Mariana Serrrano y Marycel González. Actualmente estudio canto con la maestra Marisela Leal. He estudiado composición popular con el maestro Henry Martínez y adicionalmente he estado trabajando, desde el 2015, como freelancer, haciendo música corporativa y música popular para diversos clientes alrededor del mundo.

También tengo una banda que pueden escuchar aquí:

Ile des Phoques

Y mi canal de youtube donde posteo arreglos de canciones que me gustan mucho!! Es como mi diario musical personal.

 

Riesgos y Desafíos

El riesgo y desafío más importante es que vivo en un país en crisis. Venezuela está atravesando uno de los períodos más oscuros de su historia, viviendo una crisis humanitaria sin precedentes.

El mayor reto para ejecutar el plan, en este momento, es superar los cortes eléctricos, los cuales no podemos controlar. A pesar de todo, continuamos trabajando todos los días e incluso aunque el proyecto sufra demoras por esta razón, será completado.

¡¡Gracias!!!

Puedes ayudarme regando la voz, compartiendo esta campaña o contribuir económicamente al proyecto. ¡Te agradezco por haber leído hasta aquí! Tu energía me motiva a seguir adelante. ¡¡Gracias!!

--

Welcome!

Hi! my name is Maga Urdaneta, i'm a singer-songwritter from Caracas, Venezuela and i'd like to welcome you to my project page!

With this campaign i'm looking to gather funds to record, mix and master my first solo album "El Mundo va a cambiar" (The world is going to change) that gathers my original songs which combines musical elements from genres like pop, venezuelan and latam traditional music and jazz. I've been working on this FUSION since these past 2 years.

In 2019 i started to work with the amazing venezuelan master, musician and guitarist Roldan Peña as my producer, and we have created 6 beautiful arrangements, full of energy and new wave. Roldan have helped me to put together a dream team of musicians to record this album, which we already started, but there's still a long way to go to complete the full album.

This work is important for me because i truly believe it'll make a contribution to the contemporary repertoire of venezuelan music and will give a new glimpse to the songwritter's music that's being written in Venezuela. And most importantly because you'll give me the opportunity to show my music, faces of our recent history and promote our culture in a country where we are basically dedicated to survive.

The Stages

Create this album has been a huge challenge, specially because we're facing with not common obstacles like the recent blackouts. 

Currently we've recorded 45% of the EP: Forastero (afro-fusion), El mundo va a cambiar (new-wave), El tiempo (samba-pop), ¿Qué será? (pop-jazz), Perdóname (jazz ballad) and Tu partida (tonada) are the 6 songs being recorded so far.

We've had 5 studio sessions in which we have recorded: Drums (César Villaroel and Miguel D'Vicenzo), Bass (Jorge Ramonicini and Giovanni Ramírez), Guitars (Maga Urdaneta), Electric Guitars (Roldan Peña).

Still need to cover cost of the other musicians which are participating in the project and the remaining studio recording hours.

What will i use the funds for?

  • To cover the cost of recording of the 6 songs from the EP + Produce and record 4 more songs to complete a 10 song Album. This includes studio hours, tecnical team and musicians.
  • Mix and mastering process
  • Distribute digital album and make the physical album.

That's why i'm asking for your support and in exchange you will get different rewards such as:

- Digital download of the single (before it's released)

- Digital download of the Album "El mundo va a cambiar" + a personal letter about the project

-  Exclusive Content!: With your contribution i will send you updates, images and videos of the recording process, and interviews of the team involved in the production.

- Physical album + signed poster by me (even i'm not a famous person, i'd like to send you my gratitude, with my own handwritting)

- Digital ebook with lyrics and scores of the songs

- A hidden song!! Yep, a recording of a hidden song that won't be on this album.

IMPORTANT NOTE: Even if i do not make the entire goal, the funds will go to the album.

 

Who is Maga?

My name is María Gabriela, and people call me Maga. I've been in music since i was 5 years old, singing in choirs and "Estudiantinas" which are venezuelan instrumental music groups. I studied communications and journalism at Santa María University. In there i became the artistic director of the Estudiantina of Santa María University, performing in several cultural events in and outside of campus, including a tour at Lima - Perú. I've performed in many cultural places, events and festivals in Caracas, Venezuela, including Trasnocho Cultural, Chacao Cultural Center, "Por el Medio de la Calle 2012" Festival, El Hatillo Wine Festival, Festival de Lectura de El Hatillo, Hatillo Fest, Librería Lugar Común, Art Center Los Galpones, among others.

I studied music at Caracas Jazz Workshop with masters like Oscar Fanega and Luis González, and at the Contemporary School of the Voice with masters like Alejandro Zavala, Hana Kobayashi, Mariana Serrano, Marycel González. Currently i'm studying with my master Marisela Leal. I've studied popular composition with master Henry Martínez and have been working since 2015 as a freelancer, making corporate and popular music for diverse clients worldwide.

I also have a band which you can hear here:

Ile des Phoques

 

And my youtube channel where i post my arrangements of songs i really like! it's like my personal journal. 

 

 

 

Risks & Challenges

The most imposrtant risk and challenge is that i live in a country in crisis. Venezuela's being through the darkest period of it's history, with an unprecedented humanitarian crisis.

The biggest challenge to execute the plan, right now, is to overcome the electric blackouts, which we cannot control. Despite of all, we keep working everyday and even if the project gets delayed for this reason, it'll be completed.

 

Thank you!!!

You can help me by spreading the word, sharing this campaign or contribute financially to the project. I'd like to thank you for reading up to this stage! your energy motivates me to keep going! Thanks!!!
story_txt:
¡Bienvenidos!
¡Hola! Mi nombre es Maga Urdaneta, soy una cantautora de Caracas, Venezuela y ¡quiero darte la bienvenida a la página de mi proyecto!
Con esta campaña estoy buscando recolectar fondos para grabar, mezclar y masterizar mi primer álbum solista “El Mundo va a cambiar” que reúne mis composiciones originales que combinan elementos musicales de géneros como el pop, la música tradicional venezolana/latinoamericana y el jazz.
He estado trabajando en este proyecto FUSIÓN desde hace 2 años. El año pasado empecé a trabajar con el increíble maestro, músico y guitarrista venezolano Roldan Peña como mi productor, y hasta la fecha hemos creado 6 hermosos arreglos, llenos de energía y onda nueva. Roldan me ha ayudado a armar un “dream team” de músicos para grabar este disco, proceso que ya está en marcha, pero que aún falta un largo camino por recorrer para convertirlo en álbum completo.
Este trabajo es importante para mí porque realmente creo que hará una contribución al repertorio contemporáneo de la música venezolana y le dará un vistazo a la música de cantautor que se está haciendo en Venezuela. Y aun más importante, porque me darás la oportunidad de mostrar mi música, retratos de nuestra historia y promover nuestra cultura en un país donde básicamente nos estamos dedicando a sobrevivir.
Los escenarios
Crear este álbum ha sido un enorme reto, especialmente porque estamos enfrentando un obstáculo poco común, como los recientes apagones que nos dejan inhabilitados en todo sentido.
Hasta la fecha hemos grabado 45% del EP: Forastero (afro fusión), El mundo va a cambiar (Onda nueva), El tiempo (samba pop), ¿Qué será? (Pop-jazz), Perdóname (balada jazz) y Tu partida (tonada). Estas son las 6 canciones que están siendo grabadas hasta el momento.
Hemos tenido 5 sesiones de estudio en las que se han grabado los siguientes instrumentos:
Baterías (César Villarroel y Miguel D’ Vicenzo) Bajo  (Jorge Ramoncini y Giovanni Ramírez), Guitarras (Maga Urdaneta), Guitarras eléctricas (Roldan Peña).
Aun debo cubrir el costo de los otros músicos que están participando en el proyecto y las horas de estudio derivadas.
¿Para qué utilizaré los fondos?

Para cubrir el costo de grabación de las 6 canciones del EP + Producir y grabar 4 canciones adicionales para completar un álbum de 10 canciones. Esto incluye las horas de estudio, personal técnico y los músicos.
Proceso de mezcla y masterizado.
Distribución digital y realización del disco físico.

¡Por eso es que estoy solicitando tu apoyo y en retribución tendrás estas recompensas diferentes!

- Descarga digital del single (antes de su estreno)
- Descarga digital del álbum “El Mundo va a Cambiar” + una carta personal dirigida hacia ti acerca del proyecto.
-  ¡Contenido exclusivo! Con tu contribución te enviaré actualizaciones, imágenes y videos del proceso de grabación, entrevistas al equipo involucrado en la producción.
- Álbum físico + poster firmado por mí (aunque no soy famosa, me gustaría enviarte mi agradecimiento, con mi puño y letra)
- Libro digital con las letras y cifrados de las canciones.
- ¡¡Una canción escondida!! Sí, una grabación  de una canción escondida que no estará contemplada en el álbum.
NOTA IMPORTANTE: Incluso si no llego a la meta final, los fondos estarán destinados a la grabación del disco.
¿Quién es Maga?

Mi nombre es María Gabriela, pero todos mis amigos me llaman Maga. He estado en la música desde los 5 años, cantando en coros y estudiantinas, que son grupos instrumentales de música tradicional venezolana. Estudié comunicación social en la Universidad Santa María y, mientras estudiaba allí, ingresé a la Estudiantina de la Universidad Santa María, llegando a ser la directora artística de dicha agrupación, presentándonos en diversos eventos culturales dentro y fuera del campus, incluyendo una gira por Lima-Perú. Me he presentado en diversos espacios culturales, eventos y festivales en Caracas, Venezuela, incluyendo el Trasnocho Cultural, Centro Cultural Chacao, Festival Por el Medio de la Calle 2012, III festival de Vino de El Hatillo, Festival de Lectura de El Hatillo, Hatillo Fest, Librería Lugar Común, Centro de Arte Los Galpones, Concha Acústica de Bello Monte, entre otros.
Estudié música en el Taller de Jazz de Caracas bajo la tutela de maestros como Oscar Fanega y Luis González; también estudié en la Escuela Contemporánea de la Voz con maestros como Alejandro Zavala, Hana Kobayashi, Mariana Serrrano y Marycel González. Actualmente estudio canto con la maestra Marisela Leal. He estudiado composición popular con el maestro Henry Martínez y adicionalmente he estado trabajando, desde el 2015, como freelancer, haciendo música corporativa y música popular para diversos clientes alrededor del mundo.
También tengo una banda que pueden escuchar aquí:
Ile des Phoques

Y mi canal de youtube donde posteo arreglos de canciones que me gustan mucho!! Es como mi diario musical personal.


 

Riesgos y Desafíos
El riesgo y desafío más importante es que vivo en un país en crisis. Venezuela está atravesando uno de los períodos más oscuros de su historia, viviendo una crisis humanitaria sin precedentes.
El mayor reto para ejecutar el plan, en este momento, es superar los cortes eléctricos, los cuales no podemos controlar. A pesar de todo, continuamos trabajando todos los días e incluso aunque el proyecto sufra demoras por esta razón, será completado.
¡¡Gracias!!!
Puedes ayudarme regando la voz, compartiendo esta campaña o contribuir económicamente al proyecto. ¡Te agradezco por haber leído hasta aquí! Tu energía me motiva a seguir adelante. ¡¡Gracias!!
--

Welcome!
Hi! my name is Maga Urdaneta, i'm a singer-songwritter from Caracas, Venezuela and i'd like to welcome you to my project page!
With this campaign i'm looking to gather funds to record, mix and master my first solo album "El Mundo va a cambiar" (The world is going to change) that gathers my original songs which combines musical elements from genres like pop, venezuelan and latam traditional music and jazz. I've been working on this FUSION since these past 2 years.
In 2019 i started to work with the amazing venezuelan master, musician and guitarist Roldan Peña as my producer, and we have created 6 beautiful arrangements, full of energy and new wave. Roldan have helped me to put together a dream team of musicians to record this album, which we already started, but there's still a long way to go to complete the full album.
This work is important for me because i truly believe it'll make a contribution to the contemporary repertoire of venezuelan music and will give a new glimpse to the songwritter's music that's being written in Venezuela. And most importantly because you'll give me the opportunity to show my music, faces of our recent history and promote our culture in a country where we are basically dedicated to survive.
The Stages
Create this album has been a huge challenge, specially because we're facing with not common obstacles like the recent blackouts. 
Currently we've recorded 45% of the EP: Forastero (afro-fusion), El mundo va a cambiar (new-wave), El tiempo (samba-pop), ¿Qué será? (pop-jazz), Perdóname (jazz ballad) and Tu partida (tonada) are the 6 songs being recorded so far.
We've had 5 studio sessions in which we have recorded: Drums (César Villaroel and Miguel D'Vicenzo), Bass (Jorge Ramonicini and Giovanni Ramírez), Guitars (Maga Urdaneta), Electric Guitars (Roldan Peña).
Still need to cover cost of the other musicians which are participating in the project and the remaining studio recording hours.
What will i use the funds for?

To cover the cost of recording of the 6 songs from the EP + Produce and record 4 more songs to complete a 10 song Album. This includes studio hours, tecnical team and musicians.
Mix and mastering process
Distribute digital album and make the physical album.

That's why i'm asking for your support and in exchange you will get different rewards such as:

- Digital download of the single (before it's released)
- Digital download of the Album "El mundo va a cambiar" + a personal letter about the project
-  Exclusive Content!: With your contribution i will send you updates, images and videos of the recording process, and interviews of the team involved in the production.
- Physical album + signed poster by me (even i'm not a famous person, i'd like to send you my gratitude, with my own handwritting)
- Digital ebook with lyrics and scores of the songs
- A hidden song!! Yep, a recording of a hidden song that won't be on this album.
IMPORTANT NOTE: Even if i do not make the entire goal, the funds will go to the album.

 

Who is Maga?

My name is María Gabriela, and people call me Maga. I've been in music since i was 5 years old, singing in choirs and "Estudiantinas" which are venezuelan instrumental music groups. I studied communications and journalism at Santa María University. In there i became the artistic director of the Estudiantina of Santa María University, performing in several cultural events in and outside of campus, including a tour at Lima - Perú. I've performed in many cultural places, events and festivals in Caracas, Venezuela, including Trasnocho Cultural, Chacao Cultural Center, "Por el Medio de la Calle 2012" Festival, El Hatillo Wine Festival, Festival de Lectura de El Hatillo, Hatillo Fest, Librería Lugar Común, Art Center Los Galpones, among others.
I studied music at Caracas Jazz Workshop with masters like Oscar Fanega and Luis González, and at the Contemporary School of the Voice with masters like Alejandro Zavala, Hana Kobayashi, Mariana Serrano, Marycel González. Currently i'm studying with my master Marisela Leal. I've studied popular composition with master Henry Martínez and have been working since 2015 as a freelancer, making corporate and popular music for diverse clients worldwide.
I also have a band which you can hear here:
Ile des Phoques

 
And my youtube channel where i post my arrangements of songs i really like! it's like my personal journal. 


 

 
 
Risks & Challenges


The most imposrtant risk and challenge is that i live in a country in crisis. Venezuela's being through the darkest period of it's history, with an unprecedented humanitarian crisis.
The biggest challenge to execute the plan, right now, is to overcome the electric blackouts, which we cannot control. Despite of all, we keep working everyday and even if the project gets delayed for this reason, it'll be completed.


 
Thank you!!!
You can help me by spreading the word, sharing this campaign or contribute financially to the project. I'd like to thank you for reading up to this stage! your energy motivates me to keep going! Thanks!!!

story:
Hello All,

Welcome to the campaign for the new Oceanship album Time.

Whether you're new to Oceanship, or a legacy supporter, I hope you're doing well out there.  It will have been a while since I've spoke to many of you: perhaps since the last campaign.  

Regarding this effort, the most important thing I can say is please watch all of the video above.  This is not a typical crowdfunding effort for me, as you will see.

For those of you who don't want to buy anything, but want to contribute, or want to contribute in addition to purchasing an item, just click the Back It button at the top of the page. 

Any questions or comments, send me a message here or through whichever relevant social media, and I'll answer asap.

Alright, I'm confident we can do this.  This new material is — already at the pre-production stage — the best Oceanship material by a country mile.  It is unlike anything released to date.  I will be using the money from this campaign to hire the best co-producer, guitar, bass, drums, keys, bass, and orchestral players, as well as a world-class mix and mastering engineer.  


Brad/Oceanship

story:
I'll keep it short.

Hey! 

I'm Dakota Leigh. I’m a singer-songwriter, born and raised in Jersey City, NJ. I moved to Nashville a couple years ago and fall more in love with music every day. I've been playing, writing, and co-writing a ton recently and I'm finally ready to lay down some music and share what I've been working on.

I'm planning on releasing two singles at first, and then a 5 song EP. These songs are honest and real, and while it is scary to be vulnerable, it is also freeing. I am so excited to share my story and my songs with you, and I only hope that they make you feel something.

 

How You Can Help

Being an independent artist is no easy feat... they don't call us "starving" for nothin'. (I do love a good PB & J sandwich though!)

Your contribution and support will pay for the studio time as well as the artwork and promotion that goes into releasing new music.

~

If you can't contribute financially, please feel free to share this campaign with family and friends and on social media. And give me a follow on Instagram @lovealwayskota for updates!

xoxo Kota

story:
Short Summary

My name is Caitelen. I'm a singer-songwriter, multi-instrument musician, composer, worship leader, poet, mama, and pastor's wife. 

Here's a little bit of my story:

I've been singing/performing since I was a 2, and writing, recording, and performing my original music since the age of 12. I've released albums, singles, and other collaborative works since 2010 and have been a worship leader for almost 20 years. 

In 2015 I was diagnosed with a chronic illness called ME/CFS. The extreme pain, fatigue, and other physical limitations I experienced then, and continue to battle today, have taken me to some dark places physically, emotionally, and spiritually. These limitations weighed heavily on me as I wrestled deeply with doubt, pain, fear, and grief. But in that process, my eyes and heart were also opening to the ways I could see God at work for good.

There's more to the story, but all of this has been fuel for the songwriting fire! These songs are personal, but I know they're part of a shared story I have with others who also battle chronic illness, doubt, fear, and questions of God's purpose in seasons of fallow. They are, like many of the Psalms, both honest about struggle, and filled with hope in the midst of pain. I pray that they will be a balm and blessing to many, and to point them to the One in whom we have a living hope.

It is my prayer, and my plan, to record, produce and send these songs out into the world.

That said, it costs costs a lot of money to produce a record! This platform (Indiegogo) is for financial contributions toward that end, but if you would like to support me in another way (some friends have opened their homes for fundraising concerts, some have made helpful connections for me in the music world,  and many of you simply support me in prayer and words of encouragement), I welcome and appreciate and all support!  

So... will you sow into this project with me? 

Will you join me in bringing the stories and songs of "Telltale Heart" into the world?

What We Need & What You Get

The Lowdown on $$ and perks you'll get when you contribute:

  • I've got 14 songs ready to go. Some will be on an album, and a few will be released as singles or 2-3 song EP's (mini-albums). We need $25,000 to finish recording (studio time, paying other musicians, engineering costs), producing (mixing and mastering the songs), and distributing (digital distribution, Cd's and vinyl).  
  • What do you get out of it? Besides the music itself and the chance to be part of making it, I'm offering special pre-release access to the music before anyone else hears it! Other perks of becoming a backer include getting some fun merchandise from my Undone by Grace and Dark Is Light albums, opportunities for us to meet and workshop some of YOUR work, opportunities to obtain the title of "producer" on one or more songs, and more! Check out all the perks to the right (click the box to the see more details on them).  
  • I've opted for "Flexible Funding" so that whatever funds come in will go toward completing the album and if we don't make the goal, we will still get to keep what came in.
  • If you've followed my previous music endeavors, you'll know that I work with some amazing and talented musicians and producers who have helped me produce high quality music. Excellence in production remains a high priority for this album, so what you hear when all is said and done will not disappoint! And this is another reason why raising the proper funds to pay my engineers and musicians is crucial!

The Impact

How and why is this project of value to you and to the world?

  • Most of the songs on this album are more reflective, poetic, and introspective. Although my faith informs my writing, these are songs that can be enjoyed by a wide audience. My goal is not to force my beliefs on anyone, but to invite listeners into a story of mercy, forgiveness, and hope in the trials that life throws at us all. 
  • Some are expressly for the edification of the church in the context of worship. That is, they're worship songs intended to be taught and sung together in a corporate setting. I've already been sharing them in that context, but finishing production on them means more people and churches can hear and sing them as well! 
  • I've had the privilege of taking my music on the road quite a bit, leading worship and playing solo concerts. I plan to continue that as I am able to. In the next year, my music ministry will be taking me to California, Italy, Greece, Turkey, and some other U.S. locations. In the Fall, I will travel to Cuba to share my story and songs with some friends who are doing amazing things in the art community and the church there.  I've begun translating some of my music into Spanish to be able to share some of my songs in their heart language. Your support  on this project is a huge part of my  ministry in taking these songs around the world!

Other Ways You Can Help

Every little bit helps and none of it is taken for granted. Than you!

  • Spread the word! Help me make some noise about my campaign!! Share this site, and my posts, on social media, forward links to friends who might be interested, etc. 
  • Host a free event! Some friends have opened their homes and invited a few of their friends over, allowing me to fundraise that way. This would be different than the "perk" listed to the right. Instead of paying the fee to hire me solo or with a band, you'd "host" a small event at which I can share my passion and project with your friends. 
  • Volunteer! I've got some live shows coming up and can always use some help running the merch table, setting up, tearing down, etc. Let me know if you're interested in helping!
  • Pray! I want this endeavor to be aligned with God's will for my life, my family, and my music ministry. Please pray that I would keep focused on the right things, that I would continue to support Greg in his pastoral ministry, and that our kids would see and feel God's love in this process as well.

Spread the word! Help me make some noise about my campaign!! Share this site, and my posts, on social media, forward links to friends who might be interested, etc.

story:
Summary

My name is Nate Jones, and I believe in certain fundamental values about this thing we call life:

  • Be yourself and live your truth, the universe loves your uniqueness
  • Do what's important to you, and don't let discouragement steal your determination
  • Create a picture in your mind of what you desire, and act as if you already possess it
  • Express the love you feel for others freely and readily, be a source of peace and inspiration

What I Need from You & What You Get from Me!

  • My funding goal is $7500, in consideration of how much I have spent on booking agents, artist representation, professional recording studio services, music video productions, etc.
  • I have several exciting perks to offer for different levels of contribution to my campaign, including artwork, music lessons, a lyric book, private live performances, and much more!
  • Even if I don't reach my entire goal, the amount raised will help immensely, and you still get your perks either way !

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Most is one of, if not the most valued and cherished form of art in human history
  • By contributing, you are helping me spread peace and joy through music to all the world
  • In today's connected society, a message can spread like wildfire, and it it my goal to promote collaboration, compassion, joy, and mindfulness through music!

Risks & Challenges

In my journey to become a professional musician,I have faced many risks and obstacles along the way to achieving all of my goals. It is not easy, but what drives me is the support from my family, friends, and fans, fueling my desire to share my gifts and give people truly good music that heals.

  • I promise to all of you reading this, that I will never give up my pursuit of these goals.
  • My plan is to way up each day and create as much joy as possible in my life and others'.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people aren't in a position to contribute financially, but that doesn't mean they can't help!

  • Please share this campaign with anyone you know who appreciates music and connection!
  • You can share right from the Indiegogo page!
  • Listen to "Safe as We Can" on Spotify,  Youtube, CDBaby or Apple Music!

And that's all there is to it. Thank you everyone, so much !!

Be yourself and live your truth, the universe loves your uniqueness

story:
Hello everyone, my name is Jason West. I am a movie cinematographer/ director/ producer. I am a graduate of the George A. Romero film making program at Douglas Education Center in Monessen, Pennsylvania. I graduated top of my class and received every award possible while I was in college. I have worked with movie legends such as Tom Savini, Doug Bradley, Josh Stewart, Dean Cain, Kevin Sorbo and much more. My goal is to bring to life a "Creepshow" like anthology of music videos from the world renowned horror punk band, Grave Robber. I have known this band since 2008, and I have been a huge fan since then. However, my passion alone will not get this project made, and that's why we need your help.

Grave Robber needs your help raising funds for their first ever anthology for their "Escaping the Grave" album. You will be treated with visuals from an amazing team of Tom Savini and George Romero's graduates along with new and fresh talent. You can expect to have the Hell scared out of you with these music videos.

Our goal with this campaign is to raise $7,000 in order to afford the overall cost of Principle Photography and Post Production for the film. This funding will allow our team access to the proper Camera and Lighting Equipment, Special Make-Up FX, Costumes, Props, and several other Production Costs including some of our wonder perks for our backers! 

 

What you can do to help

So basically, we need help from you (the fans). Our goal is $7000 and anything after that will go toward making this project even better. As you scroll down the right side of the screen you will notice the perk packages. The more you donate, the better the perk! All the items on the list have limits, so act fast so you can guarantee your merchandise. You will also notice a featured perk; a "free" concert within a 4 hour drive of the Fort Wayne, Indiana area. That's right, you could have Grave Robber playing a concert in your living room, or you could convince a local venue to have them play for just a $500 donation!!! So please share this with everyone you know!

 

Risks & Challenges

Look, we know how hard it is to open your wallet and take chances on a campaign like this. Just be assured that this anthology is for you, the fans. Not only are we doing this for the fans, but we are doing this in memory of George Romero. He is not only my mentor, but he is my hero and my inspiration to be the best film maker I can be.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you still can't help. Here are some other ways you can help:

Share this campaign link to as many friends as possible.

Share it as often as you can and on as many social media platforms as you can.

story:
Short Summary

Skies Like Rockets is a rock band consisting of Nate Theriault, Ethan Bliss, Jake Joyner and Luke Woodruff. Together we fuse elements of pop punk, alt-rock, emo and pop rock. Earlier this year we released two singles, "Colorblind" and "Safe". We will be releasing an EP of 5 brand new songs this fall. We have complete faith in these tunes and realize that the next step to achieving our goals is to record in a high quality studio. It has been our dream for years to make our collection of songs the best they can be. For the next 30 days (ending July 28), we will be raising money to fund this dream. Please assist us in reaching our goal by making a contribution today or selecting one the perks we are offering.

 

Why We Need Your Help

Here is a quick rundown of all expenses that our campaign is covering: 

  • Tracking: $1800 - Tracking is the major part of the cost when recording an album. We will need roughly 3 full days in the studio ($600 each). Additional hours will be roughly $85/hrs (based off rates of local studios). 
  • Mixing: $400 - Mixing is often done hourly and with the studio rates above we calculated it will be no less than $400. 
  • Mastering: $250 - Mastering is the process done after mixing and gives the recordings balance, dynamic and loudness. It is just as essential as mixing and rates are on average $50 per song. 
  • CD Printing: $300 - Printing our EP onto CD is a big part of this campaign. We put lots of work into the artwork of our music and it will be a focal point of our future promotional methods as well as an item to sell at ours shows.
  • Campaign Fees: $250 - Indiegogo is an amazing platform and the service they provide is invaluable, but the rates will be slightly higher if we don't reach our goal. Other fees also included are part of the shipping/product costs for all the merch rewards we offer.
  • Total: $3000 - If we reach our goal and exceed the amount of $3000, we will be putting those funds into recording more of our songs. We have actually have more songs we wish to record but we felt 5 songs was an attainable goal. On the other hand, if we don't reach $3000 all the funds will go to tracking a smaller number of songs. 

Your Impact

Everyone who listens to our music and comes to ours shows means the world to us. That's why we are giving back in return. Anyone who contributes to this goal can opt to receive an accompanying perk or reward. We put a lot of thought into these perks and hope they are exciting for our fans, friends and family.  

Please consider making a donation to this project today. Any support you give will have a major impact on us and our music. We want you to know, that honestly, any contribution is greatly appreciated.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

You can also help us tremendously by sharing this project with friends/family or on social media platforms. Any gesture or contribution goes a long way. Indiegogo has some great sharing tools (see above) to make it easy!

Thank you for being a fan and friend, for taking the time to listen to our songs and videos, and for giving us amazing feedback. Your support means everything to us. 

Love,

Your Boys in Skies Like Rockets

story:
I'm a lifelong activist, labor organizer and educator, and I work with veterans and senior citizens in more than 60 homes on both coasts and in Australia. My life is my music and I've dedicated myself to bringing joy to old folks and veterans when not touring and promoting my own work. Your help will ensure I can continue to do this!

 

The songs:

 Did it Really Happen Here?

 1960s Holiday 

 We Have Fed You All for a Thousand Years

 Nothing Left to Say

 There is Nothing Like a Mother’s Love

 How Can I Keep from Singing?

 Oklahoma’s Son

 I Don’t Know How We Made It Home

 This Island Ain’t Big Enough

Every Loser Was Someone Once

Hood River Roll On

Fishing at the End of the World

All songs by George Mann except:

“We Have Fed You All for a Thousand Years” by

“an unknown proletarian” 

“How Can I Keep from Singing?” traditional with third verse by Doris Plenn.

“Hood River Roll On” by Utah Phillips.

story:
WHO AM I AND WHY DO I SING?

I am a passionate, adventurous mathematician who teaches religion, music and drama in the beautiful Sunshine State of Queensland, Australia. I love to travel, eat avocado, walk through lychee fields and gaze at beautiful creations such as waterfalls or hedges. 

I had an epiphany once about how amazing it is that music can so beautifully capture wonderful concepts and life lessons within a melody. I fell in love with writing songs for and about my God. I am passionate about music and I truly believe it is such a great way to encourage souls on their journey in this life.

In 2013, I was privileged enough to release my first EP at the age of 19. My second EP came along in 2016 AND now it's time for number THREE :) 

Through this music, I desire for all to know God for who He truly is. Love. For listeners to know how desperately and unconditionally He loves you. I hope to always write songs for Christ and to embrace any chance to share them with others.

Money going towards PLUS check out deals on the side!

The money will go to recording, producing, mixing, mastering, printing, distributing and everything to with the new CD! 

Thanks for even considering donating - I'm super grateful and hope you are encouraged and inspired by the music God has put into my life! If you can't give also, I value your prayers and support just as much! 

Oiiii, here is an awesome verse to inspire your life!

1 Peter 1:8-9
Though you have not seen him, you love him; and even though you do not see him now, you believe in him and are filled with an inexpressible and glorious joy, for you are receiving the end result of your faith, the salvation of your souls.

Peace. Love. Epiphanies.

Anna :)

story:
Welcome! We are The String Revolution and we are raising donations for promotion for our new cd "Red Drops." We're excited about the new recording and would like to get it out to as many people as possible. With your help, we will be able to have more press, more radio, and more touring to help spread the word about our cd as well as our unique band. We have some amazing perks for your donations and we would be honored and grateful to have your support and be a part of reaching our goal!

We're looking to reach a $7,000 goal which will go towards hiring a PRO music PR company that works specifically with guitar orientated artists. They will help us with social media, cd reviews, television appearances, and features in music and guitar magazines in print and online. This is an absolute MUST for any artist releasing a new product. The donations will also go towards hiring a radio promoter to help get us airplay on college, satallite radio, and internet radio which helps spread the word about "Red Drops." Lastly, the donations will also go towards tour promotion and support, such as submitting to overseas guitar festivals. There are 3 major ones in Australia that we are being considered for and festival/tour live appearances are absolutely necessary for artists to get more promotion.

We all feel we are at that point where we need to step it up with press, radio, and touring and we are convinced we have the recordings and live show experience to back it up! We want you to be a part of this journey to help bring the band to the next level!

When you see a feature about our band and our record in "Guitar Player" magazine, for example, you will know that YOU were a part of making that happen. When you see a video of us playing live at "The Sydney Guitar Festival" in Australia, you will know that YOU were a part of making that happen too. We want you involved. We don't just play this music for ourselves, we record it, and we play it for you.

We are giving away some awesome perks in exchange for your generous donations; CD's, tee-shirts, posters, limited edition vinyl, house concerts, and even an acoustic Fender guitar! If you don't feel comfortable donating on Indie-gogo please contact us (info@thestringrevolution.com) and we can give you the paypal address or a snail mail address that you can use instead.

We would love you to be a part of making these things happen for The String Revolution. You are now the record label. EVERY single penny will go towards all of these things listed above for promotion. You will contribute to keeping great music (with hard working musicians) on the radio, in the press, and on the road.

We appreciate any and all you can do for us and thank you so much for stopping by our campaign!
