story:
Hunter

Music has always been at the center of my life, from when I was 4 years old I had invented my own super hero who had incredible strength, so long as they were listening to music. As soon as the music stopped they would perish, as if superman had just come into contact with kryptonite. I know that I am not unique in feeling like music is the very life force energy that runs through our veins and creates our entire reality. This unbelievably intense and intimate connection with music is what inspired me to pick up a guitar at 8 years old and begin my path as a musician. Since then I've spent time playing in Orchestras, Rock bands, Jazz bands, Funk bands and exposing myself to as many different styles and people as I possibly could. 

Due to the climate of the world we live in right now, it has become clear to me that we are in need of love, communication and community. As someone who desires to be an active participant in the community, it feels like it is time to step forward and offer what I can. During some of my experiences performing and sharing I've seen people dance, laugh, cry and love together, and these have been the most satisfying and fulfilling moments of my life this far. It is more of the dancing, more of the crying, and especially more of the loving that I wish to bring into our world and this is my mission with music. 

And Gathering 

It is with the support and love of my musical family that I will bring these messages to you:

The band-

  • Lucian Lianti (Certified Cool Cat)- Keys and percussion 
  • Jackie Rush (Groove machine)- Drum kit
  • Tristan Heineke (Harmonic and Melodic Wizard)- Bass 
  • Hunter Emigh (Oontz Factor)- Rhythm Guitar and Vocals
  • There will be other special family as well that will be announced on the album 

We will be recording at Sound Asylum studios in Santa Ana, CA on November 12th and 13th, and are so excited to be working with the sound crew over there, they are amazing at what they do. Please check out their website www.sound-asylum.com to listen to other artists they have helped on their journey. 

The album will be Mixed and Mastered by an incredible Musician and dear friend of mine Mr. Eric Van Thyne who is currently pursuing his career in music as well in Los Angeles, CA. 

The release date of the Album will be announced in the middle of November, expect the album to drop in the beginning of December, 2018. 

Please come and join us as well on October 28th, 2018 in Santa Ana, we are offering a full band live performance of the entire album for YOU! We will be holding space for gathering together in sacred dance and divine love. Please see our public Facebook event page "Hunter and Gathering pre-recording live performance" for details. 

https://www.facebook.com/events/332403157532869/

 

Our Intention 

We wish to provide you with music that connects you to your higher self. We want to hold space for your healing and your inner light to shine through and present itself to the world. We want to create a universe for you to loose yourself in dance and laughter. Everyone is in need of unconditional love, and this is our way of communicating that to you. Thank you and much love family.

We wish to provide you with music that connects you to your higher self. We want to hold space for your healing and your inner light to shine through and present itself to the world. We want to create a universe for you to loose yourself in dance and laughter. Everyone is in need of unconditional love, and this is our way of communicating that to you. Thank you and much love family.

story:
Short Summary

Hello! I'm Jason Manns, a singer/songwriter from Bowing Green, VA. I lived in Los Angeles for 15 years, before moving back home to this awesome (but tiny) town. I've had some amazing opportunities in the music industry, and I'm excited to start the second (possibly third?) chapter here in Bowling Green. As a singer/songwriter I've had music on quite a few TV shows, and have toured all over the world playing music. In the past five years or so I've started producing music, and even started a small record label. With quite a bit of help from my friends I've also booked shows and tours for myself and my friends, as well as helped build a small yearly music festival in Germany. But enough about me! here's my project. It's a culmination of ALL of that stuff with a few twists thrown in. Since I moved back I've still be traveling to Los Angeles to record because I don't have a studio here in BG, and I've also skipped BG more times than I've played it when I'm touring the east coast, either solo or with The Station Breaks, AND I've come to realize that live streaming is going to forever be an integral part of live music since so many people have used it for the first time both as performers and audience members... SO... here we go... 

The Heist, Located in a 100+ year old bank in the heart of Bowling Green, VA, will be all of those things, PLUS a community project to help revitalize what's already a small town showing signs of coming back to life. I grew up here, and I remember this little town teeming with life. For the last 10 or 15 years the town and the county have been through some hard times, but recently things seem to be turning around with two new art studios, a photography studio, 3 new restaurants, a salon, and more all opening in the last 2 or 3 years, and I'm excited to chip in some live music with your help!

 The Heist will be a live music venue inspired by my favorite small venues around the country, Eddie's Attic (ATL), Rockwood Music Hall (NYC), The Hotel Cafe (LA), The Evening Muse (Charlotte). Bowling Green is a small town, so this intimate venue will be the perfect size for the surroundings, 75-100 person capacity, it will have live streaming capabilities so that anyone can watch the shows from anywhere on earth, and it will also have a recording studio.(so I can finish my latest album!!) There is room to grow as well, so the plan is start small and do it right, but who knows what the future could hold! 

I really can't adequately describe to you what this would mean to me and to the town. To take that stage with my friends would mean the world. 

What We Need & What You Get

I'm all in. I mean that literally and figuratively. lol. I jumped into this project last year, and had I known this year would be the year of zero live music venues... I would have probably waited a little while. But, here's where we stand. I bought the building with my investors, and we've done all of the demo, built bathrooms, and a stage, made the venue handicapped accessible, which required a whole new entrance & ramp. That's where we are now. I'll be financing the rest of this through a combination of your support, business loans, and 4,567 virtual busking sessions via stageit. 

Since we're building a venue, Studio, and a place equipped for live stream gigs, the price tag is... daunting. but I'm confident with $100,000 we will be able to open the doors and start playing music. If we put every dollar we make back into the venue for a while then we'll get there! That was the idea initially anyway, I just figured I'd be gainfully employed while we did it. 

What do you get for your contribution you may ask? oooh we have some fun stuff available. 

The standard:

t shirts

coffee mugs, pint glasses, bottle openers, etc. 

The unique

invitations to special events like tastings, wine pairings, special musical events, both streaming and in person, recording sessions, 

The VIP treatments

Weekend getaways in Bowling Green with historic tours, fun excursions, live music, and good food. 

 

Should we not reach the big goal, what ever we do raise will be put toward the audio visual equipment and the recording studio first. The live music/bar/restaurant aspect of the Heist won't be a priority until things get back to normal, so I'd hope to have live streams and vocal sessions happening in the venue this fall, and then in person shows next year sometime. 

 

The Impact

I don't think I've ever been involved in something that allows so many of the things I love to intersect in such a way. Music, live and streaming, recording, a place where the community can come together and enjoy art. A place where we can hopefully give young artists a chance to play for people they would normally be able to, (you guys) a chance for you all to see some talented folks that (at least at the moment) won't be playing in Germany or England or wherever you're tuning in from. And last but not least, a chance to take what I've been doing for almost 20 years and use it to help the place that helped make me who I am. I love this little town, and I think you will to when you get to know it. 

Risks & Challenges

I love new challenges, but sometimes I take on more of them than I should. I need to finish a record that was already behind schedule before Covid shut everything down. This is not separate from that, but a solution to that problem... albeit, it may take a little while. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I know as well as anyone how 2020 changed things. I know quite a few people who are out of work, or waiting for things to pick back up. If that's you and you can't financially support this project please do not worry! Something that could help just as much as your monetary contribution is simply sharing this project with your friends and family or anyone you think might be interested!

story:
Welcome to Press Start!

Our organization brings together two worlds seemingly at odds, classical symphonic music and video games soundtracks. We've already secured our board of directors, begun mapping out future projects, and produced our first video project! While we're confident our plans and the team make this organization come to life, we still need help. YOUR help to be specific!

To get our feet off the ground, we're raising funds to help mitigate start-up expenses and fund our virtual projects we've been designing and eagerly waiting to share with you. With a little help from our friends, we'll be able to publish our website, launch our Call-for-Scores initiative, produce more music videos, and so much more. Unfortunately, we're unable have live events until next year, so until it is safe to come together, we ask for your help to create fun and uplifting content for our community!

 

How YOU can help us!

Our goal for our first campaign is $5,000. Your financial support will help us deliver a number of projects we've designed for your enjoyment, including:

  • Producing 4-5 music videos showcasing video game music and chamber ensembles
  • Supporting our artists, audio engineers, and animator (yes, I said animator!)
  • Prize money for our Call-for-Scores Composition Competition
  • Finishing our website and marketing materials
  • Producing our first live event in Spring 2021
  • And so much more!

We have a board of directors who are already working to organize and schedule the details for each of these projects, so everything is in the works. However, in order to continue and finalize the next steps, we need funding and that's where you come in. Not only do you have the opportunity to build an orchestra with us, but you will be supporting artists during this tumultuous time!

 

Badges and Leveling-Up!

We are so grateful for any size donation that you're able to contribute to our start-up orchestra. To show our appreciation, we've created a perks system with various levels! Check them out, and see what level works best for you (honestly, any help is incredibly appreciated)!

 

Level 1 - $10

  • You have earned the Sword badge!

  • Your name will appear in the credits on our next video, as well as on the website leaderboard, as one of our generous donors!

 

Level 2 - $25

  • You have earned the Star badge! 
  • Your name will appear in the credits on our next video, as well as on the website leaderboard, as one of our generous donors!
  • AND You will be mailed an official Press Start vinyl sticker to place onto your computer or favorite gaming console!
 

Level 3 - $50

  • You have earned the Shield badge! 
  • Your name will appear in the credits on our next video, as well as on the website leaderboard, as one of our generous donors!
  • You will be mailed an official Press Start vinyl sticker to place onto your computer or favorite gaming console!
  • AND You'll be invited to the Press Start Discord server, where you'll have direct access to our creative team to share your favorite soundtracks, be the first to hear about upcoming projects, and vote on what our first music videos will be! This an exclusive space reserved for our closest supporters!
 

Level 4 - $100

  • You have earned the Easter Egg badge! 
  • Your name will appear in the credits on our next video, as well as on the website leaderboard, as one of our generous donors!
  • You will be mailed an official Press Start vinyl sticker to place onto your computer or favorite gaming console!
  • You'll be invited to the Press Start Discord server, where you'll have direct access to our creative team to share your favorite soundtracks, be the first to hear about upcoming projects, and vote on what our first music videos will be! This an exclusive space reserved for our closest supporters!
  • AND YOU GET A SPRITE!!!! Our incredible animator will turn you into a 16- bit sprite. Your sprite will also appear as an Easter Egg in our next video project.
 

Level 5 - $250

  • You have earned the Lyre badge! 
  • Your name will appear in the credits on our next video, as well as on the website leaderboard, as one of our generous donors!
  • You will be mailed an official Press Start vinyl sticker to place onto your computer or favorite gaming console!
  • You'll be invited to the Press Start Discord server, where you'll have direct access to our creative team to share your favorite soundtracks, be the first to hear about upcoming projects, and vote on what our first music videos will be! This an exclusive space reserved for our closest supporters!
  • YOU GET A SPRITE!!!! Our incredible animator will turn you into a 16- bit sprite. Your sprite will also appear as an Easter Egg in our next video project.
  • AND you will be a featured guest in one of our upcoming video projects!!
 

HIGH SCORE - $500

  • You have earned the K.O. badge!
  • You have earned EVERYTHING that comes in the Level 5 perks, AS WELL as VIP treatment for our first live concert! That includes free tickets and premium seating arrangements will be made for you and one guest!!

 

The Impact

The audience for classical music is fading, and as musicians we want to rebuild the classical music scene and the audience demographic. One of the communities that we want to reach out to is the gaming community! If we are able to show the gaming community how orchestras and musicians play a huge role in their video game world, then we can begin to build a relationship together and support one another. Our goal is to make fun and exciting music together based on the themes of the games we love. But we also see this initiative as a way to bring over an entire audience into the theaters and halls again! Music is what builds community and sustains us through incredibly hard times, just like the current environment that we find ourselves in today. It is the common thread that ties humanity together, and we know that our organization will continue bridging the gap between communities one video at a time!

 

How else can you help? Glad you asked!

There are so many ways that you can help our organization out!

  • Share this campaign with friends, family, fellow musicians and gamers, your neighbors, landlord, your Uber Eats delivery guy, ANYONE! Spread the word of what we are trying to do and help us earn these funds!
  • Share our Facebook page (Press Start)  and Instagram (@press_start_orch)! The more people that follow-us, the bigger our impact!

We cannot thank you enough for visiting our page and learning more about us and ways to help! Please consider donating, any amount is a gift in our eyes! And we look forward to seeing you throughout the campaign and beyond!

story:
HELP FUND THE NEXT DRUSKY EP

Family, friends, drunk huskies,  and fellow music lovers! Drusky is trying to get back in the studio to record some more music. It will be a small collection of songs we've been playing live for a while now and we would love to get them recorded and produced to their full potential. We are a three-piece indie/emo band based out of Provo, Utah. We've been together for about a year and a half now and it's been incredible being able to perform for so many great audiences. The future for drusky is looking bright and we're lucky enough to have the opportunity to record at a world-class studio with a very talented producer. 

 

WHERE IS THE MONEY GOING?

Unfortunately, getting into the studio without the backing of a label can be expensive. We've decided to put together this campaign where people can contribute and recieve perks to help fund this ep! The cost for this project will be $12,000. This includes:

  • studio time at June Audio
  • production costs
  • mixing and mastering costs

We will start the recording process in November 2020 (NEXT MONTH) at June Audio in Provo, UT. The finished product will be a five song EP of the latest and greatest Drusky songs! We've been working on these for a long time and are very excited to show them to the world :)

 

ALBUM PRE-ORDER & PERKS

  • Digital download included with all donations
  • Physical CD 
  • Signed/custom physical CD
  • Shirts
  • Lunch with the band
  • Music lesson with band member of your choice
  • Private Concert
  • And more!

 

WHAT IF I CAN'T CONTRIBUTE? CAN I DO ANYTHING ELSE TO HELP?

We are well aware that finances can be tight, but there are plenty of other ways to contribute! If you're unable to pledge at this time, please consider spreading the word about this campaign and our music, anything helps!

  • Share this campaign on your Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, or any other form of social media you use 
  • Follow us on instagram and facebook at @druskyband
  • Follow us on Spotify/Apple Music and add our current songs to your playlists

 

THANK YOU

Thank you so much for supporting our musical journey! We are looking forward to being able to play real life shows for you again and hopefully tour someday. We can't do this without you!

story:
(If you’ve stumbled upon this by chance and don't know who we are, but are not in a hurry to click yourself away, why not check out our websites and maybe discover something new):
www.colinbass.com
www.danielbiro.com

 

Greetings dear friends, old and new, past and future, music lovers and keen supporters... (yes, YOU!)

 

We are here to enlist your support for a unique album project. A collaboration between two like-thinking musical minds: Colin Bass (Camel, Steve Hillage) on vocals, bass and piano, and Daniel Biro on keyboards. After years of slow-nurturing ideas, the two have finally, like a good wine,  got their project to reach maturity. 

A collection of carefully crafted, intimate songs that came about very organically, purely through the will of the two protagonists to 'make something happen'. To create something very personal, fragile, beautiful, that faithfully reflected the wistful state of mind of two people looking at life from a 'seasoned' vantage point. Reclaiming innocence through experience.

Why 'Still'? Because it's all quite slow-moving. Ambient songs. Not much drums, just Daniel's vintage keyboards (Rhodes piano, Moog synths, Hammonds, string machines, acoustic piano), Colin's electric bass and, of course, voice. The stillness of contemplation but with strong emotional undercurrents that evoke childhood's innocence, love's complexities and society's conundrums. It's also the 'still' of 'still believing', 'still doing it' and 'still living with passion'. Despite everything... still...

Anyway, enough of the melancholic philosophising psycho-babble.

Here's where we're at: the songs are almost done and recorded and they're sounding great! We are planning a beautiful limited edition CD package but, this being an artist-run independent production (read: 'poor'), we need your help with the following;

- Mixing and Mastering (when you pay someone to make your recording sound 'expensive')
- Design and Manufacturing (when you pay someone to create a beautiful object you can actually touch and cherish)
- Promotion (when you pay someone to say how great your music is)
- A month holiday in the Maldives (when you're just kidding yourself...)

All this will cost around £10,000 so that's what we're aiming for.

By pre-ordering the album or even going for one of the amazing perks and offers, you can infuse this project with your own personal DNA. Make the music more meaningful to you and to us.  

This campaign is scaleable depending on your input. The more support we get, the more lavish the production will be (you know you love those expensive looking special editions...).

Whatever happens, we're projecting a release in the Autumn of 2019.

Updates on progress will be uploaded here.

Friends! Creating an album is always an adventure. Making a dream come true. Bringing to life something that wasn't there before. So to get this baby on the road, or at least out of the delivery room, we need your participation. Everyone can adopt and become a member of the extended family. Be that favourite uncle or aunty now!

(even if you can't help with money, you show your support by spreading the word to your rich friends... So please SHARE! SHARE! SHARE!)

Greetings dear friends, old and new, past and future, music lovers and keen supporters... (yes, YOU!)
 
We are here to enlist your support for a unique album project. A collaboration between two like-thinking musical minds: Colin Bass (Camel, Steve Hillage) on vocals, bass and piano, and Daniel Biro on keyboards. After years of slow-nurturing ideas, the two have finally, like a good wine,  got their project to reach maturity. 
A collection of carefully crafted, intimate songs that came about very organically, purely through the will of the two protagonists to 'make something happen'. To create something very personal, fragile, beautiful, that faithfully reflected the wistful state of mind of two people looking at life from a 'seasoned' vantage point. Reclaiming innocence through experience.
Why 'Still'? Because it's all quite slow-moving. Ambient songs. Not much drums, just Daniel's vintage keyboards (Rhodes piano, Moog synths, Hammonds, string machines, acoustic piano), Colin's electric bass and, of course, voice. The stillness of contemplation but with strong emotional undercurrents that evoke childhood's innocence, love's complexities and society's conundrums. It's also the 'still' of 'still believing', 'still doing it' and 'still living with passion'. Despite everything... still...
Anyway, enough of the melancholic philosophising psycho-babble.
Here's where we're at: the songs are almost done and recorded and they're sounding great! We are planning a beautiful limited edition CD package but, this being an artist-run independent production (read: 'poor'), we need your help with the following;
- Mixing and Mastering (when you pay someone to make your recording sound 'expensive')- Design and Manufacturing (when you pay someone to create a beautiful object you can actually touch and cherish)- Promotion (when you pay someone to say how great your music is)- A month holiday in the Maldives (when you're just kidding yourself...)
All this will cost around £10,000 so that's what we're aiming for.
By pre-ordering the album or even going for one of the amazing perks and offers, you can infuse this project with your own personal DNA. Make the music more meaningful to you and to us.  
This campaign is scaleable depending on your input. The more support we get, the more lavish the production will be (you know you love those expensive looking special editions...).
Whatever happens, we're projecting a release in the Autumn of 2019.
Updates on progress will be uploaded here.
Friends! Creating an album is always an adventure. Making a dream come true. Bringing to life something that wasn't there before. So to get this baby on the road, or at least out of the delivery room, we need your participation. Everyone can adopt and become a member of the extended family. Be that favourite uncle or aunty now!
(even if you can't help with money, you show your support by spreading the word to your rich friends... So please SHARE! SHARE! SHARE!)

story:
My "Why?" for These Two Albums

   These two projects are very different. I guess since we're all prismatic and multidimensional, why shouldn't the music reflect such?

    I'm running this campaign because I need help to make these songs into records. I have been through so much shit in my life, especially over the past year and half facing big grief, sobriety, and inward looking at my patterns, shame, and addictions. I'm making this music in particular, because it represents parts of my life I want to own, celebrate, and share in hopes that others will feel similar ownership of their own stories and lives.

I JUST WANNA LOVE YOU

I JUST WANNA LET YOU

  My soul/rock record you'll be able to support-- I JUST WANNA LOVE YOU / I JUST WANNA LET YOU is a culmination of sounds and experiences that really represent a lot of my life's suffering around relationships, love addiction, and self-care. At these times, I had an inability to connect in healthy ways beyond obsession or addictive attachment. I believed I wasn't good enough of a human to NOT live in chaos.  This record represents that chaos diamond. All sides of it though! Sometimes chaos is fun! You dance to it, you groove, you meet crazy times, and other times its heartbreaking and you want it over! Haha, its all human, and its all good...

 I actually felt wrong around these songs at times, because of what they were--an admission of my darkness and uniqueness. But today, I understand them to be a celebration (The album's last song "Glories" literally is a celebration of owning a bit of narcissism and power!) Without these times of ego, suffering, without reflection upon them, I would have never have found the peace I have now.

We don't find liberation from everything being hunky-doory or being perfect angels. It takes some suffering to get us interested in waking up to our trances of selfishness and pain. This record celebrates my darkness, my egoic tendencies, my addicted lifestyle. All of it! We are here to embrace suffering, to celebrate brokenness, disconnect and receive all the gifts that come with the shadow; because only in acceptance can we find freedom.

These are mostly upbeat songs from a unique addict person with sense of humor,  and they are fun! And they are a part of me and every human. Embrace, embrace, embrace.

   My goal with these 5 songs on IJWLY/IJWLY is congruent with my larger goal as an artist: to tell the truth so that others may find in themselves, the courage and permission to tell their own.

 

PILOT LIGHT

  If IJWLY/IJWLY is a record of my suffering, then Pilot Light is a record of my compassion and kindness coming forth to meet it! After 15 years of addiction (some good, some bad, some ugly), these 5 songs have been written in moments of recent grace; these were written in moments of deep understanding of despair and real attempts at acceptance.  These songs are special, powerful, and smart folk songs that came slowly with a lot of trust and a lot of joyful tears. They make me different after I play them. I'm calling this E.P. Pilot Light because these songs encourage the softest and most tender parts of us to truly come forward, but to never burn out. These pieces are sweeter anthems for staying true to your own inner light. Straight up, I play these songs when I'm sad and I feel better.

These works are bridge songs, taking me from one place to another; they bridge the gap between how I think I ought to be, and who I really am. And when I play these songs for others, I always find kindred spirits in the audience thanking me for my honesty, and for telling their story. There are always a lot of emotions around these songs and I really believe they are medicine for hope. I think all music is, but I know from real time experience, these songs bring me forward movement in the dark.

What I'm Asking For & What You Get!

The monetary goal for these two projects to come to fruition is 3,325$

If 150 people give $22.20 (the cost of a good book!) I'll hit this goal.

This support goal covers for a lot of costs for BOTH 5-song records combined:

  • Production & Post Production Costs
  • Musicians & Engineers
  • Studio Time

While this campaign does not totally cover costs to make these records, it helps A LOT and helps me move the process along to get these pieces made. In effect, with your help, its like we'll all make these pieces happen so we all get to reap the benefits of satisfaction and accomplishment from their fruition! My community has kept me alive and sober and brought me to wellness, I'm excited to have my community be a special part of these records, too.

TIER 1

For a donation of 1$-21$ you get:

  • High Quality early digital download of BOTH E.P.'s before their Official Release
  • Thank you note & a sticker!

TIER 2

For a donation of 22$-34$ you get:

  • High Quality early digital download of BOTH E.P.'s before their Official Release
  • An Exclusive Acoustic Version of ONE of the E.P.'s, you choose! Via digital download
  • Special Art Booklet containing one of a kind Art & Lyrics for each one of the songs for the respective chosen E.P.
  • Thank you & a sticker!

TIER 3

For a donation of 35$+ you get:

  • High Quality early digital download of BOTH E.P.'s before their Official Release
  • An Exclusive Acoustic Versions of BOTH of the E.P.'s, via digital download
  • TWO Special Art Booklets containing one of a kind Art & Lyrics for each one of the songs for BOTH E.P.'s.
  • Thank you & a sticker!

 

PLEASE NOTE: In the event I don't reach the entire goal, all of these donations and your special gifts WILL still come out to you and these records WILL get made, it will just mean more time to save up all the money to make the records happen. But they're going to happen, and I'm grateful to everyone who donates as well as anyone who just shoots me a virtual high five!

 

The Musicians, The Producers & The Studio

I JUST WANNA LOVE YOU / I JUST WANNA LET YOU

"The Cottage" a Studio in East Nashville

  • I'm currently working with Evan Sieling, a remarkable producer and now friend, on a couple of tracks on the IJWLY E.P.
  • Evan has produced "Cold Stop" my most recent single, and has remixed "Believer" which is now the version on all digital platforms for my band's first single. He also has produced for labels and some well known Christian artists.
  • We work together beautifully and he loves the music we make!
  • We continuously work with session players such as: Rachel Crick (fiddle), Nick Haynes (horns) Peter Wilson (drums), Gideon Boley (guitar) and a lot of other gems in Nashville!

PILOT LIGHT

"Sundog Studios" another Studio in East Nashville

  • Another producer I've worked with in town is Michael Esser, he's worked with Black Crows and has engineered for artists such as Jack White and many more.
  • We'll be doing this 5-song record raw and folky and mostly untouched!
  • All five songs will be live and will capture the song's natural kindling and sweet fire and 6 piece band
  • Michael will play drums, myself on acoustic guitar, Rachel Crick on fiddle and a whole lot more!

BOTH of these guys are BEAUTIFUL and different, and reach me and my music in different ways.

I'm glad to share details about what's going into these projects, and who is going to be touching them!

 

The Impact & Thank You

   To conclude, the medicine of these two works speak to different sides of me, I'm sure they'll speak to different sides of you too. I'm asking for help on these, not a total cover-all; I'm still going to be covering production costs on my end too, so we really are doing this together!

   I believe in investment in each other and communities supporting one another; you can support this cause--these song's invitations and medicine, for about the price of a good book, and I really appreciate your help. I appreciate your financial, EMOTIONAL, and overall HUMAN/SPIRITUAL support in all my life and in all my creative endeavors.

Thank you Thank you Thank you!!!

I thank you whether you give or not because if you're reading this, I'm sure that I know you and love you, or one day, I will. haha

I'm grateful to have your ear, even just for this moment.

Thank you so much.

Sincerely,

-Katie B.

story:
Short Summary

Gran Reserva is our second album. The first album (El circo de la vida) was 100% "home made" and we wanted to go a step farder this time.

What We Need & What You Get

We already found the person who´s gonna mix and master the album. He knew we didn´t have much money but he liked our sound and wanted to work on it. Our first idea was a crouwdfunding where people don´t need to spend much. We just need 50 people buying our "Gran Reserva" in advance (just 10 euros). So that´s our goal... You buy our album before we master it and once it´s ready we´ll send you the digital album direct to your mail.

 

Even if we don´t get to the minimum of 500 euros, we will pay the difference so every person who´s buying it in advance can be sure that he will get the final mastered album.

 

The Impact

We belive that we have a good product. Mastering an album nowadays is very important as radios, promoters..... won´t give a chance to home made albums no matter how good the songs are.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

As an independent band we will be very happy if you can follow us the way you prefer. Facebook, Instagram, Youtube..... look for us and see how we do it :)

story:
Hello, I’m David, and this is my solo project named Dave Van Detta.

Starting my career with sights set on becoming a solo artist and the first metal solo double bassist in the world my early beginnings span from countless first prizes in classical competitions, multiple national rock festival, and competitions, appearing on national television, up to touring with classical symphonic orchestras across southern Europe.

A revelation retold is so much more than just another album, its a story 3 years in the making and a culmination of more than 15 years of music education, writing and performing. My goal for this album is to shatter the monotony that is currently reigning in the mainstream metal industry, with some innovative take on combining classical instruments into new metal genres whilst staying true to metal’s roots.

For me this is not something I do as a hobby, or to see if it will succeed - for me it’s everything and I don’t plan on stopping.

So, if you want to help spread the message of my music, if you want to donate in exchange for band merch, which I really want you to have, now you can through this campaign.

You’ll be making a dream come true.

story:
Hey it's Megan! If you don't already know me, I'm a singer, songwriter, and producer living out here in California's Central Coast (SLO to be exact). I've been creating these songs for the better part of this year and have been excited and a little bit nervous to share them with you. This project is so near to my heart. This year has been such a transformative one for me, making this EP my most vulnerable yet, and I wanted to ask you to be a part of it. With your help I will be able to pay those who've generously given their time and talent to help me put this EP in your hands. I'll be able to fund my producer, my merch and...a  short film for the EP:)

Here are the Numbers*:

My goal is to raise $3,150.00

$850 Mixing and Mastering

$1500 Short Film Videography

$100 Cover Art Photography 

$150 Indiegogo 5% Fee

$350 Short Film Space/Prop Rental (will probably cost more)

$200 Starting Merch Supplies Cost (est.)

*after we reach $1,000.00, 10% of what we raise will be donated to Friends of 40 Prado in San Luis Obispo (provides shelter and food for the homeless ).

Here's what you're getting: 

Story Boxes**: 

Each story box contains little useful, creative, carefully selected items that tie into the EP. The boxes also contain letters sharing my thoughts about each song and letting you in on the headspace I was in when writing them. Things get vulnerable. As you unwrap these gifts and read my heart and the thought process behind each song, I want to help fully immerse you in my EP to experience it the way that I do. I am terrified and excited! 

I know these are big goals and...well...let's be honest, times are weird right now. If I don't reach my intended goal, whatever money that has been given will go to pay for just the mixing and mastering of my EP. 

**In this time of caution towards product cleanliness, I will be practicing sanitation for each item and use care while assembling! We are a very clean household as my girlfrandd;))) is high-risk :(((

If you can't contribute monetarily right now, I completely get it, and have some other ways you can be involved! 

  • Share this campaign with your friends online
  • Continue sharing my music and supporting me as an artist
  • Join my email list (go to http://eepurl.com/dlsm7v)
  • Keep up with my social media to stay tuned on when the EP drops worldwide
  • Continue supporting fellow artists and showing love! 

In summary:

I want to change the way you see my music. I want to be real with you and to let you see a different creative side of me. I want to bring you into my year and into the life that these songs came from. Vulnerability like this has always been a hard thing for me, but as I do it, I'm hoping that looking at my story and my life will help others hold hope in their hearts and courage to be the same.

story:
Thank you for visiting our fundraising page for the 2020 - 2021 season!

 

Who is Multicultural Sonic Evolution (MuSE)?

We are MuSE, a non-profit organization co-directed by composer Yui Kitamura and percussionist Chihiro Shibayama. (Click our names to learn more about ourselves individually) Each season we produce unique showcases that provide talented artists who embrace musical elements in their work with a platform for sharing their craft. Our collaborators include dancers, filmmakers, animators, writers, fashion and hair stylists, and so on.

 

What’s “Sounds of Arts Festival (SOAF)”?

We had our first “Sounds of Arts Festival” in November 2011 at the Secret Theatre in Long Island City, NY.  We had wanted to create a multidisciplinary show that combined elements of different disciplines such as dance, theatre, fashion, film and music.  If all of these art forms were infused with music, what would that sound like?  It was through this creative process that the "Sounds of Arts Festival" was born.  Over the last 9 years, we have produced more than 100 programs and featured over 400 artists!

We were planning to make the 10th year anniversary of the festival big and special this year, however, everything changed when New York City venues had to shut down due to COVID-19. We lost our be-loved venue, the Secret Theatre, which had to close its door permanently in May 2020. That's when we learned that we were unable to produce the 10th Year anniversary celebration in the theatre where we started the festival. 

Other impacts due to the pandemic

Not only the festival, but we also had to cancel every concert we had planned such as our annual choral & orchestral concert which we have been presenting every spring since 2016. 

 

Why we need your help

The pandemic didn’t stop us from producing concerts! We started a “Quarantini Concert Series” which is a free online event where Yui and Chihiro talk about different works and show performance videos of artists who have worked with MuSE. 

We also decided to host the 10th Anniversary Sounds of Arts Festival 2020 virtually. We asked our past collaborators to submit videos (mostly brand-new!) to be included in this festival. You can see this amazing 12-hour-long video featuring more than 100 artists on YouTube Premieres starting on December 17th, 2020.

Today, we are asking for your support to fund our 2020 - 2021 season. The fund will directly help the artists fee and help MuSE produce future concerts either virtually, or in-person when it's safe to do so. 

Are you wondering why we chose $4041 as a goal? It comes from the year 2020 + 2021 = 4041 :-)

All donation is tax-deductible. 

 

What you will get:

*These perks are all digital to be pandemic-safe and will be delivered in February-April 2021

 

  • $10 // MuSE Digital thank you postcard - delivered February 2021

  • $20 // MuSE Sounds of Arts Festival 2020 Digital Poster (plus all of the perks above) - delivered February 2021

  • $100 // Chihiro's Otamatone Performance Video sent via email (plus all of the perks above) - delivered March 2021

  • $200 // Chihiro's Otamatone Performance of song of your choice (30 sec excerpts) video sent via email (plus all of the perks above) - delivered late April 2021

  • $500 // Yui's original composition dedicated just for you (1 minute) (plus all of the perks above) - delivered late April 2021

 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    We understand that this is a difficult time to make a financial contribution, but there are always ways you can help for free!

    Here are some great ways to help:

    - Share this campaign on your social media or via email

    -  Watch our Sounds of Arts Festival 2020 video on YouTube, like, share, and subscribe

    - Come to our future concerts
story_txt:
Thank you for visiting our fundraising page for the 2020 - 2021 season!
 
Who is Multicultural Sonic Evolution (MuSE)?
We are MuSE, a non-profit organization co-directed by composer Yui Kitamura and percussionist Chihiro Shibayama. (Click our names to learn more about ourselves individually) Each season we produce unique showcases that provide talented artists who embrace musical elements in their work with a platform for sharing their craft. Our collaborators include dancers, filmmakers, animators, writers, fashion and hair stylists, and so on.
 
What’s “Sounds of Arts Festival (SOAF)”?
We had our first “Sounds of Arts Festival” in November 2011 at the Secret Theatre in Long Island City, NY.  We had wanted to create a multidisciplinary show that combined elements of different disciplines such as dance, theatre, fashion, film and music.  If all of these art forms were infused with music, what would that sound like?  It was through this creative process that the "Sounds of Arts Festival" was born.  Over the last 9 years, we have produced more than 100 programs and featured over 400 artists!
We were planning to make the 10th year anniversary of the festival big and special this year, however, everything changed when New York City venues had to shut down due to COVID-19. We lost our be-loved venue, the Secret Theatre, which had to close its door permanently in May 2020. That's when we learned that we were unable to produce the 10th Year anniversary celebration in the theatre where we started the festival. 
Other impacts due to the pandemic
Not only the festival, but we also had to cancel every concert we had planned such as our annual choral & orchestral concert which we have been presenting every spring since 2016. 
 
Why we need your help
The pandemic didn’t stop us from producing concerts! We started a “Quarantini Concert Series” which is a free online event where Yui and Chihiro talk about different works and show performance videos of artists who have worked with MuSE. 
We also decided to host the 10th Anniversary Sounds of Arts Festival 2020 virtually. We asked our past collaborators to submit videos (mostly brand-new!) to be included in this festival. You can see this amazing 12-hour-long video featuring more than 100 artists on YouTube Premieres starting on December 17th, 2020.

Are you wondering why we chose $4041 as a goal? It comes from the year 2020 + 2021 = 4041 :-)
All donation is tax-deductible.

*These perks are all digital to be pandemic-safe and will be delivered in February-April 2021
 

$10 // MuSE Digital thank you postcard - delivered February 2021
$20 // MuSE Sounds of Arts Festival 2020 Digital Poster (plus all of the perks above) - delivered February 2021
$100 // Chihiro's Otamatone Performance Video sent via email (plus all of the perks above) - delivered March 2021
$200 // Chihiro's Otamatone Performance of song of your choice (30 sec excerpts) video sent via email (plus all of the perks above) - delivered late April 2021
$500 // Yui's original composition dedicated just for you (1 minute) (plus all of the perks above) - delivered late April 2021

 


Other Ways You Can Help
We understand that this is a difficult time to make a financial contribution, but there are always ways you can help for free!
Here are some great ways to help:
- Share this campaign on your social media or via email
-  Watch our Sounds of Arts Festival 2020 video on YouTube, like, share, and subscribe
- Come to our future concerts

story:
Speak Revival

 

Speak Revival is a song written to inspire an awakening in people to pursue the truth of who God says they are. It's time to break down the lies that bind us and wake up to the truth of the power that is within us.

 

The funding for this project will help us reach people all over the world with this message of hope.
story_txt: Speak Revival Speak Revival is a song written to inspire an awakening in people to pursue the truth of who God says they are. It's time to break down the lies that bind us and wake up to the truth of the power that is within us. The funding for this project will help us reach people all over the world with this message of hope.

story:
The quest to make Good Thing continues! 

In the first round we raised $7, 265. After Indiegogo took their cut I ultimately netted $6,590.56 of my goal of $15,575. Turns out crowdfunding during a worldwide pandemic is hard! 

The need to make a living drove me onto the road to work in the aftermath of the Derecho in Iowa and Hurricane Sally. When I'm working during storms it takes every bit of my time and energy to focus...........6:30am up..........at it all day............go to sleep at 1am..........get up and do it all again 7 days a week.........turns out this time.........for 2 months. 

Directly after my work was done I headed to Nashville to begin work on the new record. The morning we were to begin recording I get word that one my band member’s partners had tested positive for COVID. I sat in my camper in the Walmart Parking lot in Cool Springs for two days trying to figure out a solution to start moving forward with the recording process. To complicate matters, Bob Britt's wife Etta is dealing with cancer............and I just imagined him coming into the studio.........masked up, doing all the right things........and then going home to her at night. All signs were pointing to me not making the record at this particular time. 

So, we have to adjust. This record will be made. As things seem to be opening up everywhere.......I’m feeling optimistic that we will be able to start recording this summer in the warmer months, or sooner if it makes sense. 

The two month campaign was tough, but enlightening. One thing that really came into shape was the weekly live webcasts that I started doing to highlight Good Thing.  I had some incredible special guests.............Robert Reynolds from The Mavericks, Garry Tallent from Bruce Springsteen and the E Street Band, Sean Snook, Johnny Mackinnon from The Roadtrippers, Jude Johnstone, Sonny West “0h Boy” and “Rave On”, Carlene Carter, Nashville session legend Ron Oates, Jerry Fuller “Travelin’ Man” and “Young Girl”..........pretty amazing friends and musical cohorts.  The interaction with my friends on Facebook during the webcasts was a real lift each Sunday and running the new songs past everyone in realtime was invaluable. 

So, I'll continue that. 

The Perks.

I streamlined the perks a bit this time. Cds, Vinyl, t-shirt, and a selection of Backyard Concerts are available. A personal Facetime/Zoom concert is also an option now. Make sure to scroll all the way to the bottom for the Backyard Concerts and Executive Producer option. Grab one now and let's push it over the edge!

Vinyl of all the rage..................

My debut, Fear Nothing, came out on A&M Records on Cd..........completely missing vinyl. This will be my first record to be printed on vinyl. I'm so fired up about that. This is the record player I got for Christmas. Cannot wait to spin Good Thing on it! Grab your vinyl copy!

 

Other ways to help:

Share on Facebook and Twitter. Make it personal. Tell them why they should check it out.  Thanks! "like" my facebook page to participate in the weekly live webcasts at www.facebook.com/kevinmontgomeryes

story:
Thank you!

Thank you everyone who has taken part in this incredible journey with me! I'm so humbled and grateful for your support. I can't wait to put these CDs in the mail for you.

I'm so grateful to my incredible team, who have helped make this album a reality:

 

Grant Cornish - engineering, production, mastering

Tomi Ervi - string arrangements

Paul Buono - guitars & mandolin

Lendell Black - string arrangements

Jeff Chenault - album design

Dan Anderson - photography

Sam and Julie Castleman - release concert hosts

 

As we say in Finland... Kiitos ja Hyvää Joulua! 

I wish you the Merriest of Holiday Seasons!

May this music fill your heart with peace & hope.

 

Love,

Ruut

story:
The journey to becoming a star

This is a book that travels back in time to reveal the winding road that John Denver took to fulfill his dream of becoming as big as Frank Sinatra.

You’ll see stories that reveal John’s confidence and energy, and the unique talents he shared. And you'll meet many of those who helped set the table for John's iconic career. 

The author, Carl Franzen, does not rewrite John’s narrative but offers a glimpse into his coming of age, and his arrival at the doorstep of fame. Sometimes the storytellers, including the author, take over and become more important than the reader might expect. It’s as if they are participants at a pickin’ party, each with a different instrument, each with a favorite song to sing. Smiling, strumming, playing a catchy riff to grab your attention. Always, however, with a single destination: Who was Young John Denver?​

What's inside?

Franzen, who wrote the song, "On the Road" (Denver's "Back Home Again" album), takes the reader on a cross-country journey from Randy Sparks—who gave John his first boost—to the recording of his breakout hit, "Take Me Home, Country Roads."

Bill Danoff takes you back to the days when he was working Sound and Lights at the Cellar Door in Washington D.C, and the moment John first sang "Take Me Home Country Roads" with Danoff and Taffy Nivert at his side.

In Alabama, Franzen tells about meeting up with Jim Connor who played "Grandma's Feather Bed" on his front porch while a chicken squawked in his back yard.

And you'll read the story about John's first song, "For Bobbie,"  from Bobbie herself.

The book is like a genealogy, showing how one person's effort leads to another's success. You'll hear first hand how John Denver arrived in Los Angeles as Little Johnny Deutschendorf, and left with a new stage name. You'll follow the priest who guided the Chad Mitchell Trio to New York and introduced them to Nina Simone's agent, who in turn led them to Milt Okun who became John Denver's lifelong friend and music director. 

And, of course, you'll read what happened when John called Annie's college dormitory to ask for a first date. 

It's a book filled with details and connections, and memorable black and white photographs. Longtime fans and newbies who want to learn more about Denver's arrival on the scene, won't be satisfied with just one read.

What readers are saying

"A great book about a great man, and such a vibrant, yet relaxing writing style." Greg T., New Jersey

"I enjoyed the wonderful stories of John breaking into the music industry." Georgia H., Alexandria, OH

"I just finished "Faaar Out," a terrific read.  Such a humanizing look. Thank you." Steve L., Portland OR

"Cool! Or should I say 'Faaar Out"? Larry C, Lake Oswego, OR

New readers are encouraged to share their thoughts with the author.

Shipping information

Books are available for shipment now. Domestic mail takes about a week. Mail to Canada is usually received within 3 weeks. Worldwide shipments can take 4-5 weeks. Indiegogo lawyers say, "Your donation is a way to support a project, but does not guarantee that you will receive a perk." You will get your book, and each copy will be signed by the author.

story:
Hi there, My name is Nandun and I am a Singer/ Songwriter & Live Looping Artist based in Brisbane, Australia.

I am an Independent Pop & RnB artist. I have been writing music for what seems like all my life and finally released my first 2 songs in 2020, after being a full time performing artist for the past 4 years.

Now, I am set to release my 3rd single, titled "Don't Run" but there is just one small issue, which is money. The past year has been hard on all of us, but creatives especially suffered a big hit financially. I myself personally lost half my income. Which is why I am asking for your HELP to fund a portion of the recording, mixing, mastering and promotion costs that will go towards this next track. The theme of this track will center around not running away when things get tough, cause you are not alone. 

Music is the best way I know how to express myself, and at this point its kind of like the only thing I'm good at! I started writing music for myself, but at some point people started to listen and I just went with it.

What I Need & What You Get

When you are an independent artist ready to make the next leap, there are certain things that cannot be done on your own. Making a track does not come cheap, and as with everything "what you pay is what you get". That is why I have set a goal of $2000 AUD. This money will cover a portion of studio recording, mixing, mastering and promotion costs. 

My plan is to have this track ready to be released for your ears in February 2022.

In addition, I've included a bunch of perks to thank you for your contribution to this campaign. These range from a digital copy of the single, free music lessons, all the way up to booking me to play at your next event.  And of course, you can donate more than the perk cost if you feel so inclined. 

The Impact

I truly appreciate any help you can provide. Every little bit goes a long way,  and would mean the world to me. But even if you aren't in the capacity to contribute yourself, even sharing this campaign with your friends would help heaps!

Last but not least, thank you for all your support and I look forward to taking this next step in my journey with you.

story:
Who Am I?

I am Appointed. First and foremost, I am the "called out" servant of GOD with a heart for the LORD and His people. As a Pastor and Christian Recording Artist I have a passion for touching lives for His Glory through His Word and through music. My desire is not only to touch lives through His Word and music but to meet the observable needs of people, such as feeding the homeless, clothing the poor visiting the sick. 

Through this ministry, Appointed Music Ministries, we impacts lives for His Glory and we are growing beyond the resources that we have at hand and are looking to you to act as a donor/sponsor to help us keep pace with the expansion of our work



Where are the Funds Going?

The funds will be used to do things like:

  • Ministry expenses 
  • Traveling expenses (huge because of our heart to do an Africa Crusade)
  • Album recording expenses
  • TV/Radio production expenses
  • Sunday in the Park (community outreach event)


The Impact

Win, Win, Win. You win because you are  sharing in spreading the gospel message, The people win because they are helped. Appointed music wins because we get to continue to spread the gospel message across the country and around the world.

Risks & Challenges

If there be any risk or challenges at all, it will be that you dear reader will not help with the work.  I truly trust that GOD will supply according to His Vast riches.  I am committed to the cause of Christ, I will endure until the end no matter what. What we do is effective, even if  just "one" life that is transformed, it is all so worth it.  We trust Him an trust that His Activity will be done

  • I am walking by faith, just as I have done all these years.
  • The plan is to keep continue to trust that the Lord has a Plan.

If You Can't Give

then please,  give what you can.  A prayer, a word of encouragement, a share of this campaign on your social media sites, e-mails, word of mouth. Technology has made it too easy to be helpful.  Clicking the share button will aid us in raising the money we need to  keep this ministry moving for His Glory.

story:
The Red Oak Chamber Organization is a collection of dedicated, talented musicians from the Montgomery High School. We are fortunate enough to have an excellent music program, through which we have gained the chance to form an appreciation for music in its various forms, as well as been allowed the chance to express ourselves artistically and discover new areas of aptitude. We believe that all students should have the opportunity to experience the process of music education, and that circumstances should never prevent any child from being able to learn music. 

However, many schools do not have the money to fully fund a music program. Some schools have fewer than a dozen students enrolled in their music programs, mostly due to a limited supply of musical staff and equipment. This prevents many students the opportunity to make music a part of their lives.

Our organization hopes to increase the amount of students given access to music education by raising money to donate to the music department of a financially struggling school in our area. Our overall goal is to raise $2,000 by May 25th of 2015.

story:
Here we are already in the final hours of Chance's campaign,  Thank you so much to everyone that has helped out so far, You are hero's in my eyes!

  
We have reached 30% of our budget, between this campaign and private donations, so awesome!!    SO GRATEFUL to you!  Can't wait for you to hear the music, it is incredible!


Please keep spreading the word and keep contributions coming in to the very end, every thing helps and makes a difference!  Thank You! 

CHANCE needs YOUR HELP  to record a rock symphony and create a YouTube music video of him performing 34 of the instrumental parts on a variety basses! He is doing something that has never been done before! 

Chance is making a little piece of history here and your contributions are an important part in making that happen. 

This is a passion project created to meet the demand from people wanting hear & see more of Chance and his music. This attention was generated from his successful single "Feeling Good" that made its way around the world on the strength of fans sharing it on social media! 

There is no one like him, doing what he is doing in music...Chance is an original! He is known as an instrumental virtuoso, with extraordinary ideas to significantly showcase the versatility of the bass, like on "Feeling Good" where he performed 19 parts on bass.

 Chance is a pioneer in creating a new instrumental genre in music! His performances are exciting and mesmerizing, he loves pushing musical boundaries, merging jazz, classical, pop and rock music.  

This big new song and the video for YouTube will help Chance reach his fans, and is the next vital step in moving his career forward and WE NEED YOUR HELP!

Please make your contributions TODAY to make this a reality, we so appreciate your help!

An incredible team of talented people are coming together to make this recording happen.

Doctor O. Kitajima, world renowned producer with a long history of musical excellence, takes the helm as Producer. Doane Perry, the tremendously respected and legendary drummer of "Jethro Tull", will add his magic and unique sound to the production. The rest of the rock symphony is all Chance!!!!!

Did we say he doesn't do anything simple?  If anyone says it can't be done, he will find a way, and it will blow your mind.  He is just amazing!  

The Budget of $8450 dollars must be raised in just 30 Days! 

This is to help off set recording costs and cover the costs to film & edit a music video for YouTube, as well as pay for the costs associated with crowd funding.

SO PLEASE MAKE YOUR CONTRIBUTIONS AND DONATIONS TODAY!  We have some meaningful perks recognizing your involvement in making this happen, they are listed on the upper right side of this page.  

You have our heartfelt gratitude for being a true patron of the arts, thank you for supporting a truly gifted artist, it is greatly appreciated.. 

The Impact

Your support of this campaign and the impact on Chance's career is going to be life changing!   This is just the beginning of Chance's vision for where he sees his career moving and the music he wants to create.  He really is on the cutting edge of something very exciting and you will help him realize that dream!

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge is getting all the funds raised, within 30 days, so we can move forward with this project. 
We are working with consummate professionals to bring this project in.  Everyone is committed to realizing this vision, however sometimes a scheduling or technical challenge may happen that could cause a short time delay.  Rest assured the expertise of this team will bring in a truly amazing production. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Be our networking lifeline,  by contacting  10 people you know and get them excited and involved in the project too!  Also get them to contact people they know, create momentum and make some noise about the campaign!  You will be a vital key in helping make this project happen!

Thank you, Thank you, Thank you, for making this project a reality!
story_txt:
Here we are already in the final hours of Chance's campaign,  Thank you so much to everyone that has helped out so far, You are hero's in my eyes!
  We have reached 30% of our budget, between this campaign and private donations, so awesome!!    SO GRATEFUL to you!  Can't wait for you to hear the music, it is incredible!

Please keep spreading the word and keep contributions coming in to the very end, every thing helps and makes a difference!  Thank You! 



CHANCE needs YOUR HELP  to record a rock symphony and create a YouTube music video of him performing 34 of the instrumental parts on a variety basses! He is doing something that has never been done before! 
Chance is making a little piece of history here and your contributions are an important part in making that happen. 
This is a passion project created to meet the demand from people wanting hear & see more of Chance and his music. This attention was generated from his successful single "Feeling Good" that made its way around the world on the strength of fans sharing it on social media! 





There is no one like him, doing what he is doing in music...Chance is an original! He is known as an instrumental virtuoso, with extraordinary ideas to significantly showcase the versatility of the bass, like on "Feeling Good" where he performed 19 parts on bass.
 Chance is a pioneer in creating a new instrumental genre in music! His performances are exciting and mesmerizing, he loves pushing musical boundaries, merging jazz, classical, pop and rock music.  


This big new song and the video for YouTube will help Chance reach his fans, and is the next vital step in moving his career forward and WE NEED YOUR HELP!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Davor Dojchinovich. I am Seattle based independent composer, musician and producer. My main instruments are bass guitar and piano, I also play electric and acoustic guitars, keyboards and percussions.  Please find my music on SoundCloud. https://soundcloud.com/ddojchin-gmail-com

I've been around music all my life. At age of 7 I've started first piano lessons at primary music School in Sarajevo, (Bosnia, Yugoslavia). I've attend music school until age 13 when I decided to start playing bass guitar in punk rock bend that I've formed with four of my childhood friends. Needless to say my parents were not happy with me changing my main instrument and starting a punk rock band :). Band was active for several years with some demo recordings and numberless live concerts. I played bass in several other bands until early nineties, when war came to my hometown. I had to run away. Left my home, all my instruments, all of my music recordings. I started new life as a refugee and did not have any chance to play music at all for several years. I graduated from School of Pharmacy at Belgrade University. 

At a beginning of a new millennium I arrived to Seattle, Washington. One day my dear  friend Marty brought me a present, the most beautiful present I have ever received. It was his old Acoustic Guitar Ibanez crafted in Japan. He just said to me  "you have to start playing your music again". And here I am, after some time getting ready to  publish  my first solo full length album "Musical Journey with Davor D."

Allow me to take you to the musical journey, One Summer Night early in the morning we will walk across Brooklyn Bridge, from clubs of Berlin to the shores of Havana, we will Glide Above the Clouds aboard Spaceship Earth, I will tell you Don’t Cry one Ordinary Sunday Afternoon, when I bring Memories and Humpback Whale Song to you and I will give you Hope on the Road to Damascus we together will Make People Happy.

For the past several years I was able to buy new instruments and create home studio. Studio is fully operational now and I recorded and produced 13 songs for my debute album  which is now in post production phaze. Now I need a little help from you to push my project through post production. 


What I Need 

My goal is to raise at least $1500. Here is the breakdown:
Postproduction: 
1. Audio Mastering $500
2. Album Artwork $500
3. Manufacturing of CD's $500


What You Get

  • A beautiful collection of songs in thoughtfully crafted CD package plastic free.
  • A perk of your choice. These include your name in the liner notes, executive producer credit, co-producer credit, see list of perks.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this campaign with everyone! You can help spread my campaign to a whole new audience through Facebook, Twitter and email.

Thank you very much for taking time and checking my campaign.

Davor D.

story:
Acá esta la nueva pagina

https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/primer-urugu...


Mi nombre es Juan Ignacio Lizarralde, soy golfista profesional Uruguayo desde 2007. Empecé jugando a este apasionante deporte a los 5 años con mi padre y mi hermano. Desde ese momento se convirtió en mi pasión.


2013 - Ganador Soul Session Championship y CBG PRO Tour Edition - Brasil

2013 - Puesto #40 PGA Tour Latino.

2012/2014 - Miembro del PGA Tour Latino.

2007 - Participación Miccosukee Open Miami, Nationwide Tour - Estados Unidos

2001/2005 - Ganador de 10 torneos universitarios y regionales por Oklahoma Christian University - Estados Unidos

2004-2005  - Segundo puesto en los nacionales universitarios. - Estados Unidos

2004 - Campeón del Abierto Internacional de Lima - Perú

 2003 - Campeón del Abierto Internacional de Lima - Perú



En Uruguay es muy difícil costear los gastos sin un apoyo económico externo. Para llegar al PGA Tour es necesario cubrir viajes, inscripciones, estadías, caddies y demás gastos que exigen las competiciones de primer nivel. Jugar a este nivel me permitirá sumar puntos para representar a Uruguay en los Juegos Olímpicos.

En los últimos dos años he invertido USD 60.000 aproximadamente de mi propio dinero para cubrir todos estos gastos. Lamentablemente, al no conseguir el apoyo local para seguir compitiendo tuve que desviar la atención de mi entrenamiento para brindar clases de Golf y seguir vinculado al deporte. 

Para continuar compitiendo es necesario contar con USD 40.000 para cubrir el año.

Desde muy joven comencé a perfeccionar mi técnica de la mano de distintos profesores. A los 13 años empecé a competir internacionalmente por Uruguay en América y Europa.  Durante mi carrera como amateur en Uruguay tuve la suerte de ganar la mayoría de los torneos importantes en los que competí (Campeón Nacional, 2 veces Campeón del Abierto de la Ciudad de Montevideo, 3 veces ganador del Campeonato del Club, 2 veces ganador de la Copa de Oro). 

En el 2001 conseguí junto a el equipo uruguayo el primer y único título en la historia del golf uruguayo, el Sudamericano "Copa Los Andes".

En el último año trabajé con  Mariano Bartolomé, uno de los mejores profesores a nivel mundial, para elevar mi juego al máximo nivel. Desde comienzos del 2015, junto a Gonzalo Cortazzo, realizó un acondicionamiento físico completo para estar a la altura de las competencias de alto rendimiento.

El objetivo desde que empecé a jugar competitivamente fue llegar al PGA Tour y competir en los juegos olímpicos representando a Uruguay.

¡Vos podes ayudarme a conseguir este sueño!

Presupuesto por torneo

Total = 18 x u$2.000 = u$36.000

Presupuesto Asia= u$5.000

------------------------------


Here is the new website

https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/primer-urugu...

My name is Juan Ignacio Lizarralde, I am a Uruguayan golfer and been playing professional since 2007.

This adventure started when I was 5 years playing with my father and my brother. Since that moment this sport became my passion.


2013 - Winner Soul Session Championship - Brazil

2013 - CBG PRO Tour Porto Alegre - Brazil

2013 - #40 PGA Tour Latino Order of Merit

2012-2014 - Member of PGA Tour Latino.

2007 - Miccosukee Open Miami, Nationwide Tour - USA

2001-2005 - Winner of 10 tournaments and Regional Tournament while playing  for Oklahoma Christian University - USA

2004-2005 - Second place Universities Nationals Championships - USA 

2004 - Champion of the Lima Golf International Open - Peru

2003 – Champion of the Lima Golf International Open - Peru


In Uruguay it is hard to be a professional golfer and pay for the expenses without an external economic support.

In order to get to the PGA Tour it is necessary to cover trips, inscriptions, stays (hotel), caddies and other expenses that are mandatory to compete at the best level.
Playing at the level mentioned before will allow me to add points to the world ranking and represent Uruguay in the Olympic games.

In the last two years, I had invested out of my own money to cover all these expenses, approximately USD $60,000.

Unfortunately, I was not able to find local support to continue competing, therefor I had to turn aside my attention of training and playing to offer golf classes. This way I can stay linked to this sport.

To continue competing it is necessary to count with USD $40.000 a year to cover the expenses mentioned before.

Since I was very young I started to work on my technique with the help of different coaches.

When I was 13 years old I began competing internationally for Uruguay in America and Europe.

During my amateur carrier in Uruguay, I had the privilege to win most of the main   tournaments in Uruguay (National Champion, 2 times Uruguay Open Champion, 3 times winner of the Club Championship and 2 times winner of the Gold Cup).

In 2001 along with the Uruguayan team, we obtained for the first and only time in Uruguayan history the "Copa Los Andes", South American Match Play championship played in Chile.

Also that same year I earned a scholarship at Oklahoma Christian University, school where I played golf for four years and studied Marketing Management.

For the last three years I’ve been working with Mariano Bartolomé, one of the best golf coaches worldwide, so I can take my game to the next level.

From the beginnings of the 2015 I’ve also been working out and trying to get stronger with Fitness trainer Gonzalo Cortazzo.
I believe that the fitter a golfer can be the better he is going to perform, so that has been another goal I had set for this year.

My goal since I started to play competitively was to get to the PGA Tour and to compete in the Olympic games representing Uruguay.

¡You can help make my dream come true!

Budget by tournament

Total = 18 x u$2.000 = u$36.000

Budget Asia= u$5.000

story:
Let's Fund My Sweet Fall!

Hi! We're My Sweet Fall, an Indianapolis based hard working group of guys who have put an endless amount of time and money into making honest heart pumping rock music. In the last few years we have released 2 albums, left blood, sweat and tears on stage, and gained fans all over the US, and the world. 

With all that we would like to accomplish this year, we simply cannot fund it all by ourselves. With YOUR help, we will be able to take all of our hard work, and share it with as many people as possible. Help us skyrocket My Sweet Fall to new heights!


What We Need & What You Get

Your donations will assist us in:

  • Record + Release our next album
  • Shoot new music videos
  • Purchase our first van/trailer
  • Tour the United States

Now let's get down to what YOU'LL get out of it!

We worked together to come up with a list of perks you would be interested in. You've got anywhere from your basic music download perks and T-shirts, all the way to having your name tattooed to Nick's ass as his first tattoo. (Seriously.)

The Impact You're Making

All we've ever wanted as a band is to play for, and impact as many people as we possibly can. With your help, you're making that dream come true. Our fans, friends, and family have been the greatest people to us this far in our career, and now we're extending out our hands for you to assist us towards this next step in our career.

The new songs we're writing for our next release are the best, and most honest we've written yet... Help us make the world listen!

We have all faced road blocks of many forms in our lives, and with the help of good friends,  supportive families and inspirational music, we have made it this far. Our persistence alone will keep us going for years to come, but with your help nothing can stand in the way of us and our dreams. 

So thank you again, to new fans and old, for coming to shows, sharing our music, or even just reading this far down the page. It means the world to us to have you by our side and we assure you we will do our very best to be our very best. Donate what you can, enjoy the perks, and most of all enjoy the music.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you just can't scrape up the funds, but you still want to assist us, please take a second to simply share this link on your social media. Word of mouth can be the best form of support sometimes, and we greatly appreciate it!

-My Sweet Fall
