story:
Who Am I?

Hey peeps! My name is Catalina Gonzalez. I am a 21-year-old, Chilean singer/songwriter currently based out of the area of New Haven, Connecticut. I have been making music ever since I was 12. I have released two official EPs since 2012 (YOU CAN CHECK THEM OUT HERE) and I think now is the time to make an actual full-length album. I have the songs and the ideas but sadly, I am lacking the money. I'm doing my best effort to save money on my day-to-day routine. However, I thought I could get by with a little help from my friends! (Am I right?)

I recorded my most recent EP, "Roadrunner", up at SubCat Studios in Syracuse, NY. For this full-length album I will be coming back to this wonderful location at the end of May in order to make some sweet tunes with the help of engineer Jeremy Johnston and my friends, Evan Pitonzo and Justin Costello. Recording at a state-of-the-art studio costs money, especially since I would like to add a kick ass brass section on this album, which equals more $$$. This investment is overdue and I find that it is necessary to catapult me into the next stage of my career. I have already been adventuring around different cities, performing and spreading my presence and sound. All I need is fuller and more professional body of work to present physically and online. THIS IS IT!

I ask you to help me as much as you can! A dollar here, a dollar there, and everything above and in between is beyond appreciated. If you are not in a place where you can donate money to my fund, then all I ask of you is to spread the word and share my campaign on your social media platforms! Either way you help, I will be forever grateful.

THANK YOU!!! :)

-------------------------------------------------------------------------

VERSIÓN EN ESPAÑOL:

¿Quién Soy?

Hola chicos y chicas! Mi nombre es Catalina González. Soy cantautora chilena de 21 años de edad, actualmente residiendo en la área de New Haven, Connecticut, en EEUU. He estado creando música desde que tenía 12 años y he lanzado dos EPs oficiales desde el 2012 (PUEDE ESCUCHARLOS AQUÍ). Creo que ahora es el momento en el que tengo que crear un album completo. Tengo las canciones y las ideas, pero por desgracia, me falta el dinero. Estoy haciendo mí mejor esfuerzo para ahorrar dinero en mi rutina diaria. Sin embargo, pensé que podía encontrar una ayuda extra con mis amigos/as!

Grabé mi EP más reciente, "Roadrunner", un estudio llamado SubCat Studios en Syracuse, NY. Para este álbum de larga duración voy a volver a este maravilloso estudio de grabación a fines de Mayo con el fin de grabar este album debút con la ayuda del ingeniero en sonido, Jeremy Johnston y mis amigos Evan Pitonzo y Justin Costello. Grabar en un estudio de este calibre cuesta dinero, sobre todo porque me gustaría añadir nueva instrumentación, lo que equivale a más $$$. He dejado que mucha agua corra por el río y ya es tiempo de hacer esta inversión la cual me parece que es necesaria ya que me va a catapultar a la siguiente etapa de mi carrera. Ya he aventurado y tocado en diferentes ciudades y he difundido mi presencia y sonido. Ahora todo lo que necesito es una obra completa y con más cuerpo profesional para presentarle al mundo! AHORA ES LA HORA!

Les pido toda la ayuda que me puedan dar! Un dólar aquí, un dólar allá, y todo lo que se encuentra entre medio está más que apreciado. Sí ustedes no pueden donar dinero a mi campaña, entonces todo lo que pido es que difundan mi campaña con sus familias y amigos/as en sus plataformas sociales! Estaré super agradecida por cualquier tipo de ayuda que me puedan dar!

Muchas gracias!!! :)
story_txt:
Who Am I?
 Hey peeps! My name is Catalina Gonzalez. I am a 21-year-old, Chilean singer/songwriter currently based out of the area of New Haven, Connecticut. I have been making music ever since I was 12. I have released two official EPs since 2012 (YOU CAN CHECK THEM OUT HERE) and I think now is the time to make an actual full-length album. I have the songs and the ideas but sadly, I am lacking the money. I'm doing my best effort to save money on my day-to-day routine. However, I thought I could get by with a little help from my friends! (Am I right?)


I recorded my most recent EP, "Roadrunner", up at SubCat Studios in Syracuse, NY. For this full-length album I will be coming back to this wonderful location at the end of May in order to make some sweet tunes with the help of engineer Jeremy Johnston and my friends, Evan Pitonzo and Justin Costello. Recording at a state-of-the-art studio costs money, especially since I would like to add a kick ass brass section on this album, which equals more $$$. This investment is overdue and I find that it is necessary to catapult me into the next stage of my career. I have already been adventuring around different cities, performing and spreading my presence and sound. All I need is fuller and more professional body of work to present physically and online. THIS IS IT!


I ask you to help me as much as you can! A dollar here, a dollar there, and everything above and in between is beyond appreciated. If you are not in a place where you can donate money to my fund, then all I ask of you is to spread the word and share my campaign on your social media platforms! Either way you help, I will be forever grateful.
THANK YOU!!! :)
-------------------------------------------------------------------------
VERSIÓN EN ESPAÑOL:
¿Quién Soy? Hola chicos y chicas! Mi nombre es Catalina González. Soy cantautora chilena de 21 años de edad, actualmente residiendo en la área de New Haven, Connecticut, en EEUU. He estado creando música desde que tenía 12 años y he lanzado dos EPs oficiales desde el 2012 (PUEDE ESCUCHARLOS AQUÍ). Creo que ahora es el momento en el que tengo que crear un album completo. Tengo las canciones y las ideas, pero por desgracia, me falta el dinero. Estoy haciendo mí mejor esfuerzo para ahorrar dinero en mi rutina diaria. Sin embargo, pensé que podía encontrar una ayuda extra con mis amigos/as! Grabé mi EP más reciente, "Roadrunner", un estudio llamado SubCat Studios en Syracuse, NY. Para este álbum de larga duración voy a volver a este maravilloso estudio de grabación a fines de Mayo con el fin de grabar este album debút con la ayuda del ingeniero en sonido, Jeremy Johnston y mis amigos Evan Pitonzo y Justin Costello. Grabar en un estudio de este calibre cuesta dinero, sobre todo porque me gustaría añadir nueva instrumentación, lo que equivale a más $$$. He dejado que mucha agua corra por el río y ya es tiempo de hacer esta inversión la cual me parece que es necesaria ya que me va a catapultar a la siguiente etapa de mi carrera. Ya he aventurado y tocado en diferentes ciudades y he difundido mi presencia y sonido. Ahora todo lo que necesito es una obra completa y con más cuerpo profesional para presentarle al mundo! AHORA ES LA HORA!Les pido toda la ayuda que me puedan dar! Un dólar aquí, un dólar allá, y todo lo que se encuentra entre medio está más que apreciado. Sí ustedes no pueden donar dinero a mi campaña, entonces todo lo que pido es que difundan mi campaña con sus familias y amigos/as en sus plataformas sociales! Estaré super agradecida por cualquier tipo de ayuda que me puedan dar!Muchas gracias!!! :)

story:
Updates: 

Oct. 1st - Note about T-Shirt Sizes! We will follow up with you individually and request T-Shirt sizes at the end of the campaign. Thank you so much!


Oct. 2nd - "At the end of the day we want to be a production resource for musicians where money isn't the most important factor."




Who we are.

Raleigh Recording Company is a start up of multicultural audio professionals with a passion for audio production (music recording, audio for video, radio spots, custom scores) and an even stronger urge to be a major contributor to the development of music production in Raleigh, NC and its surrounding areas.   

We believe there is a great deal of musical talent in NC. Through routine community projects, supporting local non-profits, and working closely with local businesses and artists, we hope to establish a greater sense of community and a higher standard of audio quality in NC. Beginning with Raleigh.  

We love Raleigh. We love music. We’d love to share our vision with you. 


Donald Best 

I was born in Panama City, Panama. I grew up listening to popular music on the radio along with a wide mix of classic Latin rhythms and folk music. American Pop and Latin music were my earliest musical influences. 
After moving to the US I decided to pursue further education and eventually a career in audio recording and production. In 2009 I graduated from Full Sail University in Orlando, FL with an Associate of Science in Recording Arts and a Bachelor of Science in Music Business. After freelancing for a few years in Florida, I made a career move to Raleigh, NC. 
I've since worked for musicians and corporate clients through various companies and am now in the process of applying my learned skills and experience to Raleigh Recording Co.  

Elthon Mendoza 

I was born in Veracruz, Mexico but I've lived in the US for the last 19 years. My blood is Mexican and my heart American. My father named me Elthon due to his passion for music, Elton John's successful career, and his desire to have a son that would love music and eventually choose it as his career. The “H” in my name was added by my parents for individuality.  

I was raised in the states and immediately showed interest in music at a young age. I grew up listening to popular music, rock, ballads, and have always favored music driven by a talented vocalist. At the age of 15 I began to focus on building my skills as a guitarist.  

After graduating high school I went to a Gap Year school to really focus on myself, develop my leadership skills, personal character, and ultimately figure out what I really wanted to do. At this time I was actively recording and learning as much as I could about audio production. I then applied, was accepted, and granted a scholarship into Palm Beach Atlantic University of Florida for Music Composition and Performance. However, upon realizing my true passion and potential, I decided to stay in Raleigh, NC and begin a career in audio production and engineering. 

I have been freelancing, working with various companies, and making professional connections since I made the decision to stay in Raleigh. My part in Raleigh Recording Co. is contributing the unique structural approach to audio production and engineering that I've developed through my personal experience.


Trevor Howard 

I was born right here in Raleigh, North Carolina and grew up in the surrounding area. Raleigh has always been known for it’s vibrant music scene and I was exposed to many different styles of music including country, hip-hop and rock.

My real interest in music began at the age of 10 when I started taking piano lessons. This helped spark my passion for music and I came to learn a lot about not only music theory, but the history of music as well. A few years later I began taking guitar lessons and this only served to strengthen my passion for music.

What I enjoy most however, is working with other musicians. Since around the age of 18 I've been an active part of the Raleigh music scene. With Raleigh Recording Co. I want to take that to the next level! I want to work with other musicians and help them not only further their musical careers  but also be a part of the wonderful music and culture that Raleigh has to offer. 


How we got to "now."

Over the last 5 years we've individually put in countless hours, dollars, and personal time building our relationships, experience, and business ideas. Over the last year alone we've invested over $30,000 in preparation for where we are now. We have a lot at stake and we couldn't be more excited to get Raleigh Recording Co. off the ground.



What we need. 

We need $50,000 to cover our non-recoupable construction costs which include:

  • Building materials 
  • Construction & manual labor costs
  • Design Engineer
  • Structural Engineer 
  • Permits & Inspections
  • Contractor
  • etc.

Initial studio layouts and designs. 


Current space.

We're in an industrial space located less than 10 min from downtown Raleigh, NC. 


Even if our goal is not reached, all money raised will be used exclusively to fund construction costs. We already have a $25,000 investment for equipment and other various misc. startup costs. 

Now we're asking for your help in funding our studio construction.


What you get.

We will be providing very cool limited run items like shirts, stickers, discounts, and even free studio time/projects to contributors! 
See breakdown of contribution perks in the "perks" section to the right ---->

Perks.

Stickers.

   2.5"x 2.5" clear vinyl (square sticker, solid heart, transparent background.

   
2.5"x 2.5" vinyl   

 
2"x 5" vinyl

                                          

Koozies.


T-shirts.

Note about T-Shirt Sizes! We will follow up with you individually and request T-Shirt sizes at the end of the campaign. Thank you so much!

 



i-Phone 6 case.


ALL DONATIONS OF $10 OR MORE WILL INCLUDE STICKERS UNTIL WE RUN OUT.

Check out our basic business "pitch" here: https://pitch.liveplan.com/qGSNb/YIRcX

Full business plan available for those interested in further investment or partnering with us.


P.S. - We acknowledge that we've set a pretty ambitious goal. We've already started construction and have some investment capital lined up. We wanted to open the door for community involvement and contribution right from the start. 
Even if we don't reach our full goal, we will use 100% of the money to fund as much of the construction costs as possible. 

The impact.

By contributing to our start up you will be helping us begin one of our lifelong goals, having a positive impact within our community while doing something we love. Music. We've already started working with local non profits, artists, and businesses but need your help in reaching the next step: building our physical studio space. 


Risks & challenges.

We are fully aware that we may not reach our full goal in which case we have alternate funding options lined up. We are hopeful in sharing our vision with you and appreciative of the help we've received so far. Either way, Raleigh Recording Co. will happen and we'd love for you to be a part of it. Rewards/Perks will still be fulfilled regardless of having reached the full goal or not. 


Other ways you can help.

Even if you can't help financially, you can share with friends or anyone else you think might be interested in contributing to our start up. We are always open to ideas and new ways to collaborate with people. Much love, Donald, Elthon, & Trevor. 


Credits & thank yous.

Thank you Vann Dwiggins for helping us with this video, Jayne Worth for design and branding, Emily Kohler for design and graphics, Aron Robbins (Savior Guitar) for being a great friend and also letting us shoot inside your shop, (bands in order of appearance) Gray Young, Jessica Long & The New Kind, Supreme Fiction, The Pseudo Cowboys, Aarik & Josh Duncan from Ncognito, Professor Toon, The Real Laww,  Adam Pitts, Morning Times for fueling our meetings and being our unofficial office, and a huge thanks to everyone else who has helped us this far. 
Lastly, and possibly most importantly a HUGE thank you to Max Dearing for the insane amount of help in the studio design/and building process. Not only is Max an amazing person but he also owns one of the best recording studios in NC, Dark Pines Studios.

story:
Indiegogo Contest Guitar - USA Fender Stratocaster


So here's how it works... Starting at just $25 you will be entered to win this American made Fender Stratocaster!  Want a better chance to win?  The more you contribute, the better chance you have of taking this baby home.  Not a Steady Rush fan quite yet?  Just replace the pickguard (until you become a fan) :) and you walk away with a guitar valued at $1400!  Good Luck!

Hello Everyone!  First and foremost, thank you for visiting our campaign site.  We are incredibly grateful for all of the love and support that we've had from our fans thus far, and we are thrilled to share this exciting endeavor of creating our first full-length album with all of you  =)

When we formed this duo in 2011, we were two young women with a few stories to tell, and we had some friends and family who were willing to listen.  Along the way, we have learned the importance of growing, truly connecting with our listeners, and holding fast to what we believe is the purpose behind the music.  We hope to create songs that highlight and inspire all that is good and honest in humanity. 

With humble hearts and eyes focused on the horizon, we are now ready to take all that we have learned and leap into the next realm of creativity...and we need your help to do it.  With your contributions, we will finally be able to communicate the full vision of Steady Rush.  If you've been following us for a while, you have undoubtedly caught glimpses along the way (when we could afford to record a few songs for you), but now we are asking you to help us create something that we believe can impact daily lives and the musical world around us.  We really do believe that every song has the potential to affect the soul.  Whether it makes us want to dance or run, smile or cry, or feel sad about a past breakup, or take the chance on new love...music is meant to MOVE US.  We may be the ones writing and performing the songs, but the music actually belongs to us all.  That's why we want this album to involve more than just the two of us.

Our interactions with friends, family, and listeners have inspired each one of our songs.  Because we have devoted ourselves tirelessly to this craft, it feels like we've been doing it for a long time.  The reality however, is that this is just the beginning.  We hope you will join us for the rest of the journey.  We can't wait to bring our entire catalogue of songs to life with you!


  • Pre-production
  • Recording
  • Mixing
  • Mastering
  • Travel
  • Album Artwork (photographer & graphic designer)
  • Print and Distribution of Album
  • Marketing and PR
  • Multimedia (videos, photos, social media, and other promotional materials)
  • Perks Production & Shipment
  • Indiegogo Fee

We are grateful for any and every contribution made.  This project is an ambitious goal, and we're ready to make the most of it if (when) we reach it!  The more we raise, the more we can create!


These are just a few of the perks that we've been dreaming up for you...

  • Tri-blend T Shirt with official logo  (Vintage Feel / Comfortable Fashion Fit)
  • "You Know You Need" (original song) Lyric Coffee Mug
  • SR Tote Gift Bag Full of Our Favorite Things
  • VIP/Backstage Passes to a Steady Rush Concert

Meet Molly Fiorentino


Meet Kylie Hartman


Steady Rush is a female Pop Rock duo from Boise, ID (currently living in Denver, CO).  With Steady Rush, audiences get a two-for-one sound.  Combine Kylie Hartman's Blues Rock flare with Molly Fiorentino's Dance Pop sounds, and listeners are guaranteed a memorable show. This unique duo cannot go unnoticed. From their distinct voices to their prominent looks, these two performers complement each other in true yin-yang fashion. Even with such contrasting backgrounds, these young ladies have an undeniable harmony.  Before their paths crossed in 2009, Hartman and Fiorentino had each been developing as songwriters.  Now as a duo, they channel their individual and shared inspirations into their ever-evolving songwriting process.  All of their songs come from personal experiences, and from a desire for mankind to be better.  For them, the goal to positively affect the world drives them harder than any other motivation.  It isn't about fame and fortune for these two, it's about so much more.

If you want more information about Steady Rush, you can check out the following publications:

  • Restoration Living "Steady Rush Playlist"
  • I Am That Girl "THAT GIRL:  Steady Rush"
  • Idaho Statesman "Radio Ads Highlight Steady Rush, Local Bands"
  • American Family Insurance's Dream Bank "Steady Rush:  Just a Girl, Her Guitar, and a Dream"

You can also visit Steady Rush's official website.


If you aren't able to contribute financially, no problem!  You can make a huge difference for us, simply by spreading the word and sharing the link to this campaign on your social media outlets!  Telling people about Steady Rush can be just as valuable during this campaign.  With utmost sincerity and gratitude, we thank you for being involved in any way that you are willing and able to be.  The sky is the limit, so let's take flight!
Molly Fiorentino & Kylie Hartman
Steady Rush

// You need to fly.  You need to reach the unreachable heights.  You know the stakes are high.  So take a breath before you leap into the sky, and fly high.  //

story:
Approaching Troy
Approaching Troy is a 5 piece band based out of Long Island, NY. This band started as an outlet and solo project for lead singer/songwriter Jake Salazar, but during its  inception back in 2010, Jake had no idea how huge this project was really going to be. Fast forward to 2015, with the addition of Bassist Dom Bono, guitarists Jay Sutherland and Sean Doherty, drummer Joe Neglia and many goals accomplished the band is finally on their way to success. There's one problem though, we need your help. For the past 6 months, the band has worked diligently on their new EP, "Dear Sadie" from tracking, to recording, and are in the final steps of releasing this giant EP for us. Unfortunately, recording an album is unbelievably expensive. This is where we turn to you guys; our family, friends and most importantly the people who have showed us love and support since our very first show almost 4 years ago and now our brand new awesome fans as well. 

What We Need & What You Get

Here's the lowdown of the project. We need about $800 to finish this project including, recording costs, mastering, and duplication; but we don't just want to take your money; believe us thats the last thing we want to do. We have several perks just for believing in us and helping us achieve our dreams. These perks range from an Official Approaching Troy Bracelet, a signed copy of our new EP "Dear Sadie", when it comes out, a signed t-shirt, personalized Skype session with the band, to an in-house personal acoustic performance for you and your friends. (Check the side bar for more perks.) 

The Impact

We will be releasing our dream project, a 5 song EP that we believe will open new doors for us in the music industry and some awesome prizes will be given away for those who can contribute and help us toward that goal. We promise you an EP you'll never forget as well as new videos on our youtube and facebook page to help keep you guys constantly updated on our progress. We never forget an amazing fan and friend. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We can't tell you how much every bit of your donation means to us but we also realize times are tough and some of you just can't contribute at this time, and we absolutely understand that. You can still help us out by getting the word out about not only our name but our campaign by sharing our campaign on every possible social media outlet you own. When you do please tag us in the post and well give you a shout out!  There are also some indiegogo share buttons that make it really easy to share our campaign. Thank you guys so much for everything you've given us up to this point and the continued support. WE REALLY APPRECIATE EACH AND EVERYONE OF YOU.

story:
We are very excited to announce that our 4th full length recording is ready to get real. The release date will be around May 2015.

  • We are the first Pagan Metal band from Austria
  • We are doing our music since 2005. It is our heart and soul.
  • With your contribution you are supporting not only a great recording but first of all our big dream: to do what we love. That sounds lofty? True. But it is just like that!

SHIPPING COSTS: Sorry to bother you right away but please don't forget to add the appropriate shipping cost indicated in the perks! 

T- shirt size: Please put your size somewhere in the adress field.

Use the form: ##M## 


Where would your money go?

Sex, drugs and rock and roll? Yes. But not only for things like that ;-)

  • The big part of the money will be used to pay the charges of the recordings.
  • Some money will be needed for the cover/booklet artwork and the layout.
  • We need money for the production of the CD.
  • We would love to give you nice shirts too. It depends on the final sum we get via this campaign but it would be great for us, and for you, to produce shirts made of organic cotton.

If this campaign doesn't work as good as we want it to do... - this album still will be made! Music is our life. It won´t be that easy but you will have the possibility to hold INTO BATTLE in your hands.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute that is completely okay! Not everyone can, but if you have  Facebook, Twitter, Google+ or any other social media please:

  • Spread the word by sharing a link of the campaign.
  • Tell your friends about this page.
  • Like our FB, follow our Twitter, visit our site and order your folks to do the same.
  • Write about it in your Forum/ Webzine/ Printed media
  • Buy something via bandcamp: https://heathenforay.bandcamp.com


@"Retro Pack" We decided to deliver the CD as soon as we get your order. :-)

@VIP- Forever Pack: You will get a personalised VIP pass. We will need your name and a picture of you.

We may present to you: The main theme of the upcomming T-shirt design!

story:
Why Priya needs a van

Priya Ray has been part of the underground cult band Kreamy 'Lectric Santa for the past 23 years of her life. 


In 1999 she had a tragic accident where she sustained a spinal injury and is now wheelchair bound. Though faced with many obstacles she continues to make music on her own terms as she did before. Besides making music Priya went to art school for photography and continues to make art and has recently found herself taking portraits of people which she really enjoys. She  really feels this is something she can make a business out of.

To continue to live her life the way she wants. Priya now needs a van. This van will allow her to play music, tour, keep making her art, and taking portraits. Priya has contributed a lot to her community through her music and art and your contribution will help her continue to do this.

Throughout her life Priya has always been a person that gives. Her partner and her started their band 23 years ago they fostered a community that helped the music and art in Miami flourish into what it is today. It has been through her art and music she has supported so many less fortunate than her by organizing benefits and fundraisers for organizations like Food Not Bombs, Foundation for Freedom, Jakmel Ekspreseyon, as well as individuals with illnesses or injuries that needed money in their time of need. She is a person that has given so much of herself over the years and now we are hoping that all her years of selflessness will somehow come back to her so she can continue to help others.   


As always Priya is always thinking of other before she thinks of herself. Getting a vehicle she could actually drive she would not only allow her play music and make art but will also allow her be a inspirational speaker.  While she is physically disabled she strongly believes that people with any disability physical or mental can overcome them and live an amazing a fulfilling life. That everyone has obstacles they need to overcome and with hard work and determination nothing can stop you. Her goal is to help others that have suffered a similar fate as she has and help them find a way to work with circumstance they are given. Having a van to drive will be an essential tool for this. Allowing her to gain more independence to accomplish all of this. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We know like us you may not have any money to give. There are many ways you can help. Priya has always been a strong believer in community. She has already been getting strong support from the music and art community. Many people all across the world, Chattanooga TN, Miami FL, Portland OR, Chicago IL, and even New Zealand, are putting on benefits for her because of how her music has touched them. There are 4 online compilations that are being released every 2 weeks on bandcamp (see link bellow) as well as an online art auction from incredible artist's from around the world (see link bellow). All the donations will got to Help Priya get a van.
You can also help by spreading the word though Facebook, Twitter,Instagram, a blog as well as use the tools that Indiegogo has provided to help share her cause. Please help ! Thank you. Team Priya. 


Perk Grid and Links of Importance

Here is a list of links that can help you spread the word, see what the perks look like, and keep yourself informed. :)



~Facebook Page please like :)
~Online music compilation available on Bandcamp.
  • There are 4 separate complilations available for 10$ each on Bandcamp. We will add the links here as they come out.
  • You can get the whole package for 30$
  • To get the whole package PayPal us at kreamyetc@yahoo.com and say "I want the whole package !"

story:
Who we are

We are two Italian brothers (Sebastiano and Federico) who live in Milan and music is our greatest passion. We have studied it since we were children and we have always thought that people who live in music could have more opportunities to share their art.
Our project is very simple and we think it could be very useful for all those who love music. 

We are now going to explain it. 


Our project 

We would like to make a website where you can create your personal music CD. On this website, called Memo, you can select all the characteristics of your own CD (number of compositions, CD cover's picture, the layout of the CD…). You can upload your tracks on the website directly from home and then you can send your ''virtual'' CD and wait for it to be made. We will create your dream CD, folllowing your instructions. Finally we will send you the CD and you will be able to listen to your music on your personal CD!
Those who wish to sell their own music can do so through our website. You will find a specific section where you can upload your music and compositions and try to sell them to anybody who visits this section. This is called the market section. 
In this way, anybody can start a CD market net without any third party!


Why our project can be so useful

We think this project is going to be successful because having a CD with personal compositions can be a reason of pride for people who play and compose music, and, why not, it could be the beginning of something more.                                                                                                                                                                         

Well, we want you to have a personal recording studio at home, in your computer!

How you can make use of your music CD

- A surprising and special gift
- The symbol of your music efforts
- A reason of pride 
- A strong motivation to improve yourself
- A collector's object

However, in order to make this project  we need a complete website. We need help to organize it, because programmers aren't free and we don't have much money! We need help to start our business and advertise Memo. We really hope we will reach our goal, because we really want to give people this exciting opportunity!

We hope you will find our idea interesting and you will support us in making it come true. 

Help us make Memo website! Help us make your music dream come true!

THANK YOU FOR EVERYTHING! 


Memo's logo 


Two examples of a Memo CD




Perks

Memo wants to give a great chance to all the founders of our project! With our perks, you can either give a part of your sum to associations that fight against  our world's problems or have a discount on your purchases.
So If you support us with our perks, you will support associations such as  "Save the Children"  (against poverty) and WWF (to protect endangered animals). Besides,  you can have a big discount on our CDs!
When we make our website, we will post the bank transfer on it to prove your donation.
Help these associations reach their goal by helping us make Memo website.

"Save the Children". Became a ''Golden Heart''!


"WWF". Became an ''Animal Lover''!

Big chance for you with our perk ''Lucky Crowfounder''!

Would you like to visit such a gorgeous place? Win this travel with our perk ''Travel Winner''!

Risks & Challenges

We want to give music lovers this fantastic opportunity and we will try hard to make this website even if we could come across difficulties on our path. 

We will incur expenses, we will have to have the right means and we will have to advertise our website. These are very important details that we will not ignore.


Other Ways You Can Help Us

If you can't give us a financial contribution, you can help us sharing our project as much as possible the way you like best (ex. social networks...). 
Thank you so much for helping us, in any way you can!

story:
Hey folks! It's time to jump into the fire and be part of an artistic endeavor! Bon Lozaga will be releasing his 4th solo CD "Traces Of Chaos"and needs your help. Funds will go to manufacturing and promoting this album.

You might know Bon from his work with Gong & Gongzilla, or maybe Tiny Boxes, or is it Project Lo and his work with Happy Rhodes??? You may have seen him play with Umphreys McGee or moe.!! You may have heard him play with David Torn, Allan Holdsworth, Mike Oldfield, David Fiuczynski, Gary Husband....You might have read his interview in Guitar Player Magazine or....... you might not know about him at all!!!!

"Traces Of Chaos" is his new guitar/instrumental album featuring special guests Ryan Martinie (Mudvayne), Kai Eckhardt (Garaj Mahal, John McLaughlin), Kofi Burbridge (Tedeschi Trucks Band) and Joel Cummins (Umphreys McGee). Recorded over several years, the album is now in the can and just needs to be manufactured.

Your contribution will make this happen. Even spreading the word thru indiegogo will help!!

story:
Short Summary

The Booked have been playing punk rock n roll for over 17 years now.  We have played all over the U.S. and have previously released 2 albums:  "Feel The Pride" (2000) and "On The Attack" (2012).  We are now preparing to go into the studio to record our 3rd full length record.  As of now we are recording and releasing this record on our own without the help of a label.  We are very excited about the songs on this upcoming record and we want it to be the best recorded album we can make.  We have chosen to record this record with the good folks at Westfall Recording Company in Austin, TX.  As you can imagine, a good studio does not come cheap and that is why we need your help.  We are a working class band with families to support and we could not make this record happen without the help of our friends and fans.


What We Need & What You Get

We will be going into the studio at Westfall Recording Company in the middle of May 2015.  As stated before, we are seeking to make a seriously high quality recording with this new album which is why we chose to record it at Westfall.  It is going to cost us $7000 to make this record and all the money raised here will go to recording costs.  We have created some nice perks and packages including exclusive items and designs for anyone who is willing to donate their hard earned money to help us make this record.  These packages were designed to be worth your contribution.  Any funds raised over the goal will go towards mastering costs and/or artwork and manufacturing costs.


The Impact

This is our first time starting a fund raising campaign to finance the making of a record and its the first time we are releasing a record without the help of a record label.  As we've gotten older, growing families, career changes, mortgages and bills have made it very difficult for us to pay for anything like the record we are making now.  Your contribution will go a long way in helping us achieve our goal of making the best sounding record we've ever made.


Other Ways You Can Help

We know not everyone can contribute monetarily but that's not the only way you can help us out.  We would greatly appreciate anyone spreading the word about our fundraising campaign via your social media page, website, blog, email, telephone, fax, regular mail, telegram, message in a bottle or however you communicate with others.  EVERY EFFORT HELPS!  THANKS!!!!

story:
Band Bio

Fear Control has thrice been named as one of the Austin Chronicle's Top 10 Metal Bands in Austin. They have shared the stage with many heavy hitting acts including Nonpoint, Chimaira, Devil You Know, Butcher Babies, 36 Crazyfists, Unloco, Black Tide, Threat Signal, Affiance, Spineshank, Within the Ruins, American Head Charge, Phinehas, Psychostick, Hatchet, Not Tonight Josephine, Sons of Texas, HeadCrusher, Dead By Wednesday, 9Electric, 8Stops7, Shattered Sun, SKREW, Powderburn, Dead Earth Politics, & more...

Short Summary

So here's the deal. Fear Control's brand new EP entitled "The Monster" is being released June 2015. In order to make the most of this and really give us an honest shot at potentially getting this band to the next level, we are embarking on our first tour and are in need of some necessary funds to do so. 

Tour

Going on tour costs money, whether it be the costs of a trailer, gas, food, etc....With your donation, you'd be directly helping us be able to take our show on the road. 

Below are our initial tour dates:

    8/14/2015  SAN ANTONIO

    8/15/2015  AUSTIN

    8/16/2015  EL PASO

    8/18/2015  TUCSON

    8/19/2015  SAN DIEGO

    8/21/2015  LOS ANGELES

    8/22/2015  LAS VEGAS

    8/23/2015  PHOENIX

    8/25/2015  ALBUQUERQUE

    8/26/2015  LUBBOCK

    8/28/2015  TULSA

    8/29/2015  FORT WORTH


Radio Campaign

In addition to the costs of going on tour we are also aiming to launch a nationwide Radio campaign in conjunction with our tour. This is where the bulk of your donation would be going as it is not cheap, but we feel it would be the most beneficial to us by getting our music out to different cities we've never played before.


Merch

Additionally, we are in need of new merchandise (shirts, koozies, etc). With these funds, we can come up with some cool new shirt designs for yall and also be able to provide this to new fans during our tour. We already have some designs ready for print. Check them out in the "Gallery" above.


We have funded the whole recording and production of our new EP as well as our upcoming music video. But we are short on funds to give the push that we feel this EP needs and WE need right now. So we are asking for your help. Every dollar you donate counts toward another step of making our dreams come true. Will you help us?
story_txt:
Band Bio Fear Control has thrice been named as one of the Austin Chronicle's Top 10 Metal Bands in Austin. They have shared the stage with many heavy hitting acts including Nonpoint, Chimaira, Devil You Know, Butcher Babies, 36 Crazyfists, Unloco, Black Tide, Threat Signal, Affiance, Spineshank, Within the Ruins, American Head Charge, Phinehas, Psychostick, Hatchet, Not Tonight Josephine, Sons of Texas, HeadCrusher, Dead By Wednesday, 9Electric, 8Stops7, Shattered Sun, SKREW, Powderburn, Dead Earth Politics, & more...

Short Summary So here's the deal. Fear Control's brand new EP entitled "The Monster" is being released June 2015. In order to make the most of this and really give us an honest shot at potentially getting this band to the next level, we are embarking on our first tour and are in need of some necessary funds to do so. 





 
Tour
Going on tour costs money, whether it be the costs of a trailer, gas, food, etc....With your donation, you'd be directly helping us be able to take our show on the road. 

Below are our initial tour dates:

story:
Before the Supreme Court began its consideration of same-sex marriage this new church was the first in its city to perform them.  As cities like Baltimore find themselves divided by lines of race and class this new church receives an award from the NAACP for its efforts to promote racial unity.  As North Carolina’s General Assembly passes legislation which compromises working families this new church continues to provide child care to disadvantaged families.  As the same General Assembly passes voter suppression laws this new church is the site of voter registration drives. 

  These stands have not come without a cost.  In this small but growing, Southern, Bible –belt city the members and staff of this congregation have faced resistance and at times outright hostility.  These challenges have impacted their budget and their capacity to continue these unique ministries is jeopardized.  They need your help today.

story:
Summary

JoyJoy! Watches is working closely with Mo'ne Davis to create an amazing GIVEBACK project. The idea is to create a CUSTOM MO'NE DAVIS - 3 band interchangeable watch band set. The sets will sell for $70 and JoyJoy! Watches will donate $45 of that sale price to rebuilding Mo'ne's Home Field @ 17th and Fitzwater in Philadelphia. Promoting Baseball to inner city youth by improving and turfing the field, so the kids can play baseball every day.

  • JoyJoy! Watches is a fun art inspired brand that uses colors, patterns, fashion and art to enhance your everyday style. Our waterproof watches are tough, functional and fashionable for everyone. Mo'ne was organically attracted to our product through a mutual friend. We @ JoyJoy! decided this would be a great way to solidify her amazing achievements and future legacy in the city we love.
  • This campaign is a way to celebrate the game of baseball by giving back and immortalizing Mo'ne's legacy in Philadelphia. Allowing the players behind her to have an amazing facility to practice and play. Allowing her Coach, Steve Bandura, to continue his work at the Rec Center and bringing amazing baseball instruction to the youth in the city of Philadelphia.
  • With your help JoyJoy! can achieve our goal to help Mo'ne raise $90,000 to rebuild her beloved home field. Quite an accomplishment for a 14 year old girl!

What We Need & What You Get

  • The Funds will go directly to the hard costs of fixing the dugouts, back stop, and having turf installed for both the infield and outfield of this facility. It allows the kids to play year round. The turf accommodates multiple sports such as soccer and baseball. Over 100 kids can use this facility for games, practice and pick up EVERYDAY!
  • For your generous donation you can receive 1 of 2014 total production custom Mo'ne Davis watches. A limited release for our special project
  • Regardless of reaching our $90,000 goal, JoyJoy! will donate $45 from each sale or contribution to our fund. All of it going directly to the Rec Center. We will also be selling this product directly on our web site for a limited time. INDIE GO GO is a great way for us to include as many people as possible in the project.

The Impact

The impact of this project is a catalyst and a spark. Created to DIRECTLY  improve inner city baseball in Philadelphia and forward this energy around the country and the world. Once our nations favorite past time, the youth of large cities have abandoned the game. Mo'ne has reinvigorated young athletes to become reengaged with baseball. Mo'ne is determined to create a better place for the players behind her to play baseball and reach for the Little League World Series themselves.


    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you cannot afford the $70 limited Edition set, JoyJoy! will also make available 1 signature watch band with a watch head for $35. If you can only donate a few bucks...JoyJoy! will send you a #MO311 sticker as a thank you.

story:
Hello, I’m Jo and I make folk pop music as Laurence Made Me Cry. In 2013 I released my debut album ‘The Diary Of Me’ – I was very fortunate to collaborate with many wonderful artists on this project and I’m very proud of what we accomplished. I’m now ready to record my second album ‘Titans’ Daughters’ and I need your help!

Writing for the record is well underway and I’m very excited to be working with another group of amazing collaborators. I’m in a very happy and creative place right now, Scotland is treating me well and the music is flowing in new, thrilling directions. My fascination with Greek mythology, in particular the nine muses, is proving to be excellent songwriting fuel – they are muses after all!

I can’t make this record without YOU. By contributing to this campaign YOU will help bring my stories to life.

What The Muses Need & What YOU Get

‘Titans’ Daughters’ will be recorded primarily by myself (much like my first record) but I’ll also be heading into a professional studio to get some live drums recorded and a few other instruments that might be a little too noisy even for the most understanding of neighbours. I’ll be getting the album professionally mastered and I want to make sure all my collaborators are well looked after too. Finally, some of the funds raised will also help towards the CD productions costs.

There are lots of interesting and unique perks available including handwritten and illustrated lyric/poetry books, a nine muses inspired radio play (I kid you not) and my favourite perk - a hand decorated lyre harp (the muses liked the lyre A LOT).

Going Green

I love the planet we live on. It inspires me, it nurtures me and it regularly blows my mind. If there’s even just a small way that I can make what I produce as a musician more sustainable and earth friendly then I’ll give it a go. So, for this record, LMMC is going green by using eco-friendly companies and materials to create things like the CD packaging down to the ink used to write on the really cool Sheep Poo Paper lyric sheets. I’m also excited to be utilizing online tools like Google Hangouts for live performances meaning a lot less travelling so no nasty CO2 emissions.

Other Ways You Can Help

I know it won’t be possible for everyone to contribute but you can still help by sharing this page with your friends in whatever way you can – via social media, word of mouth, email or carrier pigeon. I appreciate your support so much! If you’ve shared the page, be sure to say hello in the comments section so I can give you a virtual high five!

story:
Dave "Stage" Williams

It's been 13 years since we lost our dear friend, Dave Williams. In remembrance of Dave, we have released a special anniversary edition of the Sinner album, and are performing the album in its entirety live around the US. We have also put together the video you see here for the song, "Soul", which includes rare and never before seen footage of Dave live.
People assume drugs and alcohol are the cause when the news reports that a rock star has died.  Dave actually died of the heart disease known as Cardiomyopathy - disease of the heart muscle.  Dave didn't know he had it.  It often goes undiagnosed. It affects people of all races and ages. 
To celebrate Dave's life and contribution to music, we have partnered with the American Heart of Association of Dallas, TX, and IndieGogo, to raise both awareness of the disease, and funds for further research and development of new treatments.
Make a Donation & Make a Difference

We set the financial goal of $13,000, and know that with the support from all the Drowning Pool friends and fans around the globe, we will hit this!

In exchange for your donation of $30 or more, we have a special tribute t-shirt for you that has Dave's image on the front and the lyrics to the last song we wrote together, "Heroes Sleeping", on the back.

100% of the proceeds will go to the American Heart Association of Dallas, TX in Dave's name.

story:
Short Summary

     They say it takes a village to raise a child, and while I'm far from a "kid" I'd  like to think the community/friends/family that raised me has been integral to my career as a musician!  With this project, I would like to honor (sonically fist bump) everyone who's ever been a part of this crazy adventure.

     It's been a long time since I started writing songs and each step of the way I've grown as a musician.  I've finally reached the point in which I have the relationships to create a high quality project, but I want it to be so much more than that.  I want this EP to exemplify all the things that have made me, well... ME!  The best way I can imagine doing that is by getting everyone involved and really creating a community project.  Together we can make something greater than the sum of our parts.  Together we can take the next HUGE step in this musical journey.

What We Need & What You Get

      There's no 2 ways around it... we need funds!  Don't worry though, it's not free money because every contribution receives something in return.  I have brainstormed with some of my most influential and supportive friends on how to create perks that are awesome/humorous/social/friendly/trendy (pick one... or ALL!)  I want everyone to feel like their investment means something, so EVERY donation will receive something personalized.  This EP doesn't happen without you and I am eternally indebted to everyone who contributes in ANY way.

     In order to cover our base costs, we're going to need to raise around $6000 (that's including the cut that Indiegogo takes).  If we raise this, I'm super confident that we can make this dream a reality!  If we raise more, I have several secret "unlocks" hidden that will help make this project larger than life!  For those who like to know where their dollar is going (and why on EARTH it's so expensive to create art) here is the quick and dirty list of expenses that need to be covered:

  • Producer
  • Engineer
  • Mixing
  • Mastering
  • Physical Studio Time
  • Physical CD Production
  • Indiegogo's cut
  • Mailing Supplies (stamps/envelopes/paper... etc)
  • Marketing       

    I think the most fatal flaw of crowdfunding is people thinking about it as buying something.  This is not an ordinary purchase.  This is an investment into a project (and possible future projects) designed to give back to those who have unyieldingly supported my musical journey.

Risks & Challenges

      So what happens if we don't raise the money?  How do we know this project will come to fruition if we do?  What type of risk is Isaiah (me) taking on in this venture?

     There are a lot of questions that surround a giant project like this and I completely understand people being wary of a 20-something running around with such a large sum of money.  I'd like to take on some of these questions right here:

  • I set the monetary goal as a benchmark to cover my base cost of production.  If we don't reach it, don't worry!  You will not be charged for anything that isn't physically in your possession.
  • If we do make our goal, AWESOME!  That was the whole plan!  I am dedicated to you guys 100% and will provide weekly (if not bi-weekly) updates as to the progress of the project.
  • I'm taking on the risk of my reputation with this project.  If I don't deliver, my stock as a musician/generally good person goes down!  As someone who wants to make a living doing this... it's a bad look.  I take this project as seriously as everyone donating *serious face*
  • I have created a lot of relationships with musicians/engineers/producers in the greater Seattle area in order to keep production time on schedule!  There will be no waiting months and months at a time because of unavailable studios/musicians/producers.

    If you have any other questions PLEASE don't hesitate to ask!  Leave a comment or contact me on Twitter (@IsaiahD) Facebook (facebook.com/isaiahjdominguez) email (idominguezmusic@gmail.com).  I will answer any and ALL questions with 100% honesty.

Other Ways You Can Help

      I don't want anyone to feel left out.  Sometimes circumstances just don't allow you to monetarily support something and that is totally and COMPLETELY ok!  This project isn't about money to me, it's about community.  If you can't donate, please share this with everyone you know!  Indiegogo has made it super easy with the "share" tools that they provide.  I'll give you a shout out if you do, just let me know on Twitter (@IsaiahD) or Facebook (facebook.com/isaiahjdominguez)!

story:
About Carl

Carl Brister is a singer/songwriter originally from the city of Plainfield, NJ.  He has had appearances on BET, NBC, and more. His recent “I’m Still Here” music video is currently airing internationally on VH-1, Magic Johnson’s Aspire network and has reached #1 on PULSE TV/UPN network. Carl’s recording debut was on the SONY/WORD “A Mighty Fortress” release by CD Hawkins and Singers and has since written and produced 3 independent CD’s entitled “The Journey”, “Focus,” and “Undefeated.”

Help Carl Get His Music and Video Heard and Played!

Uncomplicated Love, which is the first single from Carl’s upcoming soulful new  project, has already been reviewed by top industry radio marketing professionals who believe it has great potential on the Adult Contemporary & Urban A/C radio charts.  Acclaimed director Frank G. (Raekwon) who directed Carl’s successful “I’m Still Here” music video has also agreed to direct the “Uncomplicated Love” music video which was shot on March 8th, 2015.  (check out the Behind-the-scenes pics in the "extras" section).

Your contributions will go towards radio marketing & video promotions so that UNCOMPLICATED LOVE can get played on radio, television and Internet stations around the world. 

To do this right, marketing and promotion costs can be expensive.  We’ve offset costs with a starting goal of $5,000.

The Impact

“I want my music to be a launching pad through which I get to do great things for people.  I hope everyone that hears my music will feel uplifted and inspired to love.” states Carl who has been a long-time supporter of HIV/AIDS outreach, Young Father’s programs, African Hunger/Poverty Relief, and educational outreach for students in urban schools in the USA and Caribbean.

Funding Carl’s marketing and promotion campaigns allows him to concentrate more on the message of love and the music itself.

For those of you who don't know Carl, please check out his website www.carlbrister.com and his videos on YouTube. After listening to his signature sound, please come back and contribute. We guarantee that it'll be worth your time. In return you get some great rewards! Check out the Perk section!

Other Ways You Can Help

Another way to help would be to share this page with your friends and family. 

Thank you so much and be sure that Carl will focus all his energy into bringing his uplifting soulful songs of “Uncomplicated Love” to every corner of the globe!

story:
Our Campaign

We are the Choral Singers Unite Society (or C-SUS) We are in our third year as non-profit choral society providing programming and musical education for the Central Alberta Community.  Our accomplished Director Lisa Ward started our Adult choir 11 years ago bringing her wealth of knowledge, talent and musical gifts out into the community. In her many years of choral conducting Lisa's choirs have performed in festivals, competitions, specials events and concerts locally and internationally. 

We are asking for help with our general operating funds. As a society we are not yet eligible for grant money which will eventually help us meet some of our operational costs. As it stands each member pays a substantial fee to cover the costs of music, rehearsal space rental, director and accompanist wages as well as performance space rental to name a few. 

By contributing to this campaign you will help us potentially reduce the membership fees and keep our doors open to further educate and bring music into our community, and beyond. 

Every little bit can help to make our fundraising dreams a reality. We have 2 large annual concerts as well as our local annual fundraiser, bringing together all our groups to perform and raise money. We are a group of hard working members that is dedicated to keeping our society up and running but we need your help. Even many small donations can go a long way to make our goal achievable. Even if you cannot help us by donating, please help us by spreading the word. Get on Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn, Tumblr, Instagram... sing it out from the street corners and tell all your friends. There are share tools built right in here so feel free to click away and help us get the word out there!!

In response to the generosity of our supporters we have a number of Perks available to our contributors. Ranging from C-SUS swag to concert tickets personal performances and more. please check out the perks along the side and see which best fits you and how you would like to support us.

story:
We are bringing to Williamsburg another masterpiece -- Mozart's brilliant comedy Cosi fan tutte, "So Do They All," April 15 and 17 at the Kimball Theatre.   This is Mozart at his best, a sparkling evening of gorgeous melodies embedded in the diverting story of a (deliberate!) lovers' mix-up.

Ticket sales alone are not enough to cover the expense of opera.  We must raise money by donations as well.  Please give generously -- we can do it!

We are fortunate to have assembled a wonderful cast of singers, most of whom have already thrilled the audiences of Opera in Williamsburg: Marco Nistico from our hilarious “Don Pasquale;” Yasmine Levi-Ellentuck and Claudia Chapa, who shone in our “Il Trovatore;”  and Sidney Outlaw, so well received in our “Elisir d’Amore.” Joining them are Williamsburg-native Michelle Trovato and prize-winning tenor Cesar Delgado.  We are delighted that our Musical Director, Maestro Jorge Parodi, will again be wielding the baton for this exciting event.

It was a huge honor that David Nicholson of the “Daily Press” included both of our 2014 productions, “Don Pasquale” and “Lucia di Lammermoor,” in his list of the “Best Performances of 2014” in Tidewater Virginia (December 28).

Any place where excellent opera can take place is to be treasured. Smaller opera companies like us fulfill a crucial need.  We can take risks that larger groups can't afford.  We have shown in all six of our previous productions that we know how to pick singers who are magnificent in their roles, and they relish the opportunity to work together.  Check the video clips in the gallery of this fund-raising drive and see more at our web site, www.operainwilliamsburg.org

I love opera, but I am not a big donor.  What can a person like me do?

Give us what you would spend on a nice dinner.  Believe us, it will make a difference.  A significant portion of our budget is covered by ticket sales, but we must rely on donations as well to cover the expenses of each production.  Fractured Atlas, our fiscal sponsor, provides excellent oversight of our spending.  Direct donating is by far the most efficient way to support the performing arts.  Please give to the performing groups you love -- we can't do it without you.

I really love opera and I love what you are doing, but I can't do anything about it right now.

Yes you can!  We treasure your good will.  Please tell others about us.  Share our fund-raising drive and tell your friends how you love what we do. 

Even if you give just $10, your contribution matters.  If each of us gives just $10 we can do it!  Even if you can't, please tell your friends about us.  You can use Indiegogo share tools (on this page) .  A shout-out on Facebook or Twitter is worth a great deal.  Thank you so much for your love of opera and for your faith in Opera in Williamsburg!

story:
Short Summary

This summer we are driving 12,000 miles on a cross country tour. Andrew is playing shows. Maura is doing publicity. We'll be experiencing the full beauty of the USA in over 40 cities across the country, and playing music along the way!

 America

  • We don't want to go on this tour at the expense of everyone else in the world, so the first $300 raised will go towards carbon offsets. 
  • All additional money will cover travel expenses.
  • If we can provide any value to you with the perks below, we'd be honored to have your help on this!

What We Need

  • We will be driving 12,000 miles in our 16mpg vehicle, and will be burning 750 gallons of gasoline and releasing 6.7 metric tons of carbon dioxide into the atmosphere.

Our "Tour Bus"
  • We're going to offset 23 metric tons (more than 3x the tour's emissions) of CO2 with a $300 donation to the Improved Forest Management protocol of The City of Arcata Community Forest Barnum Tract via TerraPass. These are Green-e Climate Certified carbon offsets regulated by The Climate Action Reserve.
  • The rest of the funds will help cover travel expenses for the tour (gas, oil changes, parking, tolls, eating, basic necessities, not running out of money and being stranded in Kansas).

What You Get

  • A postcard from a city of your choosing with our thanks for helping us fully experience the beauty of the USA.
  • A shout-out at a show of your choice, publicly thanking you for backing the tour and helping us out.
  • An exclusive physical copy of Andrew's new album, Fireworks in Autumn, before the official release of the album in August.
  • A polaroid picture from a location of your choosing! Signed by us with the date and the location, as well a custom message about the story behind the picture. We'll be visiting a bunch of cool places (Niagara Falls, Mount Rushmore, Yellowstone, Redwood Forests, Grand Canyon, etc.) in a bunch of cities (listed at bottom of page) and will try our best to get you whatever picture you request. 

    We can get you a photo JUST like this!
    Want a Polaroid picture of Maura eating a Philly cheese steak even though she's lactose intolerant? Done. A picture of Andrew pretending to be a cattle farmer in the plains of Kansas? Sure thing. A picture from the top of the Space Needle in Seattle, or of a nude beach in Southern California, or the sunrise behind the NYC skyline? You get the idea.
  • A custom jingle to send to a friend (or yourself) from a location of your choosing! For reference, in the past few months Andrew has partnered with both Uber and Wheat Thins to do custom Twitter video replies like these.
     
  • A Facebook or Twitter social media shout-out from a city of your choosing, once we arrive! Example "We just made it to Portland! Shout-out @YourName for making this possible. Thank you, we love you <3"
  • A bumper sticker on our "tour bus" to be seen across the country by over 5.4 million people (according to studies by the Traffic Audit Bureau and the US Department of Transportation). We will post pictures of your bumper sticker on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram, thanking you and your business for your support!

   Like this, but replace "USA" with your name.   

  • A house concert, if you live along the route of the tour and we can coordinate something during free time in your city! Email andrew@andrewtufano.com to see if we can work something out.
  • If you pay us $750, Andrew will tattoo your initials on the inside of his lip. No joke.

The Impact

There's a lot of beauty all around us in this country, and we want to experience, share, and preserve it before we're old. This isn't a charity, and there are plenty of better causes out there for people in serious need, but if we can make the world a slightly better place by buying carbon offsets and spreading some beauty, and provide you some personal value with a custom song or picture, we are MORE than grateful for your contributions. Thank you, truly, for reading this far down, and we hope to see you on the road this summer :)


The Team

Andrew Tufano is a young, entrepreneurial musician whose persona can be defined by the statement: “It’s the miles, not the years.” Embarking on his first nationwide tour in support of the release of his third record Fireworks In Autumn, Tufano is a devout Wheat Thins-loving performer who has been compared to artists such as Ed Sheeran and Amos Lee.

Maura Mazurowski is the one-person support team responsible of all things media for Tufano. She has a diverse background sparked by her love for journalism and possesses the rare ability to mimic a dolphin’s cry. To schedule an interview, back stage pass or selfie with Tufano, Maura is the gatekeeper and can be reached at MauraMazurowski@gmail.com.


The Tour Route
Here's a map of our route:

Tour dates:

May 29, 30 // Charles Town, WV
May 31, June 1, 2, 3, 4 // Sterling, VA
June 5, 6 // Richmond, VA
June 7, 8 // Sterling, VA
June 9 // Potomac, MD
June 10 // Philadelphia, PA
June 11 // Asbury Park, NJ
June 12, 13 // New York, NY
June 14 // Bridgeport, CT
June 15, 16 // Boston, MA
June 17, 18 // Catskills, NY
June 19, 20 // Buffalo, NY
June 21, 22, 23, 24 // Ann Arbor, MI
June 25, 26 // Chicago, MI
June 27 // Milwaukee, WI
June 28 // Madison, WI
June 29 // Minneapolis, MN
June 30 // Mount Rushmore, SD
July 1, 2, 3 // Yellowstone National Park, WY
July 4 // Spokane, WA
July 5, 6 // Seattle, WA
July 7, 8 // Portland, OR
July 9 // Northern California Coastline
July 10, 11 // Lake Tahoe, CA
July 12 // Sacramento, CA
July 13, 14 // San Francisco, CA
July 15 // Southern California Coastline
July 16, 17, 18 // Los Angeles, CA
July 19 // Flagstaff, AZ
July 20 // Aspen, CO
July 21 // Denver, CO
July 22 // Kansas City, MO
July 23, 24 // St. Louis, MO
July 25 // Memphis, TN
July 26, 27 // Birmingham, AL
July 28, 29, 30, August 1, 2, 3 // Nashville, TN
August 4, 5 // Atlanta, GA
August 6 // Athens, GA
August 7, 8 // Columbia, SC
August 9, 10 // Charlotte, NC
August 11, 12 // Raleigh, NC
August 13, 14, 15 // Virginia Beach, VA
August 16, 17, 18 // Richmond, VA
August 19, 20, 21 // Knoxville, TN
August 22, 23, 24 // Nashville, TN
August 25, 26, 27, 28 // Sterling, VA

story:
“Sometimes it's the very people who no-one imagines anything of, that do the things that no-one can imagine”. — Alan Turing

LAUSD has significantly cut music from schools!

Raising money to operate! Help us bring music enrichment programs to children and youth in South Los Angeles

Our Program:

1. Music/art enrichment programs Increasing graduation rate, secondary school rate and embracing self-expression through music and art

2. Educational support and scholarships program

3. Mentors for our students through empowerment, encouragement and hope

4. Decrease gang involvement and time spent in the street

5. Family support

Let Music Heal 

BENEFITS. Musicians have been reported to enhance neurophysiological functions through learning to read music and play instruments. Recent studies suggest musicianship is associated with cognitive benefits for listening and learning, which included auditory memory and attention, general intelligence, language processing and literacy skills. Therefore musical interventions increase the probability of instilling favorable behaviors in youth, which can then set them up for an increase in academic performance in and out of the classroom. 

What's Needed:

  • TRUST. Let's be real, asking for donations is difficult, especially from people you don't know and don't know you. Much of your donation is placed on faith and inherent trust that your money is going to where you think it is going, trust me, I get it. 
  • PARTNERSHIPS. We are also seeking partnerships to create a collective impact and working collaborations
  • ACTION. Your generous donations will go to bring music and dance classes to disadvantaged children and youth
  • GOAL. Our is to raise enough money to operate by bringing the power of music, song and dance to disadvantaged children and youth

We Need Your Help 

STEPS TO TAKE:

  • 1. Raise Funds
  • 2. Advertise, market, get our name out!!! Fight For Humanity is a registered 501 (c)(3) nonprofit
  • Building capacity
  • 3. Build relationships... WE WANT YOU!

Risks & Challenges

IS FAILING A RISK?

  • Sure, failing is always a risk when you are stepping out on faith and doing something alone, but someone who is so passionate about something, will always find a way.
  • BIGGEST CHALLENGE. Continued funds.
  • WON'T HAPPEN OVERNIGHT. No, nothing changes overnight, but with the support we will be able to move much quicker.

Other Ways You Can Help

GET INVOLVED:

  • A movement for humanity, equality and social justice cannot be a movement without your involvement. Join our forces, partner with us, send us resources etc. If you would like to get involved or have resources that would be beneficial to the cause, please email me.
  • Email: amylewis.humanity@yahoo.com
  • SHARE WITH EVERYONE
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Facebook  https://www.facebook.com/humanitlyequalityandsocialjustice?skip_nax_wizard=true&ref_type=bookmark 
  • Twitter https://twitter.com/Fight_4Humanity
  • Instagram https://instagram.com/fight_4humanity/

story:
Abendmusik - New York's Early Music String Band

                                        

Judson Griffin, baroque violin

                 Małgorzata Ziemnicka, baroque violin

                                       Lawrence Lipnik, viola da gamba

                                                           Carlene Stober, viola da gamba

                                                                            Patricia Ann Neely, viola da gamba


Abendmusik, New York’s Early Music String Band, showcases the rarely-performed repertoire composed during and after one of the most devastating periods in the Germanic region’s history, the 30 Years War (1618 – 1648).  The term “Abendmusik” refers to the free concert series established by the organist Franz Tunder in Lübeck churches in the 17th century and further cultivated by North German composer Dieterich Buxtehude in the early 18th century.  Abendmusik programs featured sacred and secular vocal and instrumental solo and chamber works.  The series became so popular, as a result of free admission and featured compositions, that it grew into a respectable cultural institution.  We explore the repertoire of countries that  influenced  German composers (Italy, the Hapsburg Empire of Austria and Spain, Poland, Holland, England, Denmark and France) as well as the regional styles of German composers associated with specific principalities through the period during and after the war. The end result is a fusion of styles and the ultimate establishment of a German national style we associate with J. S. Bach, Georg Philipp Telemann, George Friderich Handel and others.

The members of the ensemble individually enjoy distinguished careers in historically-informed academic and performance fields and have appeared with many high-profile early music ensembles including: The American Classical Orchestra, Aston Magna, Boston Camerata, The Boston Early Music Festival Orchestra, Consort Royal, Early Music New York, Glimmerglass Opera, Lionheart, New York City Opera, The New York Consort of Viols, New York Grande Bande, Parthenia, Rebel, Sequentia,The Smithsonian Chamber Orchestra and Viol Consort, The Smithson Quartet, Trinity Baroque, Washington Bach Consort, and many more.  Together the members of Abendmusik contribute their professional experience, talent and scholarship, to create and present programs that are informative, showcase virtuosity, sensitivity and creativity, and most importantly leave the audience wanting more.


Our campaign is simple:

·  We want to want to increase our outreach and touch the passions of so many more as we have been touched by the work we do with each other. 

·  We want to put a collective face on the ensemble with a portfolio of photographs taken by a professional photographer. 

·  We are embarking on a professional recording of the Fantasies of William White a Jacobean composer who flourished along side Orlando Gibbons, Alfonso Ferrabosco II, and Thomas Lupo, but whose works have not yet been recorded as a collection.

Please consider making a contribution to our fundraising campaign so that we can continue to inspire ourselves as artists and inspire our followers to join us on this journey.


Giving Levels:

Contributor, $25.00 - $99.00
Donor, $100.00 - $499.00
Sponsor, $500.00 - $999.00
Patron, $1,000.00 - 1,499.00
Benefactor, $1,500.00 and above

All Supporters receive:

Contributor = 2 free tickets
Donor, = up to 4 free tickets
Sponsor = up to 6 free tickets
Patron = up to 10 free tickets
Benefactor = up to 14 free tickets

We also welcome major gifts and underwriters for specific projects. 

Our specific needs include:

·  $2,000.00 for studio publicity photos

·  $1,200.00 for archival recordings of our concerts

·  $2,000.00 to produce a commercial recording of the Fantasies of William White

·  $800.00 for general operating expenses to coordinate all efforts, including a national and international touring initiative. 


Abendmusik is under the fiscal sponsorship of Gotham Early Music Scene, Inc., a 501©3 corporation.  All donations are tax deductible to the full extent of the law.

By visiting our website   www.abendmusik.net you will also get to know us individually and LEARN MORE ABOUT OUR PROGRAMS WE OFFER THIS SEASON. WE LOOK FORWARD TO SEEING YOU AT OUR NEXT CONCERT :

Italy and Iberia – A Blending of Styles

Friday, October 16, 2015 at 8:00 pm
St. Luke in the Fields
487 Hudson Street in Greenwich Village (at the intersection of Hudson Street and Grove Street)

"This concert is part of the NEW YORK EARLY MUSIC CELEBRATION 2015: El Nuevo Mundo, a Service Project of the EARLY MUSIC FOUNDATION
story_txt:
Abendmusik - New York's Early Music String Band

                                         
Judson Griffin, baroque violin

                 Małgorzata Ziemnicka, baroque
violin

                                       Lawrence Lipnik, viola da gamba

                                                           Carlene Stober, viola da gamba

                                                                            Patricia Ann Neely, viola da gamba
Abendmusik, New York’s Early Music String
Band, showcases the rarely-performed repertoire composed during and after one
of the most devastating periods in the Germanic region’s history, the 30 Years
War (1618 –
1648).  The term “Abendmusik” refers to the free concert series
established by the organist Franz Tunder in Lübeck churches in the 17th century
and further cultivated by North German composer Dieterich Buxtehude in the
early 18th century.  Abendmusik
programs featured sacred and secular
vocal and instrumental solo and chamber works. 
The series became so popular, as a result of free admission and featured
compositions, that it grew into a respectable cultural institution.  We explore the repertoire of countries
that  influenced  German composers (Italy, the Hapsburg Empire of
Austria and Spain, Poland, Holland, England, Denmark and France) as well as the
regional styles of German composers associated with specific principalities
through the period during and after the war. The end result is a fusion of
styles and the ultimate establishment of a German national style we
associate with J. S. Bach, Georg Philipp Telemann, George Friderich Handel and
others.
The members of the ensemble individually enjoy distinguished careers in historically-informed
academic and performance fields and have appeared with many high-profile early
music ensembles including: The American Classical Orchestra, Aston Magna, Boston
Camerata, The Boston Early Music Festival Orchestra, Consort Royal, Early Music
New York, Glimmerglass Opera, Lionheart, New York City Opera, The New York Consort
of Viols, New York Grande Bande, Parthenia, Rebel, Sequentia,The Smithsonian
Chamber Orchestra and Viol Consort, The Smithson Quartet, Trinity Baroque, Washington
Bach Consort, and many more.  Together the
members of Abendmusik contribute their professional
experience, talent and scholarship, to create and present programs that are
informative, showcase virtuosity, sensitivity and creativity, and most
importantly leave the audience wanting more. 



Our campaign is simple:
· 
We want to want to increase our outreach and touch
the passions of so many more as we have been touched by the work we do with
each other.  
· 
We want to put a collective face on the ensemble
with a portfolio of photographs taken by a professional photographer.  
· 
We are embarking on a professional recording of
the Fantasies of William White a Jacobean composer who flourished along side
Orlando Gibbons, Alfonso Ferrabosco II, and Thomas Lupo, but whose works have
not yet been recorded as a collection. 
Please consider making a contribution to our fundraising campaign so that we
can continue to inspire ourselves as artists and inspire our followers to join
us on this journey.


Giving Levels:
Contributor, $25.00 - $99.00
Donor, $100.00 - $499.00 
Sponsor, $500.00 - $999.00
Patron, $1,000.00 - 1,499.00
Benefactor, $1,500.00 and above
All Supporters receive:
Contributor = 2 free tickets
Donor, = up to 4 free tickets
Sponsor = up to 6 free tickets
Patron = up to 10 free tickets
Benefactor = up to 14 free tickets
We
also welcome major gifts and underwriters for specific projects.  
Our
specific needs include:
· 
$2,000.00 for studio publicity photos 
· 
$1,200.00 for archival recordings of our concerts
· 
$2,000.00 to produce a commercial recording of the Fantasies of William White 
· 
$800.00 for general operating expenses to coordinate all efforts, including a
national and international touring initiative.  

Abendmusik is
under the fiscal sponsorship of Gotham Early Music Scene, Inc., a 501©3
corporation.  All donations are tax deductible to the full extent of the
law.

By visiting our website   www.abendmusik.net you will also get to
know us individually and LEARN MORE ABOUT OUR PROGRAMS WE OFFER THIS SEASON.
WE LOOK FORWARD TO SEEING YOU AT OUR NEXT CONCERT :Italy and Iberia – A Blending of Styles
Friday, October 16, 2015 at 8:00 pm
St. Luke in the Fields

story:
Hi, Folks!

  For the past 3+ years, I have been dedicating most of my free time to writing or performing music. This journey has been one that I would love more anything to share with the world. Rather than describing where this journey has taken me and who I have met along the way, I would like to record a debut album where many of these stories have turned into songs. From moments of love, bitterness, commentary, and self-questioning, this collection of songs will not leave you unsatisfied. 

  In the past, I have come to moments like this where I purchase some low-quality home studio equipment to try and record myself. I have to say, I can tend to be stubborn and find myself thinking "I can do it all by myself". Well, these recordings have never lasted (nor did the equipment)  and brings me to this moment where I ask for ANY donations you can spare in order to make this dream finally come true. 

  All of the proceeds will go to booking studio time, album artwork, promotional photos, disc printing, and online distribution. I thank you for your time and support and hope I can reach this goal in order to get the ball rolling in a more professional manner!
