story:
Hazmatt

My name is Matt Allen and I front the band Hazmatt. I started the band while living in Lahaina, Maui, Hi and started it again with new members in Encinitas, San Diego when I moved back home. We've been playing for several years all over San Diego, Orange County, and even a little down in Mexico. In 2008 I rushed a quick debut EP just to get something out there to help us book shows. I've never really been stoked on that. I started this campaign because last year Hazmatt got in the studio again with some real material we are proud and passionate about but we were only able to finish one single out of the 6 song EP. The band and I fund the project with the majority being funded by myself. Last year my lady left my daughter and I and I have been a full-time single parent since then with no extra money to spare and this project stuck on indefinite hold. I play music because I love it, it makes me happy, and helps me feed my daughter and I. This new album is very important to us, as we all contributed to writing the songs and we think they are the best we've got to offer. We'd love to get them out there for better or for worse to share or work with our family and friends and hopefully help further our musical endeavor by helping us to book more gigs and tours and help me to possibly give my daughter a better life through the music I love to play. I created an IndieGoGo campaign last May and started out strong but due to a personal loss of a close friend I gave up on it and focused on other stuff more important at the time. I'm starting it again because the donations made last time got me back in the studio and fired up to work!!

Goal

I've aimed for the low end of what we need. We spent several grand just finishing a single off of this project last year so this is a very conservative number to start with. Here are the costs associated with finishing the EP:

  • Recording at LA Lounge Studios is $50 an hour. That's a bargain considering we get two for one in that our sound engineer also offers great production on the songs. We have drums and bass tracked on all songs, some guitar, and some vocals. We need to track guitar, percussion, keyboards, some horns, and vocal. Mixing and mastering each song is generally around $250 per song for the mix and master.
  • I will be offering perks of copies of the finished project and surf lessons for donors. 
  • Even if we don't reach our donation goal all money will be put in to the project and we won't stop until it's accomplished.

The Impact

We are so proud of this new album and the songs we've written together as a band. Everyone in the band is a family man with children and we love music, but we also depend on the extra income we get for playing gigs. Not only will this album be great for us to be able to release for friends and family in just an artistic sense of completing a project we love, it will also help increase the opportunity of us getting better exposure with a better recording. This new album can potentially help us receive more radio and media exposure as well as open more doors to bigger gigs and festivals and touring. We'd love to be able to travel and spread our music to a larger audience and also help feed our families doing what we love. This is the first time we've attempted a venture like this, as we have always done it on our own and I have personally funded almost all the band's recording and traveling on my own. I'm in a situation where I cannot do it on my own anymore and I don't want to give up. We've been getting great feedback from the only single released off the album so far which has already helped us get one tour and some small local radio play. We're ready to take it to the next level!

Risks & Challenges

The challenge will always be coming up with money to make it as good as it can be. There's no risk of not making it happen, just a risk of it taking awhile to do it on our own.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know everyone isn't in the position to give money but there are many other ways to lend support:

  • Spread the word and share our campaign with your friends and family that may be able to help.
  • Donate goods that we can add as perks to the campaign funders. 
  • Book us to play a show and we can put that money towards the project.
  • Pass us on to friends that may need a band for an event. We play reggae, rock, hip-hop, dub and much more so we can literally play to almost any crowd.

story:
Merci à tout ceux qui ont donné La Semaine Passé/Thanks to everyone who gave funds on the first week ! :





Vous pouvez regarder le blog de la première semaine ici  




(Français plus bas !)

HEY GUYS ! 

We've been working hard for so long without any help but right now it is impossible not to ask for it !

1.To make the tour happen in USA we needed to pay for our working Visa's and our Canadian and American Federation of Musicians memberships. ( 330$ Per member = 1000$ ) 

2.We need to get more merch ( T-Shirts, Download Cards , Cozies ) (700$) 

3.We found a bad ass Bass Amp that is perfect for the tour if we want to sound AWESOME ( 800$ ).

4. On our journey our tour van  aslo need some repairs , Breaks at the back are 90% used and we'll drive across the Rockies so we need to change them ! We Did , with money we dont have (750$) 

5. We also need to do some maintenance and get new tires. ( +-500$) 

6.Finally, in case of any emergencies or van problems it would be great to have spare money. 

7.We also need to pay monthly for the van  - 540$ for 3 the months.

8.Promotion + Music Videos ( 1200$)

Total $ Needed = 5 500$


We Also have a roadie who will be taking care of filming and documenting the tour to keep you updated. 

We Leave Montreal on Oct 6th , Toronto , Sault Ste Marie, Kenora , Winnipeg , Moose Jaw , Calgary , Beaumont , Edson , Prince George , Vancouver , Olympia , Pomona ( Los Angeles Shore ) , Tempe , Las Vegas ( !!! ) , Many Many other place are on the list  in centre and East Coast of USA !!

Thank you verry much for helping us out reaching our goals with our music and also in making it less harsh on the wallets !

FRANÇAIS :


SALUT TOUT LE MONDE!

Ça fait plusieurs années qu'on travail ensemble sans jamais avoir demandé d'aide au grand publique mais c'est maintenant impossible de ne pas en avoir alors on se lance!

1.Pour faire de cette tournée un succès nous devions payer pour nos permis de travail au USA ainsi que payer la Guilde des musiciens et musiciennes du Québec pour être admissible à traverser les douanes en tant que band sans se faire retourner de bord. Et ÇA , ça nous coûte chers! - 330$ Par Personne = 1000$

2.On a acheté une Van ( Ford Econoline 2004 F350 ) pour la tournée au printemps dernier et elle a besoin de maintenance .

3.Les freins sont à changer car ils sont usé à 90% et vus qu'on part dans les rocheuses  à la fin du mois , on paie avec de l'argent qu'on a pas et ça nous aiderait énormément de pouvoir couvrir ces dépenses indispensables ( 750$ )

4. Elle a aussi besoin nouveaux pneus et changements d'huile (+- 500$ )

5. On doit aussi faire des paiements mensuels de 3 mois , Oct,Nov,Dec ( 3x180$=540$ )

6. On a trouvé un ampli de Bass de la mort pour Ritch pour être certain que ca sonne comme une tonne de briques en tournée ( 800$ )

7.Pour la promotion de la tournée et les Vidéos ( 1200$)

8. On Doit faire faire des chandails , des cozies et d'autres cartes de téléchargement ! ( 700$ )

Total des finances : 5 500$


Nous aurons la chance d'avoir un Roadie qui va aussi filmer et documenter la tournée avec un blog qui sera mis à jour toute les semaines pour vous partager le plus de moments fous possibles !

On part de Montréal le 6 Octobre , on va jouer dans plusieurs villes dont Toronto , 
Sault Ste Marie, Kenora , Winnipeg , Moose Jaw , Calgary , Beaumont , Edson , Prince George , Vancouver , Olympia , Pomona ( Banlieu de LOS ANGELES!!! ) , Tempe , Las Vegas ( !!!! )  et plusieurs autres villes dans le centre et l'Est des USA!

Merci à vous tous qui nous aidez à moins rusher financièrement durant cette tournée qui sera complètement innoubliable !

story:
SVP suivre le lien suivant pour le texte en français :

http://www.zepherine.ca/financement-participatif.html

Short Summary

A Little About Me!

My name is Zepherine Poirier-Feraud, I am 17 and have been playing the harp, and singing, for 10 years. My journey in music started on a 1/8-sized violin when I was five. By age seven I discovered the harp and never looked back!

During the last four years I have participated in Royal Conservatory of Music examinations and the Kiwanis Music Festival in harp, choral and vocal performances. I have been lucky to receive both Gold and Silver recognition certificates and, in 2013, I received the Musical Arts Club Award Bursary.

I am starting my last year at Canterbury High School in the Vocal Arts program (unfortunately they don't offer a harp program). This past spring, I was accepted into the Young Artist Harp Seminar in Atlanta, Georgia (boot camp for harps!). This experience really helped me see that the harp is the instrument I was meant to play.

Why a crowd-sourcing campaign?

I have now decided to study the harp in university. That means I must purchase a full-sized orchestral harp. The instrument I currently play is actually a small harp with just 40 strings. An orchestral harp has 47 strings and a far larger sound board to produce a bigger, bolder and more magnificent voice. There aren’t many harp manufacturers in the world. One of the oldest and most respected is Lyon & Healy in the United States.

The model I have decided to purchase is a Style 30 Concert Grand ebony harp. It was selected in Chicago by one of my teachers, a renowned professional harpist, especially for me. The cost of the harp, when you add the harp cover, shipping, exchange and taxes, is $40,000.

My family has been very supportive, with their well timed bear hugs (Sacha, Noah and Kai!), long drives to lessons and concerts (Mom), perfectly timed chocolate treats (Dad) and above all, a belief in my love of creating music. With this fundraising campaign, I hope to raise funds to pay a portion of the total cost of the harp. In this way I can give back to my family.


What We Need & What You Get

Here's My Plan:

I want to raise $8,325 to go towards the purchase of the harp. This is less than 1/3 of the total cost. I plan to sell my old harp, which should raise an additional $12,000. With this amount, I should be able to cover half the total price of the harp. I plan to supplement this with $8,000 that I will make working with my new harp, such as performing at weddings and special events. The remaining $12, 000 will be paid for by my parents.

Don't Forget to Check-Out the Perks!

The best part about donating to my campaign is the Perks. I have a whole range of special opportunities for donors, such as a ticket to my first concert with THE new harp! Or maybe you always wanted to try and play the harp. I’ll be offering a limited number of short lessons so you can try it out for yourself. If you have an upcoming event I’ll be booking through the campaign (harps are ideal for weddings). If you only have $20 to spare you can get one of my new recordings (to hear me play and sing, you can check out my web-site).


The Impact

With a small donation you can make a big impact in the way I develop as a musician. This new harp will allow me to pursue my studies in university, learn repertoire that I cannot currently play on my smaller harp and allow me to expand my recordings.

My teacher best described why it is important to have a good instrument as a developing musician:

“In sports and many other fields, the quality of one's tools and equipment can have a major influence on the product. A musician faces a similar challenge in that, as he/she attains a greater level of proficiency, it becomes more and more important to have the right tool. For a harpist, the development of sound production, true strength and resonance without bodily tension, control over a wide dynamic spectrum, and varying tone colours, requires consistent practice on an instrument without limitations. Although the tool itself does not make the artist or the athlete great, dedicated training and practice using that tool can lead to greatness.”


Other Ways You Can Help

Anyone can help; even if you are on a budget! If you can't donate I would ask that you get the word out and let as many people as possible know about my campaign. If 100 people donate just 10$ I'll have gotten $1,000 closer to my goal!

You can also "like" my Facebook page and guide people to my website. Be sure to use the Indiegogo share tools!


Thank You!

Thank you to all who have read this far and to anyone considering helping me out.  I hope one day you can catch me at a concert or event and admire the beautiful instrument you helped me buy.

music. With this fundraising campaign, I hope to raise funds to pay a portion
of the total cost of the harp. In this way I can give back to my family.

What We Need & What You Get

Here's My Plan:



I want to raise $8,325 to go towards the purchase of
the harp. This is less than 1/3 of the total cost. I plan to sell my old harp,
which should raise an additional $12,000. With this amount, I should be able to
cover half the total price of the harp. I plan to supplement this with $8,000 that
I will make working with my new harp, such as performing at weddings and
special events. The remaining $12, 000 will be paid for by my parents.
Don't Forget to Check-Out the
Perks!
The best part about donating to my campaign is the Perks. I have a whole
range of special opportunities for donors, such as a ticket to my first concert
with THE new harp! Or maybe you always wanted to try and play the harp. I’ll be
offering a limited number of short lessons so you can try it out for yourself.
If you have an upcoming event I’ll be booking through the campaign (harps are
ideal for weddings). If you only have $20 to spare you can get one of my new
recordings (to hear me play and sing, you can check out my web-site).
The Impact

With a small donation you can make a big impact in the way I develop as
a musician. This new harp will allow me to pursue my studies in university,
learn repertoire that I cannot currently play on my smaller harp and allow me
to expand my recordings.
My teacher best described why it is important to have a good instrument
as a developing musician:
“In sports and many other fields, the quality of one's tools and
equipment can have a major influence on the product. A musician faces a similar
challenge in that, as he/she attains a greater level of proficiency, it becomes
more and more important to have the right tool. For a harpist, the development
of sound production, true strength and resonance without bodily tension,
control over a wide dynamic spectrum, and varying tone colours, requires
consistent practice on an instrument without limitations. Although the tool
itself does not make the artist or the athlete great, dedicated training and
practice using that tool can lead to greatness.”

Other Ways You Can Help

Anyone can help; even if you are on a budget! If you can't donate I
would ask that you get the word out and let as many people as possible know
about my campaign. If 100 people donate just 10$ I'll have gotten $1,000 closer
to my goal!
You can also "like" my Facebook page and guide people to my
website. Be sure to use the Indiegogo share tools!Thank You!
Thank you to all who have read this far and to anyone considering
helping me out.  I hope one day you can catch me at a concert or event and
admire the beautiful instrument you helped me buy.

story:
Once upon a time...

... or 1,5 years ago to be exact, four beautiful and talented ladies (two Swedish and two not so Swedish, but just as beautiful) decided to join their forces and take over the world... as a string quartet! Another boring classical string quartet, you would assume. NO! Not this time! Well, there is nothing wrong with classical music, in fact, classical music lifts your soul and makes you a better person (not sure about the better person part or even the soul lifting part, but you get the point, right?), but because we love other kinds of music as well (like pop and rock, not so much death metal, though), we started arranging pop songs and we are absolutely lovin' it (and we are sure, you will love it too)!

So, are we any good? Yes, we are (this is not the place to be shy, right?). We are educated in highly regarded colleges of music in Stockholm, Gothenburg, Berlin, Manchester and London (and for your information spent hours and hours of practice and self-doubt) and have performed in big TV shows such as Idol, X-factor, Skavlan, Allsång på Skansen etc. 

And before we move on, you are probably wondering what the heck ''Rosa kvartetten'' means. Well, the name is Swedish, which you probably figured out by now and it means ''The Pink Quartet''. Why pink? Because we love the color, simple as that! 

Somewhere over the rainbow...

...or at the end of the rainbow, (if to say it correctly) there is this treasure chest! WE NEED IT! We need some cash, folks, so in case you see a rainbow or even find a treasure chest which you would like to give away (probably not) - let us know! But since no one is probably believing in bedtime stories anymore (we still do though. ''hope dies last'' they say) or even if someone does, no one is interested in going for a treasure chest hunting, we have left no other choice, but to ask you to help us out here (I guess, crowdfunding is a modern rainbow chasing)!  So... will you?

Show me the meaning...

...of feeling lonely (or why we are here in the first place!). The goal and dream come true would be to film a music video of a song that we recorded earlier in the year. The song is not just any song! It's the one and only -Skyfall! Please, check out our arrangement here - https://soundcloud.com/rosa-kvartetten 

Different ways of supporting us 

We take everything - credit and cash, golden coins, silver rings, well, anything that's valuable! Jokes aside... We would be truly thankful if you could help us out by supporting us or sending us a prayer, which is still better than nothing! You could also share this on social media and tell your friends about us. Spread the word! WE NEED YOU!

Put your hands up in the air and make some noise, folks! Rosa kvartetten is here to stay!

story:
The plan - plain, simple and cliche: to live out my life-long dream of studying abroad in London, England.

What's in it for you: other than donating out of the kindness of your heart and being able to watch my dreams come true, upon donating, you have to opportunity to download three of my original songs recorded in the studio, a sneak peek of some new songs I'm working on and a download of my most recent cover, a batch of deliciously baked cookies, a post card sent from me to you from London, a photo session with me, and a private acoustic jam session from me.

story:
Thank You All for the Love you have Sent over the Last Few Weeks, We really Believe it Has Helped .

After having a serious Heart Attack on August 15th, SPIDA is now Strong Enough to Have bypass Surgery; it has been scheduled for Thursday 17th September .He will need time to recover from the surgey and be unable to work for sometime ,So we are asking His Friends And Fans who I know will be Missing his Wonderful songs to Please Donate what you can here, the Last thing SPIDA needs now is to be stressed about Money. In Exchange SPIDA has made a special List of Songs he feels Appropriate right now , You can download them from a specially set up bandcamp.com page,  listed below.

This fundraising initiative is being coordinated by Emer, Spida´s girlfriend and Diana, Spida´s longtime friend and fan. We just want to ensure that Spida can relax and take his time to recover from a double bypass surgery before having to perform again.
Without this financial backing that we are hoping that his friends, family and fans, old and new will provide, Spida will be under great pressure to return to performing before he´s has had time to recuperate.

So if you make a contribution towards Spida´s recovery you will receive FREE downloads of some of his original songs, so its a WIN-WIN situation for everyone.

Spida has been sharing his music with people around the world since he started on the folk circuit in the UK when he was 17 performing under his own name Martin Carter, lets get together to give him the support so that he can continue sharing his songs and light in the future.

TO SAY THANKS FOR YOUR CONTRIBUTIONS WE HAVE SET UP A SPECIAL BANDCAMP.COM PAGE WITH ORIGINAL SPIDA SONGS FOR FREE DOWNLOAD. CHECK IT OUT HERE AND FOLLOW THESE SIMPLE INSTRUCTIONS;
https://spida1.bandcamp.com/
   1)  JUST PRESS THE "BUY NOW" BUTTON ON THE SONG/S YOU WANT
   2)  PUT IN  "0" THE "NAME  IN THE PRICE" BOX
   3) THEN PRESS DOWNLOAD NOW AND SAVE !! DONE

Seven Original Songs for FREE DOWNLOAD,
https://spida1.bandcamp.com/track/any-time-you-call
https://spida1.bandcamp.com/track/crazy-situation
https://spida1.bandcamp.com/track/how-does-it-feel-down-there
https://spida1.bandcamp.com/track/easy-loving-you
https://spida1.bandcamp.com/track/lets-talk-about-it
https://spida1.bandcamp.com/track/lost-in-love
https://spida1.bandcamp.com/track/love-is-at-your-side

WE WILL BE ADDING MORE NEW SONGS AS THE CAMPAIGN CONTINUES SO KEEP CHECKING IN FOR NEW SONGS FOR FREE DOWNLOAD
Another two for download available from 16th Sept "Sing Me To Sleep"
https://spida1.bandcamp.com/track/sing-me-to-sleep
and the one and only "CHEESE ON TOAST"
https://spida1.bandcamp.com/track/cheese-on-toast
17th Sept - "I Am By Your Side"; a beautiful Love Song by Spida
https://spida1.bandcamp.com/track/i-am-by-your-side
18th Sept - A Funny Little Ditty with very Clever Lyrics "Who Gives A Shit Anyway"
https://spida1.bandcamp.com/track/who-gives-a-shit-anyway-2
20th Sept -"Money Men - Thats What Its All About My Friends"!
https://spida1.bandcamp.com/track/money-men


OR YOU CAN HELP BY BUYING HIS CD ONLINE OR MAKING A DONATION TO DOWNLOAD ONE OR MORE OF HIS SONGS ON THE SITES LISTED BELOW.
Spida´s album "Long Way To Go",
a collection of original songs, is available for sale on
http://www.cdbaby.com/cd/spida1
Or Spida´s instrumental album "Here to Infinity"  is available on
http://www.cdbaby.com/cd/spida2


MORE SONGS AVAILABLE ....
For videos or other songs on youtube go to
https://www.youtube.com/user/neosdreamtime

story:
Who are we? 

We are an indie rock band out of Chico, Ca. We have been together for over 3 years and in that time we have created 2 albums, gone on multiple tours as far out as Colorado and Texas and everywhere in-between, and have been recognized as Best Rock Act of 2015 for our music regionally. We are a passionate trio, drawing from many genres, including Soul, Blues, Americana, Lo-Fi Rock and old world styles like waltzes, tangos, and circus marches. The common thread throughout the music is that it's all a bit dark, romantic, tongue in cheek, with a focus on storytelling and eclectic composition. 

We are finally ready to release our third album into the world and we need your help to do it! Now that the hard part is done and the music is written, we need to RECORD it, PRODUCE it, and DISTRIBUTE it. It is important to us to release only the highest quality sound, using the best technology, so that you, the listener, get the best experience possible. One way we are doing this is to have all the tracks on this album mastered at the famous ABBEY ROAD recording studio. Also, it would be a dream come true to be able to offer this album on vinyl. PLEASE HELP MAKE OUR DREAMS COME TRUE!

Thank you for checking us out and showing your support. We love what we do, and hope you do too!

What We Need & What You Get

After doing extensive research and calculations, we have set our goal at $8324. This is the amount we will need to be able to make this album exactly how we envision it so that we can be satisfied with what we are releasing. With the money we can: 

  • Spend 50 hours in the studio for recording and mixing
  • Send all the tracks to Abbey Road for Mastering
  • Order 500 CDs and 200 LPs for Distribution
  • Fulfill perk packages offered
What do you get from supporting our project??
Take advantage of the amazing perks offered at every contribution level. It is important to us that we show you just how AWESOME YOU ARE for supporting our project - we can't do this without YOU. From postcards to bringing The LoLos to you, there is something for everyone. 

What happens if we don't reach our goal? 

We are CAN DO people and don't like to think this way!!

But seriously, even if we don't reach this goal, we will put all the money contributed towards the Spirits Rebellious album. It might just take a wee bit longer to get to your beautiful ears!! Also, we will fulfill all perks that have been claimed by generous contributors. 

The Impact

Just like fine wine and stinky cheese, we think we just get better over time and this album is sure to be even better than the last. So far, everything that we have done has been self-funded, including recording and distributing two albums as well as filming, and producing our first music video, Scoundrel. With your help, we will be able to give this upcoming album all the love and attention it deserves so it can take us even further and farther than we have been before (Texas). 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute money to your project, there are other ways to show your support. 

  • Show up to gigs & bring a friend or two
  • Tell a friend or two about us and our music and even this campaign
  • Invite a friend or two over to your house to listen to our music so they can become LoLo Lovers too! Then tell them about this campaign so they can show their support
  • Play our music loud and proud and perhaps make a friend or two as you converse of the sweet sounds coming from your boombox
  • Get on the ol' social media and like us on Facebook or send us a message, we would be happy to hear from you!
  • Send us happy thoughts, cuz you can never have too many!

Thank you again for checking us out and showing your support!

story:
We no longer have any obligations to record labels. We are on are own, and we love it. Now is the time to make the second full-length album. But we need your help.


IMPORTANT NOTES: 

Indiegogo does not have a feature for you to be able to add multiple perks in a single transaction. As such, if you'd like to claim multiple perks, please make a new contribution for each perk.


Merch sizes when it comes to hoodies & T-shirts - There is no way to tell us what size of the hoodie/t-shirt you need on the Indiegogo order page, so just go ahead and order the hoodie and we will contact you via email to get the size that you want.

Short Summary

We have decided to part ways with our old record label. And this is GREAT news. Now we can offer you our music (and other exciting things) without having a middle-man.

So far in our band's career we have released an album ('Sintrinity'), an EP ('The Nemesis EP') and a single ('Wicked'). And now it's time for us to make our most epic piece of music ever: 'INCONTROVERTIBLE'.

'Incontrovertible' have one big thing in common with our first, critically acclaimed album: The whole album will be a story from beginning to end. We have the broad picture of the story written and also have recorded the first song.

The main problem we are facing is that we need time & money to make this album happen. 'Sintrinity' took four years to write, record & release. Four. Years. And if we don't get any help from you guys, this album will suffer the same destiny. 

We love to make music and can't wait to share it with you. We have so many musical ideas we want you to hear, and a great story that will make the picture complete.

Crowdfunding is a way for supporters of a band to know exactly where their hard earned dollars are going. No middlemen, no commissions, no crap at all.


What We Need & What You Get

ALL of the fundings we get through this campaign will go back into making the album. As a thank-you for believing in our vision about the album, we will give you some unique perks that won't be available after this campaign. 

 We are set up for Flex Funding which means if we don't reach our goal, we are still getting the money that is raised. Regardless of how our campaign plays out, we will record this album. The biggest difference is gonna be at what time we will be ready to release it.  


The Effect

By taking part in this you are taking charge and helping to change how we make music. You are putting faith in us. And that is meaning the world to us. We. Won't Let. You. Down. If you have heard our previous work, you know that everything we do is from the heart. We never release a song if it doesn't give ourselves chills. It's actually true. If we don't get those feelings from our songs, how can we expect you to get them?

Don't take are word for it. Just listen to our previous work.

The money we raise will give us an oppurtunity to get even better sound quality, and also give us the amazing chance to totally dive into creating music together. You see, we got a bit of a problem. 'morph' consists of two members only, and we live quite far apart from each other. Because of expensive travelling costs, we can't see each other as much as we like to. With your help, we could actually meet and create music like never before.

Here's to making our best album yet.


Other Ways You Can Help

Every dollar is appreciated. But if you don't have the opportunity to spend a bit of money yourself – there are other ways you can help out. Spread the word! Tell your family and friends and let them know what's going on. We understand that not everyone will be able to be part of this campaign, but just let people know this is happening. It DOES mean a lot. By sharing this page on social networks and spreading the word, we will be able to reach places we never would have otherwise.

Every dollar is appreciated. But if you don't have the opportunity to spend a bit of money yourself – there are other ways you can help out. Spread the word! Tell your family and friends and let them know what's going on. We understand that not everyone will be able to be part of this campaign, but just let people know this is happening. It DOES mean a lot. By sharing this page on social networks and spreading the word, we will be able to reach places we never would have otherwise.

story:
My name is Christopher Anton.  I am the former lead vocalist of the popular synth-pop band,  Information Society (2006-2008). I recorded and released two CDs with them.  Since then I have been working on my own project, christopher ANTON, with my wife and bandmate Donna Jean.  To date we have released one full length album, two EPs and three singles as christopher ANTON.  My full album, entitled Destination: X, was released in a limited edition physical format on A Different Drum Records. 

Our new album, called Connected, is almost finished recording.  We need the funds from this campaign to master, manufacture and promote the album. We are also seeking your help for tour transportation so that we can get out across the States  as part of an outreach ministry to people.

Donna and I have had a revelation of purpose.  We are both ordained Christian Ministers and the christopher ANTON project has become a ministry tool for us.  We want to share our testimony of God's love and healing everywhere we go!

Donna Jean oversees our music entertainment business and record company, Mirror Piece Records. Our goal is to complete the album entitled Connected and press 2000 fully packaged retail-ready 8 Panel Digipacks in full color. This will be the first full scale pressing of christopher ANTON music in these numbers for distribution and sale on our own record label.  The album sales will also help provide funding for our ministry.

Our cost break down is:

-Mixing, mastering, replication and promotion (including print advertising and outreach) for Connected.
-Durable sound and stage equipment to tour with, such as speakers, mixers, cables, stands, etc.  This tour will be unlike anything we have ever attempted in the past.  We intend to go grass roots to many different stops across the country in both larger and smaller markets.

Additionally, we are needing funds to purchase or rent a tour bus so that we can be on the road this Summer,  We also will be bringing additional band members, our road manager, driver, instruments and production equipment.  That's a lot of equipment and people  on the road for the summer!  A large portion of funds will go to rental costs, fuel, and other necessities (people need to eat apparently). 

Music for us is not just a hobby, a job, it’s our calling, our passion, our mission field. Here is your chance to help make the album and the tour happen by partnering with us as we follow Christ. Please, support us however the Lord leads you.  All contributions are greatly appreciated, starting at just $1.  Now is the time to come together as one.  Please pray for us as we continue with the christopher ANTON outreach ministry.  We intend to be out on the road this summer playing christopher ANTON music live, and meeting as many people as we can with our experiences of hope and love through the power of God's Word. We have had nothing but love and support from our fans, friends and family in the past  so we are extremely excited to work so closely with you guys to make this project a success.  Make sure everyone you know is aware of our campaign. While we are on the road we will film amazing things that are happening in Christ and post them on our website to share with you! 

Peace and Love, thank you and God Bless!
-Christopher Anton

Please note that any perk of $2 or more automatically includes your name on a special backers page on the brand new christopher ANTON website.

story:
Take 90+ talented teenagers and ask them to share a message of hope through music and the arts, and magic happens. 

  • The message itself becomes part of the lives of those who share it.
  • The singers, instrumentalists, artists, dancers and actors realize they posses talents which can be used to benefit others.
  • Concerts are only part of what we do.  We also lead mini-arts camps with disadvantaged youth we visit while touring.  We give teddy-bears to children in hospitals, work in soup kitchens, do art projects in homeless shelters, visit homebound seniors and nursing homes.  We have even performed "flash-mob" concerts in subway cars, malls and government buildings.  

What We Need & What You Get

This year's tour is taking us into communities throughout New England, with a special concentration on the inner cities of Baltimore and Boston.  Our single largest expense with a group this size is lodging.  We need your help to have a place to stay while we work.

  • Lodging for two nights in Boston will cost us $10,500.  These are not "fancy" accommodations.  Housing 90+ people is an expensive thing to do. We are asking, through this Indiegogo campaign, for help in raising $7,500 of this total.
  • If we do not reach our entire goal, whatever is raised will be used to supplement what we hope to earn through other sources.  Everything you donate, less the platform fee, will benefit our efforts.
In exchange for your contribution, we are offering a wide variety of premiums with each donation.  A live CD or DVD recording of our homecoming concert, a copy of a tour journal compiled from comments of our youth as we travel, a t-shirt designed especially for this year's tour, and greeting cards designed by our visual arts group are all premiums being offered this year in appreciation of your support.

The Impact

Since 1996, Crossflame Youth Choir and Orchestra has successfully provided rich opportunities to combine the arts with community service in our local community and beyond.  Each summer, we travel away from the friendly confines of the world we know to places most of our members have never seen.  Our experiences help us to see the world differently; to personally share with others; to learn that in so many ways, we are interconnected with the world around us.  And of course, we learn that we CAN make a difference.

Risks & Challenges

Raising a significant portion of each year's touring costs is not easy.  But with your help, we can make it happen.  This is not our only fundraising campaign, but it is a very important one because it allows us to reach people who are not normally part of our immediate support group.  As our group has grown over the past few years (doubled in size since 2010), we rely more and more on our Indiegogo campaigns for support. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign!  Share with your friends, family and co-workers.
  • If you are a former Crossflame member, tell the world what your experience has meant in your own life.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
We are Few Dollars More, a Norwegian Classic Rock band. Currently we are planning our first full length album. Studio time is booked for July 2015, and plans have been made for press photography, music video, single release and touring.


What we're asking for is money for the studio time, mixing and mastering, which is the most expensive part of our upcoming ventures. 

Since our debut EP "Westcoast Lover" was released in May 2013, we've played concerts, gotten more used to the stage and evolved our sound. This time we want to go bigger and bolder than we have before, and for that to happen we are asking for your help!


What We Need 

Our estimated price from the studio - including studio time, mixing and mastering is €13000. Of this €10000 goes towards the studio and mixing, while the remaining €3000 covers the mastering. 

We are not asking for the full amount, but rather the help to be pushed in the right direction. Our target for this campaign is €2500. You may ask why we're not trying to get the full amount? Well, we're a relatively new band, still looking to build a genuine fan base. We are not expecting you to do the entire funding for us, but we are hoping to have a little help from our friends and fans. We're just being realistic here!


What You Get

To say thank you, we've worked out some perks for you.

Want to be the first to hear our new album? Help us, and get the digital download before everyone else. 

Want a signed poster on your wall? Help us, and get just that, our current poster signed and sent your way. 

Want to see what happens behind the scenes? At rehearsal, in studio, on tour? Help us, and get a photo book depicting our journey to the new album. 

Want a live show? Help us, and we'll come to your event and rock you. 

But wait! There's more! Check out the rest of our perks and see if anything tickles your fancy.


Any Kind Of Help Is Deeply Appreciated!

Of course, we understand that not everyone is able to contribute financially. Even spreading the word to your friends and family will help us greatly. Please share our campaign through social media, and help us spread the word if you think we deserve it. 

Anything you're able to contribute with, will be greatly appreciated!

story:
Hello! I am Fuzzy Soul Tiger and I believe this world needs more music about Love and Hope. When I was recently laid off from work, I began focusing more of my time and attention towards making a new album. In the midst of me writing songs, I began to see a common theme about love and hope emerging.  I've heard some of today's songs that's just bogged down with way too much negativity & exaggerated bragging so I take pride in wanting to put something out there that's more optimistic and originates from experiences I've been through that everyone can relate to.  You'd be surprised to see that a big bearded brotha can put his big heart in such a project.
Albums I used to release were work I did completely on my own. This time around, it's become more of a collaborative effort and I must admit, I like that very much. This led to my excitement of starting this new fundraiser and the naming of my music album, "You're the Best Thing in My Life". There will be between 10 to 14 songs on it ranging from Easy Listening, Pop, R&B and Dance Music for everyone to enjoy.  Some of my songs talk about missing someone you love who passed away, wishing for the world to change for the better, discovering the possibility of love to celebrating the one you're with. How's that sound to you, so far? I think some of everyone will enjoy what my album will offer.
Thanks to all of you, there will be a number of things I can accomplish upon successfully raising funds.  Instead of just releasing my work as a digital download, I would now be able to make my album available as a physical CD. I'll also be able to have my album professionally designed, purchase UPC code, copyright my work and purchase copies of my album to distribute.  If you've been on my weekly YouTube channel, "TheElectricMrPJ", you will see that I enjoy making music videos for my songs so this will be another way I will promote my songs.
In the event that I'm blessed to raise more than the intended goal, I will have the opportunity to pay for promotional work involved to get more ears to hear & more people to see my work. In addition, I'll be able to purchase more materials  & pay for postage to send out more "thank you" perks that I've set up (like copies of my published books, I'd like to send out posters, stickers & additional CD's I've done and more, etc.). I'm so fortunate to be working with talented friends of mine who will help me as music engineer and photographer (respectively).
Whatever you give is tremendously appreciated. If you are also able to help share my fundraiser throughout online (Facebook, Twitter, YouTube, etc.) I definetly appreciate it.

story:
Hey friends, War Drum is on our way to Europe (London/Portugal/Spain/Germany) in April 2015 and we could use a little help along the way! We've been invited to play a rad festival called Desertfest in Camden, London and want to finish up our new record by printing it on vinyl! 

    So this is our plan: 

Land in London in late April, play the festival from the 24th-26th, then get over to Germany and drive through until we reach Spain, playing a 10-15 show tour along the way. We have our dates booked, we have our new record being  made (including several tracks the one and only Robby Krieger of The Doors graced with his guitar as well as vocals from Jesika Von Rabbit), AND we have artwork for new merch (shirts/stickers) ready to go! 

Your contributions will help us make our vinyl, pay for fuel, tolls, lodging, and all of the other expenses that tours bring up as sweet little surprises! Our last tour in Europe was received really well and we want more than ANYTHING to get out there and do it again! 

We make music because it feels the best to us, but we also make it to have you enjoy it the same way. Our goal is to give you back the best art and live show you can see, and we'll HUGELY appreciate any help you'd like to give. See you in the States and Europe! 

MORE INCENTIVES AND DONATIONS TO COME!!! KEEP UP WITH THE PAGE TO SEE WHATS IN STORE!!

story:
Rock Station Lenna©

Rock Station Lenna© is an online music channel that focuses primarily on music from the 60s 70s & 80s. The station is usually operated daily from 11am until 11pm-midnight (AEST). Songs are selected from old hit lists and played on YouTube from where they are posted to the @LennaLeprena Twitter stream. The station has brought many old hits back to life for thousands around the world. It not only provides a nostalgic trip down memory lane, according to Lenna's feedback it results in many purchases of cd's and dvds of much of that music. Therefore Rock Station Lenna is helping many older groups and artists etc by boosting their sales. All Lenna is asking for is $5 or so from fellow music lovers to help her buy new equipment to run the station as it becomes necessary. She is quite happy to work 12hrs a day 7 days a week to keep the music rolling along.

Hi folks, my name is Mervyn George Pike, (George). I'm the agent for Rock Station Lenna© (RSL). I have been given the task of trying to raise funds for the purpose of renewing the equipment used to run the station. RSL currently attracts close to two million Tweet impressions and 37,000 profile visits every month, so it is very popular to say the least. It is therefore quite understandable that having a spare computer on hand is important in case of breakdown.

David Bowie is featured often on Rock Station Lenna©. Heroes  (click to play), is Lenna's favourite Bowie song.
Lenna started the rock station as a hobby to keep herself occupied. She was a flight attendant before a bad fall forced her into early retirement. Her right knee was so badly damaged that she was deemed permanently incapacitated. Lenna also has arthritis that cripples her and keeps her bedridden at times, especially during the winter months.
The rock station has been a revelation for her. Not only has she now found something quite easily done from home, but her love of music and passion for political discourse have finally been put to good use! She is becoming quite well known both here in Australia and overseas for her strong views, sharp sense of humour and wide musical tastes. 
The music station is operated purely as a service for Lenna's followers, not for profit. The artists whose songs are posted to Twitter are paid via the YouTube system. It will actually help lift revenue for a lot of those older artists who had hits from 1960 thru 1990. Many songs have made a comeback in the media since Lenna started the rock station. No credit is given to her for being the cause of that renewed interest but her rock station is undoubtedly the catalyst. Even Labor's Anthony Albanese has commented on her music choices. He's a fan of John Paul Jones of Led Zeppelin fame. Nobody's Fault played by JPJ on the lap steel guitar is Albo's fave song.
Most rock bands thru the years are played on Rock Station Lenna©

The mix of politics and songs from yesteryear makes for a pleasant change to how Twitter operates. Most feedback regarding the politics and music is very positive. Many listeners post links to Lenna's stream with other versions of the songs played and they often request Lenna post their own favourites as well..so it is a musical wonderland as well as a progressive political podium for many! Lenna also posts many articles from other media about politics, music and items of interest from around the globe. She has also been very successful in encouraging people to sign petitions and donate to good causes by posting links from Change etc onto the Rock Station Lenna© stream. People respond very positively to the beautiful images Lenna posts every day as well. All in all her Twitter stream is a very entertaining and enlightening platform for people to enjoy.

The Fab Four often feature on Rock Station Lenna. Lenna's Beatles fave is Hey Jude, (click to play).

Funds raised will be used to buy a new computer much more up to the task, as the current machine is 4 years old and is not expected to last much longer. Lenna also uses her laptop to run the station while bedridden or while away from home, she will also have to buy a new laptop for this purpose. Her current laptop is also 4 years old and getting very rough around the edges! US$5,000 (since revised down to $AU4,000) would be ample to replace both machines and to purchase any extra data plans required. That will also cover the crowdfunding and bank charges as well as meet Australian tax requirements. 

Lenna is thinking of expanding her data plan to 500GB but it will cost $60pm. She wants to keep running the station for 12 hours a day as it has proven very popular since she began the longer routine in May. Therefore if funding reaches that $4k mark it should be sufficient. 

Lots of Aussie legends like Billy Thorpe get a good run on Rock Station Lenna as well. Lenna's favourite Aussie song is The Real Thing (click to play), by Russell Morris.

All contributions will be gratefully accepted and you can be sure all funds will used solely for the operation of Rock Station Lenna©. Thank you in advance to all those who choose to help keep Rock Station Lenna© not just up and running but for also giving it a chance to be become a success in the future.

Rock Station Lenna Campaign Manager, Mervyn George Pike.

Most rock bands thru the years are played on Rock Station Lenna©

The mix of politics and songs from yesteryear makes for a pleasant change to how Twitter operates. Most feedback regarding the politics and music is very positive. Many listeners post links to Lenna's stream with other versions of the songs played and they often request Lenna post their own favourites as well..so it is a musical wonderland as well as a progressive political podium for many! Lenna also posts many articles from other media about politics, music and items of interest from around the globe. She has also been very successful in encouraging people to sign petitions and donate to good causes by posting links from Change etc onto the Rock Station Lenna© stream. People respond very positively to the beautiful images Lenna posts every day as well. All in all her Twitter stream is a very entertaining and enlightening platform for people to enjoy.


The Fab Four often feature on Rock Station Lenna. Lenna's Beatles fave is Hey Jude, (click to play).

Funds raised will be used to buy a new computer much more up to the task, as the current machine is 4 years old and is not expected to last much longer. Lenna also uses her laptop to run the station while bedridden or while away from home, she will also have to buy a new laptop for this purpose. Her current laptop is also 4 years old and getting very rough around the edges! US$5,000 (since revised down to $AU4,000) would be ample to replace both machines and to purchase any extra data plans required. That will also cover the crowdfunding and bank charges as well as meet Australian tax requirements. 
Lenna is thinking of expanding her data plan to 500GB but it will cost $60pm. She wants to keep running the station for 12 hours a day as it has proven very popular since she began the longer routine in May. Therefore if funding reaches that $4k mark it should be sufficient. 


Lots of Aussie legends like Billy Thorpe get a good run on Rock Station Lenna as well. Lenna's favourite Aussie song is The Real Thing (click to play), by Russell Morris.

All contributions will be gratefully accepted and you can be sure all funds will used solely for the operation of Rock Station Lenna©. Thank you in advance to all those who choose to help keep Rock Station Lenna© not just up and running but for also giving it a chance to be become a success in the future.
Rock Station Lenna Campaign Manager, Mervyn George Pike.

story:
welcome

... to the Kevin Moehringer Ballad Trio indiegogo campaign to support the completion our debut album. The band consists of drummer Nicholas Anderson, bassist Ari Folman-Cohen, and Kevin Moehringer on trombone.   For the last several years we have honed our sound playing shows at venues around New York City. I have been playing music with Nick and Ari in several different bands since I moved to New York 8 years ago, and we have a wonderful chemistry as colleagues and as friends. The music on this album has come together through playing shows and workshopping the material, and I think we have something really special that most everyone will enjoy.  The recordings we have so far are sounding incredible, I am so excited to share this music with everyone!  


what we need 

The recording process has multiple phases:  rehearsing, tracking, editing, mixing, mastering, artwork, pressing to vinyl, and so forth.  Right now we have just entered the mixing phase, We intend to spend many hours in the studio, making this album sound as good as we possibly can before sending it off to get mastered.  All of these phases cost money.  How much?  Low estimates for the production costs are:  $1,400 for rehearsing and tracking, $1,000 for mixing, $1,000 for mastering, $500 for artwork, $2,000 to print it, $1,500-$2,000 for publicity. The $8,000 I am asking for won't cover all of the costs of making this album, but it will cover most of them, and you get lots of great stuff for contributing to the campaign. I appreciate every cent you can donate, and if you can't donate that's fine too--Thank you for your support in all forms!

story:
"Grant has displayed fantastic growth over the past year. He is ready for the next level. His music deserves to be heard."

                                                                        ~ Jake McKim, A&R Consultant
                                                                            Birch Street Music, LLC
                                                                            www.birchstreetmusic.com

Why This Music?

There is so much negativity out there in the world, especially in music. I get it. Bad things happen. People get their hearts broken, lovers cheat, and people we love leave us. But even when those things happen; no, ESPECIALLY when those things happen, people need to know that there’s still hope, somehow, someway, there’s always hope that a brighter tomorrow is headed our way. The purpose of this CD is to bring a little positivity into the darkness of this world we live in.

Why This Project?

This is my sophomore album. In my first project, I was really just exploring who I was as an artist. That first CD was great. I learned a lot about the kind of music I like to write and sing, and the kind I don’t. This project is designed to showcase who Grant Harrison is as a musician and artist. The sound is uniquely my own, but I often say it’s a beautiful blend of the light-heartedness of Jack Johnson and the soulful depth of Maroon Five.

Why Now?

Recently I was interviewed by Jake McKim, Beyoncé’s A&R Consultant. Of the many artists he’s talked to, he selected me as one of his top artists to work with, but he gave me a long list of things I have to accomplish, including narrow and define my sound (which I have done) and write and produce a CD that is professionally produced by a top-notch studio.

Why You?

Many of you are the very people who encouraged me to go after a career in music. You recognized something in me that I didn’t even know was there. You purchased my first album and you came to my shows. You celebrated with me when I was selected to perform in a big showcase in Los Angeles, and you were the first to know when I was signed to a publishing and management deal with April Sound Entertainment Group who connected me with Reel Muzik Werks to write original songs for licencing to the television and the motion picture industry.

And you’re here now, encouraging me to continue on this crazy journey. To produce the five song CD that Jake McKim wants to help me get produced I need to raise $35,000. That money will cover:

·  Working with top songwriters in the industry

·  Recording each of the five songs

·  Paying musicians as needed

·  Laying tracks

·  Hiring a Producer for the project

·  Traveling to Nashville for recording sessions

·  Traveling to other areas in the country to talk with people in the industry

·  Working with Jake McKim

Why Me?

That’s a question I keep asking myself. I can’t believe this incredible opportunity is here in front of me, but I’m so grateful for it, and I promise to make the most of it with your help.

Check out all the cool prizes you get when you donate and then click that donate button and help me reach my goal! And in case I haven’t said it already, “Thank you so much for all you have done and are doing to help me.” #hopemeetsmusic

story:
Chorus of Westerly - Documentary (Filming)

We are very excited to announce an exciting (and long in demand) project: a documentary of the amazing story of The Chorus of Westerly. 

This campaign is an appeal to you for your support in making this project happen. Over the project campaign appeal, we are looking to raise $11,350 to help cover the costs of the actual "filming" of this documentary (for work we are doing right now and for filming work we are about to further engage in). We are hopeful to raise this amount over the next few weeks so we can continue to go forward with the project.

After this phase, and this campaign, there will still be two other phases to raise funds to raise for editing, final production, and promotion (approximately another $12K - phase 2), as well as orchestra licensing and royalties expenses (approximately another $10K - phase 3) prior to final public distribution.

Right now, though, we are asking for your help right now in allowing us to complete the most vital phase: filming!

Please keep reading our story to find out why this is so important!


Why? 

It is time for the story of the Chorus of Westerly to be told to the larger public.

Choral organizations in the U.S. are not rare. In fact, there are more than 42 million Americans singing in some type of chorus. However, the Chorus of Westerly is unique. Indeed, there may be no other American chorus like it.

The Chorus of Westerly - an organization of that presents music and educational programs of the highest artistic merit - is one of the only intergenerational choruses in the United States. In a small seaside town that sits no where near a major city, the Chorus offers the chance for children as young as 8 years old, alongside their adult counterparts, to sing the monuments of choral music: the Verdi Requiem, the Bach B Minor, the Brahms Requiem, Handel's Messiah. Beethoven, Mozart, Britten, Dvorak. The children and adults get to create this art with orchestras of the finest quality, sing in an acoustically perfect hall, and, once a year sing for more than 25,000 people in one huge, free concert. 

And this all happens in Westerly, Rhode Island.

A 21-year old founded the Chorus in 1959, with the dream of a chorus where adults and children could have a chance to sing the major works, as equals, at the highest level of artistic merit. He believed in educating children and adults through music as a way to better their lives. He guided it for a half century. He succeeded.

2500 singers, 1500 children passed through the program. And one of those children, a young man of exceptional talent, rose through the ranks to eventually become the founders' successor. This young man's life was changed because of the Chorus.

56 seasons. 615 performances. 1.6 million people in the audience. 90 major choral works performed. 14 American premieres. 4 international tours. 2 music directors.

The Chorus is music education and performance program that is incredibly special. And it is all found in Westerly.

The time has come for the incredible story of the Chorus of Westerly to be told to the larger public. We believe that the best way to do that is through film. In this current social media world, great quality media rises to the top. 

For the last several months, the Chorus has been filming rehearsals, activities, concerts, camp, and other events to later this year create a full hour-long documentary on the compelling story of this special organization. It is our hope, that, once completed, the project will be aired on PBS and other cable outlets. It is our belief that this a compelling story for national purposes as well. And, eventually, we hope to enter this film in local and national film festivals to bring greater awareness to this special organization.

Caswell Cooke, a former child singer in the Chorus of Westerly, will produce and direct. Chorus of Westerly directors Andrew Howell and Ryan Saunders will also serve as co-producers. Chris Walsh Productions will be filming the project. 
The project will include highlights from children's camp, the classical concerts, Christmas Pops, Twelfth Night, Summer Pops, rehearsals, as well as in depth interviews with key Chorus of Westerly singers and personnel, including Andrew Howell and George Kent.

story:
Nashville Or Bust

What is it? More importantly, why should you support it?

Nashville Or Bust is about more then one musician trying to raise money to pursue a singular dream. Yes it is also that but the dream in question has many facets and many of those I hope will benefit my fellow songwriters and performers. I am lucky to be a part of a very talented music and art community in Central Oregon. From writers to performers the roster of musical folks here in Bend, Oregon rivals that of much bigger cities. But as with most things in life, success in music has as much to do with opportunity and location as it does with talent and experience. While the internet has made location less of a factor it still has an effect on who gets heard, noticed and offered work on a larger scale. I have had a trip to Nashville in my mind for years.....maybe decades. But either my songwriting was not, in my opinion, at a level to be successful in a town filled with the best or the ever challenging factor for us musicians......money kept me from taking that leap. Now I am 47, I have a batch of songs I truly believe in and well to be honest I can hear the clock ticking on this career bucket list item. So I came up with a plan and that plan continues to grow.

Ok so money is still the biggest factor. I work teaching guitar and vocals and perform a lot. But to fund my family and other life stuff and plan this tour/venture/dream is impossible, hence this campaign. SO....not asking for a hand out....but truly a hand up  in financing this business venture.

I have a company called Miller Entertainment Media (M.E.M) that I hope to develop in to a publishing/talent/media company. I intend to use this Nashville Or Bust venture to launch this idea. Once I have spent the time needed in Nashville my goal is not only to launch my songwriting goals but to also be in a position of influence or association that will enable M.E.M to then sign on songwriters and performers from my musical community in order to promote and connect them to work in Nashville and in the over all entertainment field. From songwriting contracts to session work to career coaching and development M.E.M is my hope that I can make something big happen, not just for myself, but for all those other artists I know. The industry has changed a lot in the past decade and new, cutting edge methods are the way to find success now........I hope!!

I have spent 35 years working in music and media in some fashion. From performing, writing, session work and my time in radio I have collected a large amount of both connections in the field and experience for how it all works. I am now hoping to take all of that and make it mean something for me and many others. If you help fund the Nashville Or Bust campaign the money will go to facilitating marketing, recording and travel for a two month trip/tour to Nashville. I am currently booking a short tour of 6-10 stops between Bend and Nashville to make the travel easier, add funds to the cause and get me in top performing shape by the time I get there. Once in Nashville I will spend my time working getting my songs heard, selling others on my idea and opening as many doors as I can to succeed. I have several people who can and are willing to help along the way with introductions and performance opportunities while there.

If this all succeeds then I hope to be able to regularly submit mine and my friends songs for consideration to be recorded by other artists or licensed to other media, like films, tv, web etc. This will be a building process and won't happen over night. But I feel confident that with your support I can make this dream come true and through that start making other artists dreams come true as well.

So if you feel so inspired please contribute to the future of not just mine but many musicians futures. There are some perks listed here of cool stuff you can get in thanks for your support. From t-shirts and guitar picks to custom songs and even house concerts, there are many ways to support. So please check out all the info here, feel free to email me questions, ideas or comments to dmillerguitar@gmail.com and thanks for supporting Independent Music!
